title: Maine Lesbian Feminists
description: Box 125 Belfast, Maine. This is a new organization an dit represents a new concept in organizing. Here are the local chapters as of September 1976: Brunswick-Bath, Augusta, Bangor, Belfast, and Portland. And this is how they intend to operate: each group meets regularly for support, sharing, partying, political discussion and action. The entire statewide organization will meet every two months for all day meetings and partying. Committees will work together as needed.

They hold regular meetings and have lots of time for Drop In. They will soon be getting their own newsletter together.

description:
c/o Alaska Women's Resource Center, PO Box 188, 99510. Tel. 
(907) 278-9047. Open: Monday to Friday, 9-5pm, Their publ: 'Klondyke ke Kontact', bimonthly, Includes events calendar, local news, radio & TV. Requests input.

description: Tel. 276-0692. Home-cooked food and live folk music. Open for lunch and dinner.

title: Wimmin on Land
description: 'A collective of wimmin... to get life support systems going for wimmin who are coming out of mental prisons, who need a farm space to heal in, to rest, to work, to learn collective process. WoL welcomes serious visitors and wants to get together workshops on political direction, class, racism. : etc. Please write to us about who you are and enclose a stamped, self-addressed envelope."

title: Hy-Kamp Lounge
description: Tel. (501) 783-9494. Gay women and men. Closed Sundays. Recommended.

description: Main Street (across from the Trail-ways Bus Depot). Tel. (501) 371-9966.

title: Focus Phase II
description: 35204. Tel. (205) 254-8621. Open 7pm onwards. Disco dancing by Santana, 9pm till... Pool tables and game machines. Female impersonator shows: Friday, Saturday and Sunday by Lady Baronessa- Miss Gay America 1973, Show Director, Focus Phase II also sponsors a women's softball team. Very, very highly recommended.

title: Gizmo's
description: 35205. Tel. (205) 254-8816. Open: Mon-Friday 4:00pm onwards" Saturday 4pm-2am. Private Club licence applied for. It's MGM now, but if Gizmo's if does become a private club, they hope to see more gay women. Dancing, entertainment (Mr. & Miss Gay Alabama/Mr. & Miss Gay Birmingham contests), pool table pin ball and other games.

title: Rhinestone Circus/ J & B Yumm Yumm Tree
Ce Ray's Corral Club
description: Mailing: 856 East Patton; 366111. Tel. (205) 272-9810. "Montgomery's newest and largest gay club. Up to 500n people 50% gay women, 50% gay men. This place is totally gay." Game Room, Disco, Showbar. Tuesday is "Dyke Night" happy hour prices all night; Sunday's there's volleyball, bingo, pool tournaments, badminton. Hours are: Tues-Frid. 4pm till late. Sat. 8pm till late (show nite); Sundays 1 pm till... Owners: Celia E. Brown (State Coordinator- NOW) and tay Harper. Very, very highly recommended.

title: "Arizona Women's Yellow Pages"
description: 85257. $3.00 per year. Divided into three categories: 1) Women in Business; 2) Resources available to women; 3) Women's organizations. Very, very handy and highly recommended.

title: "The Directory"
description: Rox Publishing Co., PO Box 16054; 85011. Tel. 967-4131. "Distributed free to the gay community. "Includes bars, centers, business, etc., and a centerfold map. Very highly recommended.

title: Women's Center
description: 85004. Tel. 258-9227. Rap groups, legal services, workshops, free alcohol counseling.

title: Women's Line
description: Tel. 252-5152. Open 2pm-10pm seven days. Telephone counseling, crisis counseling, information and referrals.

title: Full Moon
description: Open: Mon-Fri. 10am-1am; Weekends noon-1am. Nitely disco plus live bands and gay community fund raisers. Very highly recommended. Opened in may 1978.

title: New Morning Cafe
description: (just north of Thomas) Tel. 279-6322. Open: Mon-Thurs. 11:30am-9:00pm; Fri & Sat. 11:30am-1:00pm. Natural food.

title: Roommate Finders
description: Suite 8111. Tel. 264-0809. "We maintain a gay roommate file".

title: Free Spirit
description: Tel. (602) 966-5090. Gay services at Arizona State University. Switchboard, coffeehouses, bar nites, newsletter. Helpline: 271-0125, Sat. & Sun. nites from 8pm to midnight.

title: "Arizona Gay News"
description: 85703. Tel. 623-5268. Weekly gay newspaper distributed free at gay establishments. (but it is happening?)

title: M.C.C.
description: 85726. Tel. (602) 748-8699. Regular meetings and social activities; temporary housing provided for women only.

title: Wicca Mountain
description: 94590. Tel. (707) 459-5776. "We offer 17 acres of secluded land where womyn can come and camp at $2.00 a night. This land is also available for womyn to rent for weekend retreats. During the summer we run a feminist camp for young womyn aged 7-14." Write to them for more information.

title: The Bacchanal
description: Tel. 527-1314. Open every day at 5pm. (21 plus I.D. essential). A bar for all women, feminist owned and operated. " We serve wine, beers, good coffee and teas, plus other non-alcoholic beverages and sandwiches. Each week we present women's music, poetry, film, theater, lectures and special happenings. We've got a small art gallery and a place for meetings. We play pool, ping-pong, and chess. We've also got a groovy dance floor. Our goal: to provide a hassle-free atmosphere for women come and have a good time with us." Recommended.

title: Mountain Sisters
description: Old Bank Mail, PO Box 426, 95222. Tel/ (209) 736-4801. Feminist goods store in the Sierra Nevada. Books, jewelry, unique t-shirts, ethnic clothing, etc. "Tiny But Terrific!" A group of forward-thinking women organizing in the the Sierra Nevadas.

title: "Plexus"
description: Room 209; 94704. Tel. (415) 841-2476. "Started in '74. News and reviews. bay Area's only women's newspaper. Events calendar, radio and TV selections. "Subscriptions: $5.00 per annum. A truly tremendous source of information for all lesbians in the Bay Area.

title: Labyris
description: 94510. Tel. (707) 745-5076. "Fine quality gold and silver, as well as pots of feminine grace in porcelain and stoneware. We also carry lesbian graphics and custom design is our speciality. Jewelry and crafts for women by women." Free catalog.

title: San Francisco and East Bay Women's Yellow Pages
description: c/o Berkeley Women's Center, 94704. Tel. (415) 548-4343. yellow Pages for women in the area to list organizations, skills, etc. -not all gay, but any gay services, etc., and gay consciousness. Very highly recommended reading.

title: Pacific Center For Human Growth
description: 94710. Tel. 841-6224, Switchboard 10am-10pm. Crisis and referral switchboard for housing, jobs, etc. Monthly newsletter, monthly women's calendar of events. Women's programs, including rap groups: Slightly Older Lesbians; Bisexuality; Open Lesbian; Working Class Women; Younger Lesbian. Also, Mental Health services, Educational services, social activities, pot-luck suppers.

title: Pacific Center Bay Area Gay Switchboard
University of California Gay People's Union
M.C.C of the East Bay
description: 94705 (Gay Community Center). Tel. (415) 549-1975. Office & Info: Mon-Wed. 3-8pm Sat. 12-4pm. Counseling available: personal and relationship, spirtual (counselors are lesbian women). Lesbian Rap Group: Mondays at 7:30pm. Worship Service: Sundays at 7:30pm.

title: The Brick Hut
description: Tel. 841-6853. Short order breakfast/lunch, Mon-Fri: 7:30am-2:00pm; Sat. & Sun: 8:30-3:00pm. Collectively-owned and operated.

title: Clements & Fisher
description: 94706. For special gifts- jewelry designed and made by Joyce Clements and Linda Fisher.

title: Womyn's Adventures
description: 94708. Tel. (415) 841-6500 ext. 197. Their trips include ... "Wmyn's adventure to Kauai", plus "Lay Back Tours" (Mexico in the sun), "Amazon Adventures" and "Stardust Trails".

title: Alice B's Bookservices
description: 94704. Tel. (415) 845-1308. Out-of-print lesbian books. New titles too. Send $1.00 for catalog with current calendar, listing about 1000 books and periodicals.

title: Moon Books
description: 94709. Tel. (415) 444-0465. "Moon Books is a women's publishing company committed to making a wide variety of fine women's writing and feminist literature available in the general market."

title: The Bacchanal
description: Albany. Tel. 527-1314. Although this is in Albany (see listing) it is your very best bet in the East Bay area.

title: Newport Station
description: 92627. Tel. (714) 631-0031. Good disco, dancing and restaurant. Gay women and men.

title: The New Ms. Fitz
description: 90230. Tel. 397-9377. Live entertainment every weekend. Pool tournaments, bowling league and baseball team. I.D. required. open 10am-2am. Woman owned. Very, very highly recommended.

title: The Marvelous Book Company
description: (one block north of Culver, next to the Big 5) Tel. 397-2771. Woman-owned. Specializing in women's literature.

title: Savoy

title: Acacia, Citrus and Arrow

description: 93740. Social and educational functions for campus-based gay women and men.

description: 93776. Tel. (209) 251-7476. "Serving the religious, social and service needs of the community." Gay women and men.

title: Wilde/Stein Democratic Club
description: c/o Fresno Human Rights Coalition; 93744 Tel. (209) 266-6067. Gay Democrats- Women and men.

title: The Circle
description: Tel. (209) 224-0440. Very highly recommended. Discos. Long happy hours.

title: Red Lantern
description: Tel. (209) 251-5898. Western, but friendly to women. Pool table.

title: The Community Center of Orange County
description: Suite 'H; 92643. Tel. (714) 534-3261, Hotline; (714) 534-3280 Business/referrals/information Women's Rap group: Monday's at 7:30pm; Mixed Rap groups: Wednesdays, Thursdays at 7:30pm; Sexual Compulsives Anonymous: Tuesdays at 7:30pm. Professionally supervised, short-term counseling; speakers bureau; news-letter; roommate referrals; library. All services provided free. Hotline- information and referral services.

title: The Happy Hour
description: Tel. 537-9079. Cocktail hour, dinner and dancing. Live bands and pool table.

title: The Mug
description: Tel. (714) 534-9943. Entertainment center, women's pool tournaments. The guys outnumber the girls but it's apparently quite OK.

title: Rumour Hazzit
description: Tel. (714) 534-9370. Pool table. Good disco music. Young crowd: more men than women.

title: Manzanita Kitchen
description: (between Murphys and Hathaway Pines, near Hanford Hill area). "Not feminist or lesbian per se, but owned and operated by two feminists who play Chris Williamson in the background. A very nice restaurant."

title: Armadillo Mountain
description: Tel. (209) 795-2296. Truly unique T'shirts, including Obnoxious Mountain Woman, Uppity City Woman, Clitspah. $6.00 each post-paid. Levis style mugs. Free brochure.

title: M.C.C.
description: Tel. (714) 752-1220 and 497-2142. Chapel: 1259 Victoria St (in Costa Mesa).

title: Main Street
description: 92651. Tel. (714) 494-0056. Open: Noon-2am, seven days a week. "Located in a resort community. Affluent clientele: artists through real estate people, many self-employed, ages: 25-60. A warm, friendly and casual atmosphere prevails. Also, more women attending regularly."

title: The Cottage Restaurant
description: 92651. Tel. (714) 494-3023. Open: 8am-3pm (Breakfast Lunch); 5pm-10pm (Dinner). " Just good home cooking-a landmark home that has watched the ever-changing Laguna surd for more than half a century. The building, which is an old-fashioned garden, was constructed in 1914."

title: Feminist Forge
description: Tel. (714) 494-7877. Feminist jewelry plus things like belts and buckles.

title: We're Inn!
description: Tahoe, Box 114, Tahoe Vista; 95732. Tel. (916) 546-2444. A gay resort with frontage and a beach on the lake and lake-front rooms. Highly recommended.

title: Fools Rush Inn
description: Hiway One (at Dimport Road); 95456. Tel. (707) 937-5339. "Rustic cabins by the sea... we offer accommodation in a beautiful setting at reasonable prices. We are gay-owned and operated, but our clientele are mixed- all are welcome."

title: Gay Service League of Long Beach
Que Sera Sera
description: 90813. Tel. 599-6170. Open: Monday-Friday: 6pm-2am; Saturday & Sunday: 2pm-2am. Woman-owned and 90% gay. "The atmosphere is very warm and friendly. The couches and fireplace lend themselves to the atmosphere. "Dancing, pool table, pin ball, regular entertainment. Very, very highly recommended.

title: Red Mill
description: Tel. 432-2019. Beer and wine. "Serving the gay community."

title: Roman IV Restaurant
description: 90802. Tel. (213) 437-3771. Open: 10am-2am, seven days a week. "Organ and Piano Bar: Wednesday to Sunday nites. Cocktails, dinners, daily luncheon and dinner specials. Sunday Brunch. Relaxed atmosphere. Entertainment: Thursday through Sunday." Very highly recommended. Popular with gay women.

title: "The Lesbian Tide" Tide Publications
description: 90034. Tel. (213) 839-7254. Subs: $6.00 per annum (U.S.A.); $10.00 institutions; $8.00 for Canada and overseas subscribers. An extremely sophisticated magazine, this bi-monthly is probably the most uncompromising and thoroughly lesbian publication of its kind in the world. "The 'Lesbian Tide' is a feminist lesbian publication, financially supported by the community it serves... we are produces by the pride and energy of a staff who are committed to one or more specific departments within the magazine. The staff is continually open to women who wish to become involved in journalism and communications or who see the media as a vehicle for activism.

title: Sojourner
description: (corner of 6th and Redondo). Tel. (213) 433-5384. "We sell books, gifts, and cards, by for and about women. We have free monthly workshops, a bulletin board with information about women's activities, resources. large selection of lesbian titles and we sell Gaia's Guide."

title: "Sister"
description: 90266. Tel. 994-6729 after 5pm; 450-4231 after 9:30pm; 393-7547 any time. Subs: $.50 per copy; $5.00 per annum. What a newspaper!!!! It's got everything and it's afraid of nothing. It's almost 7 years old and I find it essetial... much better than having had a sister ever could have been. Events calendar and announcements, numbers to know, services and businesses. All are listed.

title: "The Lesbian News"
description: 90230. Tel. 396-5135 or 474-1648. L.A.-oriented monthly in big newsletter form. Thoroughly lesbian high calibre journalism. It's great reading and it's often quite juicy (L.A. orientation). There's a regular list of telephone numbers you might need as well as lots of other local resources and information. $3.50 per year.

title: "LA Star"
description: (Suite 7), Beverly Hills;90211. Tel. (213) 653-6622. 'We are one of the country's largest sexual freedom papers. -since 1970. We're very happy about our large bi-sexual women."

title: The Woman's Building
description: Tel. (213) 221-6161. This is a phenomenon in the lesbian/feminist scene. " The Woman's Building is a public center for women's culture. We offer classes and workshops in the visual, environmental, language and kinetic arts, and we present public performances and shows of women's work in present public performances and shows of women's work in present public performances and shows of women's work in film, theater, visual arts, language arts, video, performance, dance and experimental forms. Women staff the Building and are responsible for 100% of its programs. Men form part of the audience for some public presentations (films, theater, etc.)... We are taking the power within ourselves and with each other to be active in the world, finding our creative sources, developing skills, hearing each other... pushing past previous limits. "Also now: Vals Restaurant at the Woman's Building.

title: Alcoholism Center for Women
description: 90006. Tel. (213) 381-7805. "Offer a supportive, sisterly environment for every woman who feels she has a drinking problem, and wishes to explore her alternatives. Counseling groups, recovery home, social activities, survival services. Coffeehouse nites, plus lesbian rap groups."

title: Gay Community Services Center Women's Resource Program
description: 90038. Tel. 464-7400 x 31, Switchboard 9.30am-10pm. "Our center is Human Services Center. We have numerous departments, such as educational outreach; employment; emergency housing, prison probation and parole; counseling; volunteers; women's resource; Ceta I; Hotline." Other activities include dances, social happenings.

title: Gipsy
description: Tel. (213) 652-1611. Entertainment nightly. Piano Bar. Lunch: 11am-4pm; Dinner: 6pm-11pm.

title: Cafe Metro
description: 90026. Tel. 484-2442. Dinner: 5pm-11pm Tuesday to Sunday. Vegetarian and non-vegetarian. Highly recommended.

title: Val's Restaurant
description: at the Woman's Building. Very highly recommended.

title: Dolly Dolphin's Grill
description: (corner of Westgate in West L.A.) Tel. 477-2277. "Seafood without Pier. Casual atmosphere, green plants and women's art."

title: Sisterhood Bookstore
description: 90024. Tel. (213) 477-7300 or 473-9090. Also located at: Woman's Building, 1727 N. Spring St; 90012. Both locations open seven days a week. "Complete selection of feminist and lesbian books, pamphlets, journals and record albums. Non-sexist children's books, books by and about women on health, history, literature, poetry, drama, law. Resources include local magazines, fliers advertising community events, bulletin board. We also sell posters, jewelry, T-shirts and Gaia's Guide."

title: Feminist Horizons
description: 90064. Tel. (213) 836-7822. Open: 11am-5pm Monday thru Saturday. "The largest and most complete feminist and lesbian gift store in the world. "Jewelry, T-shirts, vibrators, ceramics, leather, buttons, bumper stickers, posters, greeting cards, and they also sell Gaia's Guide. Mail order catalog: $.25

title: Womantours
description: 90042. Tel. 255-1115. Highly recommended. 80% gay women. Feminist educational tours for women, fun and pleasure tours for lesbians. Travel arrangements world-wide. "We make travel arrangements for anyone traveling to any part of the world."

title: Center Press
description: (a division of the Alcoholism Center for Women). Tel. 381-7805. Discount to feminist groups. Rates flexible; b/w and color. Business cards, publications. 29" press; typesetting. "Women teaching women."

title: The New Ms. Fitz
description: 90230. Tel. 397-9377. Live entertainment every weekend. Pool tournaments, bowling league and baseball team. I.D. required. Woman-owned. Open: 10am-2am. Very, very highly recommended.

title: Studio One
description: 'Backlot', W. Hollywood. Tel. 659-0471. Two shows: 10pm and midnite. Dining: 7:30pm-9:00pm. Call for reservations. Women only on Wednesday night. Theatre and restaurant plus disco.

title: Carriage Trade
description: Excellent food. More men than women but very, very highly recommended.

title: Dummy Up
description: Studio City (off the Alley-- one block west of Laurel Canyon). Open: Noon-2am every day. Dancing, pool table, softball team.

title: Big Horn
description: Tel. 980-9792. Still going strong. Dancing, pool table, pin ball.

title: 49'r Club
description: Tel. 980-9792. Tel. 761-4966. Open: Mon-Thurs: 10am-2am; Weekends: 24 hours. 'Warm and friendly atmosphere." Dancing, entertainment, pool table, pin ball, food. Recommended.

title: The Office
description: Tel. (213) 981-6942. Open: 11am-2am seven days a week. Dinner: 6pm-11pm. Entertainment in Dining Room 9:30pm in Disco Room (called 'The Campers')

title: The Canyon Room
description: (at Woodman, Sherman Oaks). Bar/restaurant. A real old-timer.

title: Califia, Inc.
description: 90266. Tel. 545-8717. Open: Tues-Sat. 11am-6pm. Sunday: 11am-4pm. Closed Mondays. "Books, periodicals, arts and crafts by women for women."

title: The Book Shop in Ocean Park
Womonspace
description: 90405. Tel. (213) 396-0054 or 399-9813. "Womonspace is a womon's center dedicated to the idea of providing a safe and nurturing atmosphere where womon can share skills, discuss political activities, hold cultural events, raise womon's consiousness, produce entertainment by and for womon and provide a safe place for feminist groups to meet. We are interested in reaching out to all womon who want to work on their own oppression and the oppressive forces in our society. Womon-space includes straight, bi-sexual and lesbian womon (80%). We involve womon from a variety of class backgrounds whilst focusing on outreach to working class womon. It is Womon-space's policy that "no womon is turned away for lack of funds." This appears on all fliers and literature. We try to provide childcare at all events. In our fall programming we hope to involve new womon and expand our outreach activities. Straight/bi/gay womon can work together. There is room for all feminist womon."

title: Seaworthy Women
description: Suite 254; 90403. Tel. (213) 397-7728. Seaworthy Womon is the only place on the West Coast providing sailing adventures for women by private charter. "We offer cruises from one to ten days to the Channel Islands on all-woman crewed 31' classic wood boat. We also offer sailing instruction at all levels. "Write to them for detailed information on their cruises and sailing classes.

title: The Church in Ocean Park
description: 90405. Tel. 399-1631. "Our space is available for events such as concerts, films, discussions, forums, meetings and theater."

title: The Feminist Shop
description: (Wicca) Tel. (213) 399-3919. Open: Mon. Thurs., Sat: Noon-6:30pm. Herbs, books, tarot reading, occult supplies. Mail order catalog: $.35.

title: Fools Rush Inn
description: Hiway One (at Dimport Road); Little River; 95456. Tel. (707) 937-5339. (see Little River listing).

title: Everywoman's
description: Tel. 328-3195 or 3295 (?). A women's coffeehouse, workshops, happenings, meeting place. Open: Tues-Sat. from 5pm. Very highly recommended.

title: The Bacchanal
description: Tel. 527-1314. Open every day at 5pm. (21 plus I.D. essential). Recommended. (See details under Albany.) Your bets bet in the East Bay Area.

title: Willow
description: 94558. Tel. (707) 944-8173. "Secluded retreats on 40 acres, 70 miles north of San Francisco in the mountains. Hot tub, sauna, swimming pool, tennis court. Available to groups and individuals. Various workshops offered."

title: I.C.I (Information Center Incorporate)
description: 94618. Tel. 547-9920. Lesbian books, magazines, periodicals and newspapers, also Gaia's Guide.

title: Gay Community Center of Orange County
description: Suite H, Garden Grove; 92643. Tel. (714) 534-3280 and 534-3261. Hotline: 534-5820, Alcohol Helpline. The Gay Women's Groups are extremely active. They are definitely the place in the 'Orange County' area try them even if you're not sure.

title: Whitehorse
description: Tel. 652-3820. Once again, straight, voyeuristic men and some lesbians it was the same in 1956 but then there was really no place else to go). Women's nites.

title: Aunt Hattie's
description: (at Date Palm), Cathedral City. Tel. 328-9074. Open seven nites: 7pm-2am. Tea dance on Sundays from 3pm.

title: Ulysses
description: 92262. Tel. (714) 325-2833. "Heated Olympian outdoor pool plus a huge 105 degree indoor mineral whirlpool, rock steams/sauna room, spacious grounds, garden-type room, apartments and cottages. We make group bookings for organizations and clubs as well as individuals. Gay women most welcome. We have gay women's group weekends and vacations. " Very Highly recommended.

title: Desert Knight Motel
description: Very, very highly recommended for gay women. Motel and bar.

title: The Hideaway
description: Rancho Mirage. Tel. (714) 346-4720. Friendly people, privacy, large pool, volleyball court, color t.v., shuffleboard. 50% gay women and very highly recommended.

title: GAF
description: 92262. Tel. (714) 328-9079. Open: 9pm-2am seven days a week. Disco dancing from 10pm. Sunday nite dance contest-cash prizes. Separate lounge and games room.

title: Gay People's Union at Stanford Women's Collective
description: 94305. Tel. (415) 497-1488. Hours: Mon-Fri: 1-5pm: Meeting: Tuesday at 8pm, at Old Firehouse, 2nd Floor, Stanford University. Legal and medical referrals; health clinic; emergency housing; local information. Raps; potlucks, dances. Speakers available. Publ: 'Lesbian Visions'," Lots of supportive, friendly gay sisters."

title: Small World
description: 94306. Tel. (415) 494-1556. Open: Monday-Friday 9am-5pm. "Gay-owned and operated. Specializing in gay resorts, tours, etc., and areas in the world where gay women and men are welcome. We maintain a network where fay men are welcome. We maintain a network where gay women and men are welcome. We maintain a network fro exchanging information with other gay travel agencies throughout the U.S. as well."

title: Daily Double
description: Tel. 499-9701. Open: Sat & Sun: 1pm-2am; Mon-Wed: 5pm-midnight/2am weekends. They are considering after hours on weekends only to select clientele. It will be membership oriented. Pool table, juke box, live entertainment, club-like atmosphere. "Groups to listen to and dance to : top 40, some C&W. We now have an all-women's pool team and soon we'll have a women's softball team." Very, very highly recommended.

title: Vermie's
description: 91107. Open: Mon-Thurs: 4pm-midnight; Fri & Sat. Noon-2am; Sun: Noon-midnight. Dancing, pool table. "Good atmosphere... local clientele." Very, very highly recommended.

title: The Tender Trap
description: Te. 622-9307. Open: Noon-2am. Is it just gay men?

title: Page One Books
description: 91101. Tel. (213) 792-9011. "We have a complete line of lesbian and feminist books. We sell Gaia's Guide." Open: Mon-Sat. 11am-5:30pm. Mail order catalogs: 50 cent (kids).

title: Juinetas
description: (3 miles from Crockett). Weekends are for gay women and men, Weekdays it's a straight tourists' scene.

title: Wayside Inn
description: 1 mile on Hiway 299. Dancing and pool table.

title: M.C.C.
description: 93509. Tel. (714) 682-7445. Services at: 5539 Mission Blvd. Rubidoux. Rap groups, counseling social activities.

title: Cruiser
description: 94063. Tel. (714) 682-7445. Services at 5539 Mission Blvd., Rubidoux. Rap groups, counseling social activities.

title: The Rusty Nail
description: 95436. Gay people's bar. Restaurant, dancing, pool. Recommended.

title: River Queen Women's Center
description: PO Box 173, Guernewood Park; 95446. Tel. 869-0333 message service for women to use between 10am and 6pm. "A non-profit organization. Library and bookstore, art shows, information, referrals, dances and special cultural events (lesbian orientation). Their publ: " River Queen Rag".

title: "River Queen Rag"
description: Mail: Box 173, Guernewood Park; 95446. Tel. 869-033. Breezy reading from the Russian River.

title: Fife's Resort
description: 95446. New resort for gay people here on the Russian River. Pool, hot tubs, restaurant, cabins, shops, and much, much more. Write to them for further details.

title: River Queen Women's Center
description: 95446. Tel. 869-0333. Feminist bookstore selling Gaia's Guide.

title: River View Lodge
description: Tel. 865-1372. Relaxing atmosphere. Probably mixed clientele.

title: The Cresent Moon
description: 95818. Tel. 442-9375. Open: Mon-Fri: 4pm-1:45am. Women-only club. "Very Nice, friendly gorgeous women bartenders. Dancing, entertaining, pool table, pin ball and other games and a baseball team. There is also a beer garden." Very highly recommended.

title: "Gibbous Rising"
description: Sacramento Women's Center, 1230 'H' Street (temporary). tel. 442-4657. Subs: $5.00 per year. Temporarily housed at the Sacramento Women's Center is the Sacramento-based feminist newspaper, Gibbous Rising. It reports on news of interest (social, educational, political) to Sacramento and events occurring in the community, events calendar.

title: N.O.W.
description: Sacramento Chapter, Box 1404; 95801. Tel. 443-3470. Switchboard, 24 hours. Monthly newsletter.

title: Sacramento Women's Center & Bookstore, Inc.
description: (between 12th and 13th on 'H'); 95814. Tel. (Bookstore and Info): 442-4657; (Rape Crisis): 447-RAPE, 24 hours. "Sacramento Women's Center is a non-profit organization consisting of a feminist bookstore, informational services (which provides Lesbian Rap the first Friday of each month; lesbian peer counseling and referrals), and a rape crisis service. Temporarily housed under the corporation is the feminist newspaper, 'Gibbous Rising'. Center open from 9am-5pm."

title: The Parking Lot
description: "The largest gay complex in the world; mixed bar-disco, two swimming pools and saunas, volleyball, barbeque pits, pool tables, pinball machines, plus, plus, plus..."

title: Camping Women
description: 95825. Tel. (916) 488-1297. "We provide feminist camping got women by women. We are a non-profit organization whose primary purpose is to offer persons an opportunity to participate in a feminist outdoor program and to experience our heritage of wilderness lands in order to develop our own unique potential. We provide trips and camping adventures in California and the Western States- with camps in the East planned for the near future. Membership provides monthly newsletter re: Women in Camping. (Please note: Programs are not listed as lesbian and are designed for all women regardless of their sexual orientation. One camp- Lifestyle Diversity- is designed for lesbians and non-lesbians specifically, but the rest are simply camping for women)."

title: Earhart's Cafe
description: (at 'S' Street). Tel. 442-2481. A highly recommended woman-owned restaurant but definitely not lesbian in orientation.

title: Linda Birner Design
description: 95818. tel. 456-5858. Logo design, brochures, business cards, photography, side presentations.

title: Women Together
description: write: Linda Birner, 1934 Sloat hiway; 95818. Tel. (916) 456-4848. Xmas Balls and Boat Trips, train rides and giant barbeques. Their 1979 plans include a trip to Hawaii.

title: M.C.C.
description: 92103. Church/Center: 1335 Fern St. Tel. 239-0714. "Many active gay women involved." Their publ: "The prodigal".

title: "The Longest Revolution"
description: 92101. Subs: $3.00 per year. news and views of progressive feminism. Lots for lesbians in this big, well-turned-out monthly. Also events calendar and classified ads.

title: Center for Women's Studies and Services (CWSS)
description: PO Box 350; 92101. Tel. (714) 233-8984. " We are a women's center, with radical feminism as out base-we have publications, storefront, counseling and educational/cultural components. Feminist Free University classes held year-round. A big event every Spring (April-May 31st)

title: Gay Center for Social Services
description: Tel. (714) 232-7528. Very active women's group. A complete range of services and activities. They even sell Gaia's Guide.

title: The Apartment
description: (on Mission Beach across from the Amusement Center). Tel. 488-9302. "Small, popular, active, woman-owned bar. Great juice box, bar, pool table, fireplace... an 'at-home' atmosphere. It's near the Boardwalk so you can rent roller skates and enjoy the ocean."

title: Diablo's
description: 92104. Tel. (714) 298-3269. Open: Noon-2am seven days a week. "Quite possibly the wildest, craziest bar in town." Great disco and dance floor, pool table, pin ball. (Near the House of Pies and not far from Balboa Beach).

title: West Coast Production Co.
description: Tel. 295-3724. Elegant. Dress is flashy and there are long lines to get in. new in '78. Recommended.

title: Nickelodeon
description: Tel. 284-9518. "Draft and bottled beers. fine wine, nickel juke box. "Open: 11am-2am. Recommended.

title: King Richard
description: (La Jolla). Tel. 454-6592. Lounge open: 10am-2am. Restaurant and pub.

title: Club Lombard
description: Tel. 231-2857. "Strictly for the young set, but you must be 17-plus to get in. Superb disco. Bar serves coke, 7-up and root beer. $3.00 cover on weekends." Recommended.

title: Kung Food
description: (near Balboa Park). Tel. 298-7302. Vegetarian cuisine... "in an atmosphere conducive to health, relaxation an enjoyment. "Open: 9am-9pm. Closes Monday at 3pm.

title: The Women's Store
description: Tel. 233-4194. "A very unique store: posters, postcards, music, books and records and a great selection of books-lesbian titles-a comfortable place to relax."

title: Las Hermanas
description: (The Sisters) 92104. Tel. 280-7510. Open: Fri. & Sat. 5-11pm; Sun. 10am-1am. "A collectively-operated non-profit organization created to provide a space for women's art and a place for women to be with women in a supportive atmosphere. We have been open for 3 years now and provide workshops, discussion space, weekend entertainment and political programs. We also serve special weekend dinners and Sunday brunches- besides regular tea/coffee/juice and munchie type menu." (Open weekdays when programs are scheduled). Private club but open to all women. "Very mellow." They sponsor monthly dances (at another location) and summer picnics.

title: The Book Mark
description: 92116. Tel. (714) 280-3091. Open: 10am-6pm Mon-Sat. Gay and feminist titles and Gaia's Guide.

title: Imperial Motel
description: Tel. 463-9245 for reservations. "A place where two people can feel comfortable asking for one bed."

title: Bay Times
description: 94102. Subs: $18.00 one year; $7.50 half-year. "A newspaper by lesbians and gay men." Too new to review.

title: S.F. East Bay Women's Yellow Pages
description: c/o Berkeley Women's Center, 94704. A really marvellous source of information.

title: Center for Women's Studies and Services
The Women's Store
description: Tel. 233-4194. "A very unique store: posters, postcards, music, books."

title: Gay Referral Switchboard
description: Tel. (415) 992-5255, 8am-midnight. P.O. Box 6046; 94101. "We are a telephone referral service for gay women and men in the Bay Area."

title: San Francisco Crusader
description: 94101. Tel. (415) 885-1001. Politically conservative and Christian oriented. Free.

title: Gay Events Tape
description: Tel. 771-9700, 24 hours (part of S.F. gay Action) Dept. Y 94109.

title: Daughters of Bilitis
description: (D.O.B.), No. 1114; 94109. Tel. 441-4545. Annual Women's Festival of the Arts. In the past we have had Margie Adam in concert and the feminist comedienne Ivy Bottini. "Their publs: 'The longest Revolution' a nationally distributed bi-monthly newspaper; 'Feminist Bulletin', also bi-monthly.

title: Gay Community Center
description: Tel. 469-2271. Golden Gate Gay Liberation House, Inc., 944 Market Street, Room 512; 94102. Tel. 543-1556. Open Mon-Fri: 9am-5pm. "We are a social service agency targeted at the gay community of San Francisco, the majority of our services are referrals to appropriate agencies or organizations who can best serve our clients' needs. We have a drug education program and an information resource program in operation." Medical and legal referrals, accommodation finding, emergency housing, prisoner services, It's now all gay men but they would welcome gay women.

title: The Gay Tourist and Visitor Information Center
description: at the Gay Community Center. Tel. 469-2271. Where to go; where to stay; what to do; what to see. Services include a hospitality lounge, sightseeing tours, liaisons with other cities. Spanish, French and Italian speaking referrals. For gay women and men.

title: San Francisco Women's Centers
description: 94103. Tel. 431-1180/6944. Open: Tues: Noon-7pm; Wed: Noon-5pm. Closed Mondays. "Women's Centers serves as a source of information, technical assistance and support for existing and emerging Bay Area's women's social-change groups." Monthly newsletter: $3.00 per year- includes a calendar of events of women. Drop-in room at Center contains bulletin boards of events, housing, jobs and educational opportunities. Membership fee (including the newsletter sub.) is $7.00 per year.

title: Full Moon Bookstore/Coffeehouse
description: 94114. Tel. 864-9274. Frequent happenings. Very, very highly recommended.

title: The Artemis Society
description: 94110. Tel. (415) 647-4144. Open: 11am-midnight, seven days a week. Women's cafe/coffeehouse- serving wide variety of sandwiches, salads, quiches, beer and wine, expresso. Entertainment. "Good atmosphere, good people, excellent food." Very, very highly recommended.

title: Peg's Place
description: (between 11th and 12th avenue). Tel. 668-5050. Open: 4pm-2am. "We've been told that we are the nicest gay women's bar in S.F. Cozy fireplace in front, disco in back." Dancing, pool table, other games. Very, very highly recommended.

title: Scott's
description: 94117. tel. (415) 864-9534. Open: Mon-Sun: Noon-2am. "We are friendly bar-women are made to feel at home and newcomers are especially welcome. " Dancing, entertainment, pool table, pin ball and other games. Munchies served. Very, very highly recommended.

title: Maud's
description: 94117. Tel. 731-6119. Open: Noon-2am, seven days a week. "We respect individual attitudes and opinions as long as the do not deny the same rights to others. We are friendly, open and interesting." Dancing entertainment, pool table and other games such as ping-pong. There is also a sunny back yard for summer drinking. No food is served.

title: The Mocambo
description: Tel. (415) 776-2133. Hours: 5pm-2am. "The Mocambo is a place of entertainment. We welcome all women and men." Restaurant opened July '78.

title: A Little More
description: One of the most highly recommended women's dance bars in the world.

title: The Neon Chicken
description: Tel. 863-0484. Dinners every night. Sunday Champagne Brunch.

title: Chez Jaques
description: (at Hyde). Tel (415) 775-7574. Cabaret Club opens 5pm-2am. Dinners served Tuesday thru Saturday. Very highly recommended showbar.

title: Original Jackson's Restaurant
description: 94133. Tel. 397-9797. Open: 11am-2am. Lunch: 11am-2:30pm; Bar: 6pm-11pm; Brunch: Sat & Sun & Holidays; 11am-3pm. "Everybody is welcome-come and join us in this unique section of S.F. We've got one of the city's finest restaurants. We do promise to serve courteously and at a price to suit your checkbook! Moderately priced at: 4-course dinners from $4.95. Piano Bar at weekends."

title: P.S.
description: Tel. 441-7798. Open: 11am-2am. Continental cuisine, dinner and lunch. Entertainment. Very highly recommended.

title: Casa de Cristal
description: Tel. (415) 441-7838. Open: 5:30pm-1am. Great Mexican food. Very highly recommended.

title: Old Wives Tales
description: Tel. 552-1015. Open: Mon-Fri: Noon-7pm; Thur: Noon-9pm; Sat: Noon-6pm. Women's visions and books.

title: Church Street Station
description: Tel. 861-1266. 24-hour coffee shop. Dinners from 11am-11pm. Pinball machine. All gay and highly recommended.

title: Avatar
description: Single copy: 25 cents subscription by membership to Gay Task Force; Membership Fee: $20.00. Serious, politically oriented bi-monthly. Non-sexist and with some local news.

title: The Remedy Lounge
description: at Irwin St. Apparently mixed clientele. New in June, '78.

title: The Other Side
description: 94902. Tel. (415) 549-2417. An all-lesbian social organization. "A way to let your hair down." Newsletter: $5.00 to non-members, or included in your $13.00 membership, or $22.00 for a couple. Parties, rap sessions, pot lucks, cookouts, camping, hiking weekends. All gay women. Very highly recommended.
Tel (415) 549-2417 for details of a bar to have opened in summer of '78 (too late for this edition).
notes: No business name or address listed

title: Everywoman's
description: 94901. Tel. (415) 456-3495. Books, posters, art gallery, jewelry, records, and much, much more.

title: The Old Bell
description: Bar and restaurant. "Nice and pleasant with a pool table upstairs."

title: Tinker's Damn
description: Disco, pool table. probably just gay men.

title: Heavy Traffic
description: 92703. Tel. (714) 558-9778. "Heavy Traffic is about the ultimate in a mixed bar, with a clientele of men, women, straights and gays, all sharing one common bond, that of wanting to enjoy life to the fullest together. "Open: Noon-2am daily. Dancing, pool table, pin ball and other games.

title: Gay and Lesbian Alliance (GALA)
description: Redwood Bldg., University of California; 95064. Tel. (708) 429-2468 or 426-LIFE, Switchboard 8pm-midnight Mon-Sat; 4pm-midnight Sun. "Gay lending library of books by and about lesbians and gay men plus some feminist materials-includes fiction, non-fiction, poetry, periodicals, student papers. Open to everyone-community people and students."

title: The Odyssey
description: 93101. Tel. (805) 965-4410. Open: 5pm-2am. "80-90% gay women. Warm friendly atmosphere. Disco/live D.J. Friday and Saturday nights, 10pm-2am." Pool table and other games. Very highly recommended.

title: Dragon Moon
description: Tel. (408) 423-9808. "Large dance floor with a large number of gay people."

title: Mother Right Feminist Books
description: 95060. Tel (415) 426-1317. "We are a collective of five women, aged 22-32, coming from diverse backgrounds, learning and sharing the skills of running a business politically. We carry books by, for and about women, along with an excellent selection of women's music, periodicals and crafts. We hope to function as a literary and cultural center. If you're new in town or passing through and want to know what local lesbians are doing, call or drop by."

title: Sonoma County lesbian & Gay Alliance News
description: 95402. Free, but donations always most welcome. News from everywhere. Very non-sexist orientation.

title: Runes
description: 95402. "Feminist newspaper- Sonoma County Feminist News Journal- published collectively. Monthly. Political theory and analyses, calendar of events, photography, poetry and fiction. Input wanted! Personal experience, events, news, etc. The mood is mystical."

title: Moonrise Cafe
description: 95401. Tel. (707) 526-4207. "We are a collectively-run women's coffeehouse community center. We serve good, wholesome food and feature live women's music. "Relax and be with friends."

title: Rising Woman Books
description: 95401. Tel. (707) 545-6590. Open: Mon-Fri: Noon-6pm; Sat: 10am-5pm. "We are an informal community resource center for women-we have a bulletin board, housing board and lending library-carrying feminist books, non-sexist children's literature and feminist gift items." 75% women and 75% of those are gay."

title: Runes
description: 95402. Subs: $3.00-$6.00 per year sliding scale. News, features, theory, poetry.

title: Mother Lode Women's Crisis Center
description: Tel. (209) 532-4707. "There are now quite a few lesbians in this area and a lesbian in need of help in a crisis situation could contact some of them through this organization."

title: Gay Community of Concern
description: G.P.U.; 94305. Tel. (415) 497-1488. They publish: 'Ending Discrimination Against Lesbian and Gay Men' which contains copies of ordinances, letters and others statements in support of Gay Civil Rights. Social hours; rap groups; peer counseling; programs; parties.

title: M.C.C.
description: 95205. Tel. 463-0478. Services: Sunday at 11am and 8pm; Wednesday at 8pm. Activities throughout the week, call for details.

title: The Hub
description: Tel. 938-4550. Hostile ownership vs. persistent women customers!!

title: Big Mama Rag.
description: 80206. Tel. (303) 322-2010. $8.00 per year, USA and Canada. A fine and tenacious feminist monthly. Third-world orientation. Lesbian news and info. "Big Mama Tag is a national feminist news journal which has been publishing for the past six years. It is dedicated to representing a feminist point of view and providing a forum for women to develop their theories and practices of feminism."

title: Lilith
description: 80302. Tel. 443-9467. Lesbian/feminist selections. Poetry readings the first and third Sundays of each month. "We sell Gaia's Guide."

title: Little Professor Book Center
description: Tel. 443-3390. Lots of lesbian and feminist titles.

title: Woman to Woman Feminist Center
description: Tel. 320-5972. Open: Tues-Sat 10am-8pm. Center, referral service and the Woman to Woman Library. Highly recommended for those who are new to Denver.

title: The Velvet Hammer
description: Open: Tues-Fri. 5pm-2am; Sat. 4pm-2am; Sun. 4pm-midnight. Dancing, pool table, women's groups, spaghetti nites. "Group meetings welcome." Very highly recommended.

title: Three Sisters
description: Open: Mon-Sat. 4pm-2am; Sun. 4pm-midnight. "Owned and operated by women for women."

title: The Broadway
description: Tel. 861-0478. MGM but many women do go there. Disco dancing and live entertainment.

title: The Clover
description: Tel. 922-9024. 60% gay men, 35% gay women and 5% straight. Country and western atmosphere.

title: The Apartment
description: open: 8 pm-midnight and Tuesday nite is drag night. Disco. Very popular with 50% gay women. Recommended.

title: Pearl Street
description: between 13th & 14th on Pearl. Open: Mon-Sat. till 2am (after hours till 4am); Sun. till 2am. Disco music, restaurant at the back. 30% gay women. "Hasn't picked up yet, nice place to go through." Recommended.

title: Cafe Nepenthes
description: Tel. 534-5423. Lunches, expresso, entertainment and late nite activity.

title: Woman to Woman
description: 80206. Tel. 320-5972. Feminist bookstore and information center. (See Center listing.)

title: Satisfy
description: 80218. Tel. (303) 832-3832. Open: Mon-Sat. 10am-6pm. Lots of lesbian titles. Woman-owned.

title: Black Rock Inn
description: Black Rock (western part of Bridgeport). Bar/Restaurant.

title: Bloodroot Ltd.
description: Black Rock; 06605. Tel. (203)576-9168. Open: Wednesday nights- women only and we operate then as a private club; Open to public: Tues, Thurs, Fri & Sat. 11:30am-2:30pm (lunch); Thurs, Fri & Sat. 6-11pm (dinner); Sun. 11am-2:30pm (brunch). "We are a lesbian-owned and operated vegetarian restaurant, feminist bookstore. Only feminist women's music, mostly lesbian, played. Wine and beer served."

title: M.C.C./Womanspace
description: Tel. (203) 52205575. Activities include a lesbian coffeehouse and workshop every Sunday.

title: Women's Center
description: Tel. 527-6724. Newsletter and women's events calendar.

title: Y.W.C.A.
description: lots of lesbian activity-local reports please!!!

title: Warehouse
description: Disco dancing. 25% gay women with some straight clientele. "They are community minded. House the offices of the gay newspaper 'Nightshift'." There are conflicting reports, so proceed with caution.

title: Banana Disco
description: (off Ct.-91). A few gay women fo regularly attend.

title: New Haven's Women's Liberation Center
description: 06510. Tel. (203) 436-0645. The Center is open: Mon, Wed, Fri. 10am-5pm; Tues & Thurs. 10am-7pm; Sat. 11am-3pm. Information and referral service. Lesbian sub-groups. Various social and political activities. Contract them for their brochure.

title: The Place
description: "Decadence a la Aubrey Beardsley". The later, the gayer it is.

title: La Machinetta
description: Tel. (203) 776-8560. Around the corner from Partners. late, mixed group.

title: The Answer Cafe
description: 06776. Tel. 354-7901. Open: Mon-Thurs. 11am-1am; Fri & Sat. 11am-2am; Sun. 4pm-11pm. Dancing, pool table. Hamburgers and cheeseburgers served. They've got a friendly neighborhood atmosphere. "Lots of fun." Recommended-especially weekends.

title: The Club Cafe
description: Tel. 755-7236. Open: Mon-Thurs. 2pm-2am; Fri & Sat. 2pm-3am; Sun. 6pm-midnight. Dancing, entertainment, pin ball, special events.

title: Off Our Backs
description: (Newsjournal) (OOB), N.W.; 20009. Subscription rates: (one year)-contributing subs $12 or more; individual $6; businesses and institutions $20; Canada $7; foreign $13. "We are an independent, radical, women's lives. Also, reviews (books, movies, records, concerts) poetry (not each issue), photos, chicken lady." A real old-timer among the feminist newspaper. Includes an extremely comprehensive international and national news section. Somewhat third-world oriented with lots of lesbian news and info.

title: The Blade
description: (newspaper), c/o Blade Communications, Inc., 2430 NW Pennsylvania Ave, Suite 209; 20037. Tel. (202) 785-3009. Subscription: $7.50 per year 1st class, $5.00 3rd class. Weekly. Reporting local and national gay news, including " Nightlife Guide to Gay D.C.' which comes complete with a map, key code and includes bars/restaurants, plus information. Female attendance and participation clearly indicated. There is also a gay attendance and participation clearly indicated. There is also a gay directory for Washington and Baltimore and an events calendar- all with a totally non-sexist approach. Media coverage. They have been quite helpful to Gaia's Guide.

title: D.C. Gay Switchboard
description: Tel. 638-4611, for help, information, and assistance, 7 days a week, 7:30 pm-11L00pm. Peer counseling.

title: Washington Area Women's Center, Inc.
description:
Basement of Summer School, 17th and M Street, N.W; 20036. Tel. (202) 347-5078. The Women's Center will be offering a series of "coffeehouse" type events every three weeks. Women are invited to perform or listen to community women read poetry, jam, play, sing, act whatever! Call the Center for Further info. 
-The Center also has: Women's Center Softball team- meeting and practicing Sunday afternoons at 1 pm. 
- Women's Motorcycle Club- this is not a Center activity, but get info. from them for a chance to ride with other women on weekends and possibly camping trips. 
-Teenage Rap Group- the rap group for teenage women will meet at the Women's Center. For more info. call Nan Fray, 652-7260. 
-Women's Weekly Rap Group-topics include sexuality/lesbianism. 
-Newsletter, "In Our Own Write" -pertinent feminist and feature articles, services and events of both traditional and non-traditional interest to women. There are tips on jobs and an emergency housing file which asks detailed questions of those who have available space and those who are looking. Health and legal issues are frequently handled at the Center, and the non-traditional activities include study groups on feminist socialism and matriarchy.
-Lesbian/Feminist Library for members.

title: Washington Women's Arts Center
description: 20009. Tel. (202) 332-2121. Gallery, literary program, slide registry, workshops program, library and a monthly newsletter. Activity center. Annual membership: $15.00.

title: The Round-Up
description: S.E. (across street from Phase 1). A women's western bar. Opens: 7pm. Pool table, limited bar. Recommended. Western style-all women.

title: Club Madame
description: S.E. (at "E" Street). Tel. 546-1525. Showtimes. Men are sometimes allowed in.

title: Phase One
description: S.E. Tel. 544-6831. Dance bar. Women only.

title: Mr P's
description: N.W. Tel. 293-1064. Saturday Munch and Sunday Brunch, noon-4pm. "Gay women are welcome".

title: The Pier
description: S.W. Tel. (202) 488-1205. There are five bars in the disco and good food is served. Some straights too.

title: Owl & Tortoise
description: N.W. Tel 293-4827. Open: 5pm-11pm Dress regulation- i.e. 'no jeans'.

title: Passport to Leisure of Georgetown Travel Service
description: 20007. Tel. (202) 965-0880. Open: Mon-Sat. 10am-6pm; Thurs. 10am-9pm. "Serving the gay community." For gay men and gay women.

title: Lammas Women's Store
description: S.E. Tel. (202) 546-7292. "We sell Gaia' Guide and lots of other things for lesbians."

title: Lambda Rising
description: Tel (202) 462-6969. Open: Mon-Fri. noon-8pm; Sat. noon -7pm; Sun. 1pm-6pm. Now in its fifth year. Huge selection of gay and lesbian books and magazines, including Gaia's Guide. Lambda Rising also provides meeting space, speakers service, conference displays, bulletin board and literature table, audio-visual materials and book sales, ticket sales and mailings.

title: Bread and Roses
description: N.W. Tel. 387-6264. Lesbian music. Feminist music. Gay Music. Women's music.

title: Nomad Village and "The Other Room" Bar
The Boat House
description: (Bellevue on the Bay). Lunch, dinner. Disco every night- two bars, two dance floors. Tel. (302) 227-7337.

title: Alpine Room
description: Tel. (302) 652-9571. "... but gay women are welcome."

title: Alive
description: 33143. Tel. (305) 666-2588. $10.00 per year. A glossy monthly with a lesbian literary side to it... but graphically, male-oriented. It's bar-life oriented but I don't find it at all helpful about giving the ladies' scene. Distributed in bars and has a statewide circulation.

title: Southern Gay Liberator
description: 33432. Tel. (305) 391-8693, after 4pm. "We are a reference/information service-providing info. to pays on locations of taverns and professional services, etc. In addition, we have an extensive collection of books and gay periodicals available to all gays for research and related purposes."

title: Evening Edition
description: Bayview Shopping Plaza. Tel. (305) 783-9136. very highly recommended.

title: Visa Travel
description: 33134. Tel. (305) 444-8484. "Able to provide whatever services the gay community might require without any hassle or raised eyebrows. Contacts are maintained with gay-oriented travel groups."

title: Zodiac Lounge
description: (South Daytona Beach). Tel. 767-4624. Open: 3pm-2am. "We have the finest disco in this area, complete with a light show, wall panels and lighted floor. Two shows nitely. A new cruise bar and a large games room." Also, pool table and pin ball.

title: Inferno
description: Tel. 258-9259. Big disco and after hour snacks.

title: Nite Fall Motel
description: on US 1 Tel. (904) 252-4947. Mostly gay men.

title: Zelda's
description: Tel. 561-8988. Big disco open till 4am. Recommended.

title: The Copa
description: at US 1. Tel. 463-1507 for reservations. Opens at 9pm.

title: M.C.C.
description: of the Palms. Mail: PO Box 0532, Tice; 33905. Church: 4427 Palm Beach Blvd; 33905. Tel. (813) 694-2535. A good mixture of gay women and men.

title: The Club
description: Tel. 332-1789. Open: 9pm-2am, weekends till 5am. Private club (BYOB). Show on Sundays. Gay women and men.

title: Lost Texans, Inc
description: Key Estero Island Shops, Fort Myers Beach; 33931. Tel. (813) 463-2474. "General bookstore- a section devoted to "Gay" oriented books; operated a mail order business for gay men and lesbian readers, Send requests to be added to our mailing list or for special order. We sell Gaia's Guide."

title: Melody Club
description: Dance bar. Women's nites. Tel. 376-3772. May be closing.

title: Womanstore
description: 32601. Tel. (904) 376-3456. Open: 10am-6pm, Mon-Sat. "We Sell Gaia's Guide."

title: Fat Lady's
description: (next to 'Keith's Cruise Room');33309. Tel. 454-3404. 75-85% gay women. Disco dancing, pool table. Highly recommended.

title: Top's Lounge
description: Tel. 921-6563. Open: 7pm-6am, 7 days a week. "This is south Florida's only 100% women's lounge. It is done in the finest decor and has the finest staff and customers around, Drinks are reasonable and the atmosphere in superb. "Small snacks served after 11pm. Dancing, shows every other week, 2 pool tables, pinball and other games. Special parties on all major holidays. Private Club. Women only. Very, very highly recommended. Hallendale-Hollywood area.

title: Stonewall Library & Archives
description: 33020. Tel. (305) 922-2937. morning and evening. "Building and maintaining the South's largest collection of books, publications, clippings, records, papers, etc., dealing with homosexuality, lesbian-feminism, gay liberation. Founded in August '73 and affiliated with the Broward County Coalition for Human Rights, Inc. Personal papers, poems, diaries, articles and research papers gratefully accepted. We also distribute literature and are involved in educational and political activism."

title: Jacksonville Lambda Coalition
description: 32201. '100% gay- we have always had a certain percentage of gay women, but would love to have more! No gay movement is complete without gay women." Their publ: 'Lambda Speaks' -monthly. Florida news and semi magazine articles. Currently, the major Florida publication with over 1200 gay names on mailing list. The Group's activities range from social, religious (M.C.C. , and Universal Life Church of META), educational to political.

title: The Dudes
description: (at 2952 Roosevelt and Willow branch, across from Farmbest Diary). 90% gay women. Pool, pin ball. Noisy and crowded, friendly. Highly recommended.

title: Brothers
description: Disco, pool table. Has about 30% gay women.

title: Bo's Crow Bar
description: Tel. 249-9297. Open: noon-2am, seven days a week.

title: The Monster
description: 33040. "Fabulous indoor/outdoor bar. Four separate areas of incredible design." Gay women most welcome.

title: Key Lodge Motel
description: Duval Street and Truman (on US 1); 33040. Tel. (305) 296-9915. Mostly gay men.

title: The Green Parrot
description: Pool table, dance floor, food, drag shoes twice monthly. Recommended.

title: The Sly Fox
description: (3 1/2 miles north of Lakeland Hills Blvd. on Lake Desson) 5224 State Road 33. Tel. (813) 682-9489. Private club and it might be just gay men, so ring up first. Disco and showbar.

title: "Alive"
description: Suite A-213, 7000 S.W. 62nd Ave; 33143. Tel. (305) 666-2588. A glossy monthly with a lesbian literary side to it but graphically male-oriented and bar scene for ladies not that helpful.

title: C.B.'s Bar
description: Get address locally and report back!!

title: Sebastians
description: 33145. Tel. (305) 854-9216. open: 4pm-3am. "Dim lighting. Newly renovated with mirrored ceiling and disco lighting. Cool, quiet patio with fountain, umbrella tables and plants. Miami's finest ladies' lounge." Recommended.

title: Hamlet's Hideaway
description: tel. 358-3736 Saturday and Sunday are shownites.

title: Mayflower Back Room
description: (use rear entrance). Tel. 673-6345 for reservations. A women's showbar with the only glass dance floor in Miami. Recommended, but is it still open???

title: 8000 Club
description: 33138. Tel. 751-0831. Bar and restaurant, dancing, entertainment.

title: 8000 Resort Hotel/Club
description: 33138. tel. 751-0831. Bar and restaurant, dancing, entertainment.

title: Nite Owl/ Pin-Up & Middle Room
description: 2228-2243 Park Ave (3 bars under one roof)-222-2234 Park Avenue; 33139 All bars open 1pm-5am.

title: Miss Kay's Lounge
description: Tel. 532-1082. Recommended, but is it still open???

title: Nite Owl
description: Tel. 673-9864. Some straights amongst mixed gay clientele.

title: Middle Room
description: tel. 673-9864. mixed gay men and women. This has a bar and game room, with pin ball and tow pool table.

title: The Windward
description: Tel. 947-5674. Resort, swimming, disco. the motel is mainly gay men.

title: Odds and Ends Club/End Zone Disco
description: 32810. Tel. (305) 293-9733. open: Mon-Thurs. & Sun. 11am-2am; Fri & Sat. 11am-4am (BYOB after 2am). Cover Charge: $1.00 at weekends ($2.00 after 2am). Female impersonator shows at 10:30pm on Tues., Wed., Fri., Sat. & Sun. "A small neighborhood bar with two sections (cruise room and disco room). Sandwiches served. Pool table, pin ball, disco.

title: Parliament House
description: Tel. 425-7571. Disco, three bars, motor inn accommodation, showbar, restaurant, 50/50 gay men and women. Very highly recommended. Restaurant also.

title: Sarasota-Lesbian-Contact
description: Tel. (813) 921-1683. almost anytime. Write: S.L.C., PO Box 15621; 33579. "I am offering a lesbian contact service, from a special private phone. Contact me for info. about whatever is available for lesbians, i.e. meetings, M.C.C services and activities, DOB meetings and activities, gay bars and directions around town if needed."

title: The Stingers
description: (downtown, near the stadium) Bar and restaurant.

title: Daughters of Bilitis
description: 33579. "We hold one meeting a month and our social activities include weekend camping trips, deep-sea fishing and beach cookouts. 100% gay women."

title: Pagoda Cottages & Cultural Center
description: 32084. Tel. (904) 824-2970. "We have eight oceanside cottages and a duplex, plus a large community house which includes a small women's theatre, dance studio, library, and natural foods and women's craft store. We also have a pool and sailboats and the local St. Augustin community is famous for its excellent seafood and restoration area."

title: Wedgewood Inn & Motel
description: 445-18th Ave S. & 4th St Tel. 823-7600. Also has a Disco and Restaurant. Very highly recommended.

title: Co-op Books and Records
description: Location: PO Box 2436; 32304. Mailing: 648-652 W. Tennessee St; 32304. Tel. 222-6677. "We are a progressive/alternative bookstore that has been in existence for 8 years now. We have a large selection of feminist, gay, left, black, literature. We also carry fiction, poetry, alternative technology, health, herb and dope books. We also carry women's albums in the second store, including Olivia and other labels. We are a good resource center in the community. We sell Gaia'a Guide." The manageress is a lesbian-feminist.

title: 21st Century Fox
description: Tel. (904) 599-9728. Open 7 days a week. 30% gay women. Big disco, pus pool room. Young crowd.

title: The Carousel Disco
description: Tel. (813) 251-9887. Dancing, pool table, weekend shows. Friendly people.

title: Rene's Lounge
description: Tel. (813) 872-9631. Outdoor swimming pool, barbecue and tea dances.

title: The Tap Room
description: (US 1); 33405. Tel. 832-9282 (Buzzer system on door after 8pm). Open: Mon.-Sat. noon-2am(?); Sunday 2pm-2am. Pool table.

title: The Outer Limits
description: Tel. (813) 247-9754. Opens at 4pm. Game room, large disco.

title: El Goya
description: (at 14th St) Tel. (813) 247-9435. "Built in the 1890's... became a gay bar in the summer of '76." The entrance is through a door on 14th Street. Recommended.

title: Womansword
description: Georgia University Station, Po Box 2301; 30602. The publication of the lesbian/feminists of Athens.

title: Cruise
description: 30355. Tel. (404) 231-1057. Monthly. $15.00 per year. $2.00 per copy. "Cruise is a monthly magazine of travel and entertainment for gay men and women, providing an up-to-date guide to bars and restaurants." Male-orientated, but quite useful- at least it gives some hints as to where the ladies go (which is a tremendous improvement over other gay men's publications and guides).

title: Atlanta Lesbian Feminist Alliance (ALFA)
description: 30307. Center: ALFA House, 1326 McLendon Ave (N.E.?); 30307. Tel. (404) 523-7786, Switchboard. Library, karate and self-defense, poetry workshop and softball team. Coffeehouse nights. Their publ: 'Atlanta'. $6.00 per year membership fee includes newsletter. "ALFA is open to all lesbians. Women-involved work on social, political, educational cultural and recreational activities. Mostly, ALFA allows lesbians to meet and get together with other lesbians who share her interests. We do not exclude anyone on basis of race, religion, politics, economic status, occupation or degree of openness."

title: Ms. Garbo
description: N.E. (behind Baby Products Warehouse). Tel. (404) 321-0054 and 634-9145.

title: Atalanta
description: (The Atlantic Lesbian Feminist Alliance Newsletter). Mail: P.O. Box 5502; 30307. Tel. (404) 523-7786. $3.50 per year. "Atalanta, a Greek woman from Arkadia, was custom with female children throughout history." The newsletter covers local lesbian news and reviews, events calendar. their regular column, 'Lesbian Region' is a power house of information about the lesbian/feminist scene in the South.

title: Starlite Lounge
description: Tel. 881-9308. Open: Mon-Thurs. 2pm-2am/later; Fri. 2pm-4am; Sat. noon-3am. Dancing, pool table, pin ball. Recommended.

title: Shelly's Place
description: (just after Peachtree crosses Hiway 85). Highly recommended restaurant and lounge. About 30% gay women. "Sort of elegant, but jeans are OK."

title: Sweet Gum Head
description: (behind Tiger Auto Parts). A good mixture of gay women and men. Tel. 634-2922.

title: Back Street
description: (near 6th and Juniper). "Super Disco in several bars."

title: Magic Garden
description: Tel. 875-0119. Pool tables under the trees.

title: Gene & Gabe's
description: N.E. Tel. 876-9426. Piano Bar. Northern Italian cooking. Gay-owned and highly recommended. About $10.00 each.

title: Gallus
description: Restaurant and bar. Sunday nites are recommended.

title: Cruise Weekly
description: Tel. (404) 231-1057, 10am-6pm any weekday. "A complimentary Gay entertainment guide to Atlanta." Check with them for current details.

title: Ray's Way Date Games
description: 111GG, PO Box 77004; 30357. Tel. (404) 351-6904. Atlanta-based, but out-of-state members are welcome. "We welcome listings from gay people and our matches are achieved by considering personal as well as geographical preferences."

title: Peacock Lounge-bar
description: 30904. Tel. 724-9262. Private Club. Open: Mon-Fri. 8pm-2:30am; Sat. 8.00pm-1.45am. "We serve beer and set-ups. Bring your own bottle. Women welcome." Food served. Dancing, entertainment, pool table and other games.

title: Bottoms Up Lounge
description: 1407 1st Ave. Open: Mon-Sat. 7pm-2am; closed Sundays. Gay women and men plus a few straights.

title: Dr. Feelgood's
description: Tel. (912) 234-9696. Open: 7pm-3am except Sundays. "Good disco, good bar. Drag shows on Saturday nites. A greta place. "Gay men and women.

title: J.J.'s Lounge
description: (formerly The Red Fox), 410 Cotton Avenue. Tel. (912) 742-9661. Open: Mon-Fri. noon-2am; Sat. noon-1am; closed Sundays. Woman-owned. "Tri-sexual; try anything that has to do with sex! We are a people's bar for all nice people. Country cooking-short order. We're new and friendly."

title: The Paper
description:
96815. Tel. (808) 941-2029. $10.00 per 13 issues (Hawaii residents add .40 cents) News, politics, personalities, and an ongoing photo essay covering the major islands. Includes a page called "Women"
 and a regular column called "I Am Woman".

title: Sexual Identity Center
description: Tel. 521-4551, 24-hour Switchboard. Gay women's group; has weekly meetings.

title: N.O.W. Lesbian Task Force
description: Meets third Wednesday of the month at Richard Street YMCA- but check with local sources to be certain.

title: Ferity
description: 96822. $2.00 per year. Feminist journal. Linked to N.O.W. Lesbian Task Force of Honolulu.

title: Everywoman
description: Suite 754; 96814. Counseling clinic and resource center. $3.25 for a year's subscription to their publication.

title: M.C.C.
description: Hawaii. Office: 1186 Fort Street Mall, Room 211. Tel. (808) 537-9478, Switchboard- 10am-5pm. Worship Services: 7:30pm at 2500 Pali Hiway (Church). This is a very, very active M.C.C. group, with lesbian participation. There is a full range of activities and they are highly recommended.

title: Lorraine's Cocktail Lounge
description: Tel. 538-9477. "Lorraine's is a gay club with 75% gay men, plus women and a few straights." Pool table, entertainment. Open: noon-2am.

title: The Tomato
description: (at Ala Wai 1/2 block south of Kalakaua). Tel. 955-5688. Dancing. Open: 4pm-4am. Friday nites are best for women.

title: Cocktail Center
description: Pool table, but no dancing. A real old-timer.

title: Hula's Bar & Lei Stand
description: Tel. 923-0669. Across from Kuhio Theater. "A banyan tree outside and disco dancing inside." best after 11pm. Highly recommended.

title: The Tomato
description: (at Ala Wai, 1/2 block south of Kalakaua). Tel. 955-5688. Open: 4pm-4am. "During weekends at least 50% gay women, especially Friday nites. Free hot appetizers until 10pm. No shorts allowed." Dancing and pin ball games. Very highly recommended by Gaia.

title: Waikiki Drug Clinic
description: Tel. 922-4787. Hotline: 922-1313. VD screening/gay counseling/medical advice. Friday is gay night: 7:30pm to 10:30pm.

title: House of Music
description: Ala Moana Center. Has Olivia records and other women's music.

title: The Glades
description: (downtown). "A bar and tables. Gives an honest drink and a good show."

title: Side Track
description: S.E. Tel. (319) 363-0393. Mostly gay men... but recommended because it's gay-owned and quite OK for women. Open: 5.30pm-2am.

title: City Disco Park
description: 50309. Tel. 243-9953 (bar); 280-1155 (office). Open Monday to Sunday. Mon-Sat: 5-7.30pm- cocktail hour, reduced prices on drinks; 8-2am regular disco hour, reduced prices on drinks; 8-2am regular disco hours; Sunday: 6-10pm regular disco hours and prices. "Lively, exciting disco/D.J. every nights. Excellent and up-to-date music selections. City Showcase Company (female impersonation/ male impersonation- fun) performs Thursdays thru Sundays. Lights, fog and special effects shows all night every night. Fun, beautiful, courteous, friendly crowd. Ladies' night on Thursdays in our Shelter House Bar (part of City Disco, Inc.) located on the premises. Pool table, pin ball and other games. City Disco park celebrates 14 annual events yearly. Aside from the usual holidays, we have Miss Des Moines, Miss City Sweetheart, Gay Miss Iowa Pageants, Spring Festival, Winter Carnival, City Celebrity Awards." WE WELCOME THE LADIES!!" Very highly recommended by Gaia.

title: Lesbian Alliance c/o Women's Resource & Action Center
description: 52240. Tel. (319) 353-6265. They have every facility and activity you could possibly think of - including sports and a very wide range of social activities. "L.A. helps to support/facilitate social, cultural, political activities for lesbians. Includes dances, poetry, workshops, concerts, speakers bureau. Provides contact people."

title: A Mind of Your Own
description: 50311. Tel. (515) 277-9091. Feminist literature, non-sexist children's books, posters, records- and they sell Gaia's Guide.

title: Grace and Rubie's
description: 52240. Tel. (319) 351-9550. Open: Mon-Fri. 11am-midnight. Natural food. Private membership. "A private club for women, owned and run by women"... but is it still going???

title: Plains Woman Bookstore
description: 52240. Tel. (319) 338-9842. Specializes in feminist books and music. Also carries t-shirts, pins, posters, etc. Has mail order service. Periodically holds workshops, poetry readings, etc. Open: Mon-Fri. noon-6pm; Sat. noon 5pm. "We like visitors." Gaia's Guide on sale.

title: Shuckey's
description: Tel. (208)342-9558. "Right now it's mostly gay men but there's always very good vibes for gay women." The owners want more gay women in and they also believe that 'gay is good'.

title: B.S.U. Women's Alliance
description: Boise State University, Student Union Building, 1910 University Drive; 83725. Tel. (208) 342-2869/1978. A feminist student group with very strong lesbian representation.

title: G.C. News/Journal
description: 60690. Sample copy $1.50; in Metro Chicago $1.00. For current and detailed information about the bar scene in Illinois.

title: Mr. B's Club
description: 60409. Tel. (312) 862-1221. Open: Sun-Tues from 2pm; Wed Sat from 7pm. Some straights. "Beer and all mixed drinks available. Up-to-date jukebox. Our customers can have good conversations and not be shouted over by the jukebox." Dancing and pin ball.

title: Washington Street Underground
description: 62901. Open: 1pm-2am, 7 days a week. "A combination of a social as well as a partying atmosphere. We have a dance floor, a bar, seating, and  3 pool tables, many in ball machines, On Sunday nites, its disco with a D.J. It has a pleasant as well as lively atmosphere." Highly recommended.

title: Gay Life
description: Suite 1306; 60606. tel. (312) 236-7575. "We are a weekly newspaper serving the gay and lesbian community of Chicago. The first edition of each month is our Midwest Edition and is distributed throughout the Midwest. Whilst distributed free, subs, are available 2nd class (controlled circulation): $16.00 per year; $10.00 per 1/2 year- delivered in "no-peak" brown envelope." Bar guide has a section called "Women's Bars".

title: Women's News- For a Change
description: 60657. Free monthly paper for all women in Chicago. News and information for Chicago women. Highly recommended.

title: Gay Chicago
description: 60613. Tel. (312) 929-9833/2767. Quarterly: $1.50. 13 issues: $12.00 1st class; $8.00 2nd class. Local guide. Male-oriented but listings do indicate the women's bars and bars where women are welcome. Very handy indeed if you're living or are new to the area. Also publish Gay Ohio and gay Detroit.

title: All Together
description: Suite 1416, 205 W. Wacker Drive, 60606. Gay news, local news, lesbian news. This big publication is free to "All Together" members- non-discriminatory insurance group.

title: Illinois Women's Agenda
description: from: Midwest Women's Center, 53 W Jackson, Room 623; 60604. Tel. (312) 922-8530. Monthly newsletter. 10 issues per year: $6.00. Covers services and programs of Illinois Women's organizations and calendar of state-wide events. They also publish The Illinois Women's Directory ($4.00) which is lists programs and activities of women's organizations and will include Illinois, Northwest Indiana, Quad City and East St. Louis.

title: Women's Switchboard
description: Tel. (312) 663-4163. "We provide comprehensive bi-lingual referral and assistance 46 hours/week r visit our clearinghouse for the same service: Midwest Women's Center, 53 West Jackson Street, Room 623."

title: Midwest Women's Center
description: 60604. Tel. (312) 922-8530. "A not-for-profit educational institution created to respond to the concerns of Midwest area women." Their publs: 'Illinois Women's Agenda' and "The Illinois Women's Directory' (see 'Publications' for further details).

title: Blue Gargoyle
description: coffeeshop at Jane Addams Bookstore, 5/6 S Wabash, Room 1508; 60603. Tel. (312) 782-0708. Coffee, herb tea, cider, whoewheat pastries. "Women and children first!". Open: Mon-Fri. 10am-5pm; Sat. 10am-4pm. Recommended. (see also 'Bookstore' listing).

title: Mountain Moving Coffeehouse
description: Open: Sat 7:30pm-11:00pm. "A non-alcoholic wimmen-only space. Woman talent featured."

title: C.K.'s Lounge
description: 60614. Tel. 871-2120. Open: Wed-Mon 7pm-4am/5am on Sat; closed Tues. 1/2-price drinks on Wed. nites. Thurs. nites 2 for 1 drinks. Membership cards presented to bartenders means 1 free drink any/all nites. "We make the best 1/2 lb hamburgers in the City."Dancing, occasional entertainment, pool table, pin ball, baseball and basketball teams. very highly recommended.

title: Marilyn
description: Tel. 337-8421. Open: Wed-Sun. 8:30pm-4am. "Chicago's elegant disco for women. You are invited to enjoy, explore, be yourself."

title: The Bushes
description: Tel. 528-6088. Open: Sat & Sun 2pm-2am; weekdays 4pm-2am. Cocktail hour prices until 7:30pm daily. Women's nites.

title: The Courtyard Inn
description: 60610. Tel. 664-7387. Under same ownership as "The Fireplace Inn". Open: Mon-Fri (lunch): 11:30am-4:00pm; Sunday (brunch): 11.00am-3.00pm; Sun-Fri (dinner): 3:00pm-1.15am; Sat: 5.00pm-2.15am. "Warm, cozy atmosphere. We specialize in B.B.Q. baby back ribs, but also have a full range of prime steaks, fish, chicken and sandwiches. Reasonably priced and we accept all major credit cards."

title: The Knight Out
description: 60657. Tel. 525-8150. open: Mon-Fri 9am-2am; Sat. 9am-3am; Sun. noon-2am. Dancing, pin ball, plus many benefits for the gay people, owned and operated by gays, Included on the premises is the only non-erotic gay bookstore in Chicago, for both sexes; also, a full service jewelry counter, selling many gay symbols and custom work wedding bands, etc., etc."

title: The Fireplace Inn
description: 60610. Tel. 664-5264. Under same ownership and locale (almost) as "The Courtyard Inn". Has same menu too. Open: Mon-Sat (dinner) 5pm-midnight; Sun 3pm-midnight. Reasonably priced and all major credit cards accepted.

title: Walk Our Dog
description: Tel. 281-3303. Open from 11am. Fast food (London needs it!!!).

title: Abbot Hotel
description: Tel. Bi8 2701. Ok for gay women.

title: Jane Addams Bookstore
description: (and Coffeeshop), 5/6 South Wabash, Room 1508; 60603. (downtown Chicago.) Tel. (312) 782-0708. "Women and Children First! We sell Gaia's Guide, women's and lesbian titles, children's books, rare women's books, free search service for out-of-print books. Posters, and records by woman artists. Coffee, herb tea, cider, wholewheat pastries from the coffeeshop. "Open: Mon-Fri. 10am-5pm; Sat. 10am-4pm. Recommended.

title: Horizons
description: Tel. (217) 328-2988. "has a good women's selection; reading room and serves tea and coffee."

title: a bookstore in a gay bar
description: Source, at the Knight Out Bar, 2936 N Clark St; 60657. Tel. 525-8150. "A gay bookstore/boutique within the "Knight Out', selling books etc. for gay women and men, also Gaia's Guide."

title: New World Resource Center
description: Tel. (312) 348-3360. Large feminist selection. Anti-imperialist focus.

title: Barbara's Bookstore
description: and also at 2907 N Broadway. Has a special women's section. 3 branches.

title: A Mind of Your Own
description: 50311. Tel. (515) 277-9091. Feminist literature, non-sexist children's literature, posters, records. And they sell Gaia's Guide.

title: Free Spirits
description: Suite 1502; 60601. Tel. (312) 726-2221. "We're a Chicago-based club that circles the world. Services include many fully escorted gay tours." Group and individual travel.

title: Business and Vacation Travel Service
description: 60602. Tel. (312) 782-0532. "Tours, cruises, air tickets, charter flights, gay-owned and operated for 15 years." Recommended.

title: Sojourner Bookstore
description: Tel. (815) 758-8178. Collectively-owned women's bookstore. Large selection of feminist and non-sexist children's books (over 5,000 titles). Search and special order service. Women's arts and crafts gallery. Information center.

title: Marie's Golden Cue
description: get address locally. "A pool hall open to women only."

title: Hideaway II
description: Tel. 771-9600. Open: 8pm-2am. "Paino bar plus, plus, plus."

title: Whole Earth Center
description: 60202. Tel. (312) 491-9555. "We are a retail bookstore with a significant feminist collection. We sell Gaia's Guide."

title: The Main Drag
description: "Mostly gay men, but OK." Use the rear entrance- the sign on Main Street says gymnastic club. the local M.C.C. is in the same building.

title: Womanspace Center Bookstore
description: Tel. (815) 877-0118. Over 500 titles. Filmstrips, slides, tapes, books. These resources are available to members of the Center.

title: 7th Heaven
description: Tel. (815) 962-9403.  Mostly gay men-good dance floor. Open: Mon-Sat. 4pm-1am; closed Sundays.

title: Conquest
description: (use rear entrance). "Nice and large; pinball machines, pool tables, disco and dancing. 80% guys-  20% gals." Recommended. Tel. 786-9372.

title: Spoon River Book Co-op
description: Tel. (217) 786-6600. Co-operatively owned and operated feminist bookstore. Journals, paperbacks and non-sexist children's literature.

title: G.C./News Journal
description: 60690. Sample copy: $1.50. For current and detailed information about the bar scene in Indiana.

title: G.C. News/Journal
description: 60690. Sample copy: $1.50. For current and detailed information about the bar scene in Illinois.

title: G.C. News Journal
description: 60690. Sample copy: %1.50. For current and detailed information about the bar scene in Kansas.

title: G.C. News/Journal
description: 60690. Sample copy: $1.50 For current and detailed information about the bar scene in Kentucky.

title: G.C. News/Journal
