title: Galleon House
description: All rooms with private bath-- harbor views and a swimming pool. Recommended.

title: Primavera
description:
Tel.(802)254-9394."Secluded
camp sites in a woman-owned forest near a beautiful pond-- very,very lesbian."

title: Flat Street Disco
description: (inquire locally). Gay crowd on Wednesdays only.

title: Grand Palace
description: Tel.(304)342-9532.A discoprivate club on two floors. Food is served.

title: Red Wood
description:
Tel. 632-0371.
Four Winds, 1103 East Pershing Blvd. Tel.632

title: Magnolia
notes: Under the "Statewide" rather than a city

title: Birmingham Gay Center
description: Tel. 251-0682. Your first stop in gay Birmingham

title: Lambda Hotline/Gay Info
description: Tel. 251-0682. Contact them for details about local MCC and Dignity

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Tel. 251-0682. Your best bet as an alternative to the bar scene in Birmingham. The minister Is a lesbian and theres a pot-luck dinner every Sunday at 6pm, held at the BIRMINGHAM GAY CENTER, 1019-23rd Street, South. Phone number as above
notes: Shares a space with the Birmingham Gay Center

title: Bill's Place (Bill's Club)
description: Tel. 254-8634. Very nice place, women only. Disco, pinball, very comfortable and highly recommended. (Located between 2nd and 3rd Avenue). Closed Sundays.

title: Steak 'n' Eggs
description: Tel. 933-9822. Popular after hours eating place. Open 24 hours daily.

title: Dexter Pub
description: Tel. 264-9059 and 269-9715. Super bar with disco, piano bar living-room type lounge, regular shows and two New Orleans style outdoor courtyards. Their new plans include a health club with special nights for ladies. Open 7pm- 5am. Disco from 5am. Very, very highly recommended. A private club that will admit new members who have valid ID and a copy of GAIA'S GUIDE

title: Hojon's
description: Tel. 265-0021. Open Mon-Sat from 8pm-3am&Sat till 2am. Pool table/computer & video games/lounge/disco/downstairs bar.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of the Ozarks
description: Meetings at: the Church at Kenway & Plainview Tel. ~278 & 443-3717. Sunday services at 11am & 7.30pm. Also coffeehouse for gay women & men and other activities during the week.

title: Our House
description: Tel. 624-6868. Disco 6 days a week. Open 12 noon-2am.

title: Grassroots Women's House
description: Tel. 378-7851. Strictly political interests. Not all-lesbian.

title: Silver Dollar
description: Tel. 663-9886. A mixed gay bar-often mostly women clientele. Game area with pool tables, video & pin-ball Serves beer & snacks. Open 12 noon-midnight.

title: Discovery Disco
description: Tel. 664-4784. Pool tables/video games/dancing. Open Weds-Sat. 9pm-3am & Sun. till late. Show time Weds. & Sun. 9pm & 11pm. Back & front bars (back bar open after the shows). Private club.

title: Arizona Gay News (AGN)
description: Tel. 623-5268. Weekly gay newspaper, full of Arizona news and resources.

title: The Directory
description: Tel. 277-0196. Gay resource and guide for Arizona. Extremely handy and extremely useful.

title: Women's Pages
description: Tel. 947-5655. Statewide directory of women's resources, services and businesses. Extremely handy.

title: Charlie's
description: (in the Weatherford Hotel) Tel. 779-1919. Folk music/women musicians. Open every night

title: Aradia Women's Books
description: Tel. 779-3817. Closed Sundays- Feminist and lesbian titles galore.

title: Womansplace Bookstore
description: Tel. 966-9276 Your first stop in the Phoenix area. Bulletin board/notices, etc. for all current local events and information. Be sure and say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: The Full Moon Saloon
description: Tel. 275-0764. Office: 267-8707. Open 1pm-1am. Nightly disco plus live bands and gay community fund raisers. Games, snacks. 'The largest womyn's bar in Arizona, very friendly but younger crowd and comfortable for all. Sunday: home made lunches. Pool tournaments. We have a DJ every night playing rock and roll. Womyn's music'. Nominal cover charge after about 11.00pm on Saturday nights.

title: Raggedy Ann and Andy's
description: (at Oak); Tel. 957-9929. Cocktails and dinnners. Very nice women's bar. Terrific atmosphere. Sunday brunch, occasional shows. large dance floor, pool tables and pinball. Slightly older crowd. Nominal cover charge after about 11.00pm on Saturday nights.

title: Incognito Lounge
description: Tel. 955-9805. Disco/young crowd, good music, friendly neighbourhood, bar atmosphere.

title: Phillip's
description: Tel. 248-9271. New to the Phoenix scene and very, very promising. Women bartenders.

title: The Grans Camel Club
description: Tel. 841-9807. Multi-level super bar/restaurant/disco/game room -pin-ball, video, pool table. Open daily noon-1am. Friendly and intimate, serving dinner nightly. Sunday brunch at 12 noon.

title: Sammy's Steak House and Saloon
description: Tel.231-0168. Good Restaurant, reasonable prices. Dance Floor. Separate Game Room. Pin Ball. Pool. Dinner is served until 9pm. Recommended. Sunday brunch: noon. Showtime: Sunday nights

title: Womanplace
description: Tel. 956-0456.Feminist and lesbian books. newspapers, periodicals, records. buttons, greetings cards. stickers, jewelry etc. Three mail order booklists; lesbian, feminist, non-sexist children's. Send a S.20 stamp for each list. We sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Fourth World
description: Tel. 966 0039. Feminist therapy alternative, especially for those with lesbian lifestyles. For women only. Contact them for information about FEMINIST LESBIAN ACTIVIST COALITION.

title: Gay Christian Outreach Services, INC
description: Tel. 792-3772 (24 Hours). Crisis help/social action/informauon & referral.

title: Gay Information/Referral
description: 881-1794. Monday thru Friday- 8am-5pm. Very helpful people/some women on the answering staff.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of Tucson
description: Tel. 622-4536. Offering regular worship services at 10:45 Sundays. Professional counseling and referrals/social activities/possible temporary housing/alcoholics together/women's rap group/children's activities. Other services available. Office Hours: Mon/Th/Fri. 1Dam-4pm + Tu/Weds 1pm-9pm. Over 50% of our church community are women. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Dignity/Tucson
description: Tel. 297-6340. Gay and concerned Catholics. Alternate phone number, 297-6340.

title: Dena's Outpost
description: Tel. 623-2442. The owners went to turn this into a women's bar- but it is in a very bad section of Tucson and still maintains some straight clientele. You reports, please.

title: Michael's
description: (just south of Broadway- east side of town)Tel.886-5480 Good size dance floor for disco - a good mixture of gay women & men. Pinball/pool table/video games/movie nites/beer nite Weds.

title: The Fine Line
description: Tel. 882-4953. Clientele: 70% gay men/30% gay women. Some straights on weekends. Nice atmosphere, 3 areas: country bar, quiet bar and disco bar. Weekends are hopping and weeknights bring in a good crowd too.

title: Joshua Tree/Back Pocket
description: Tel. 622-6233. Juke box/pool table/ outdoor patio. Quiet atmosphere. Bar open 11am-1am. Restaurant open 11:30am-3am.

title: Antigone Books
description: Tel. 792-3715. Very well-stocked bookshop featuring lesbian and feminist titles. They sell GAIA'S GUID

title: Books Brothers LTD
description: Tel. 326-3332. A new bookstore with a truly enormous range of gay and lesbian titles. also feminist books and much much more. Open 9-9 Mon-Fri. and 9-6 on Saturdays.

title: Roommate Referral of Tucson
description: c/o GayCommunity ServicesTel.622-8868. Mon-Fri. 7:30pm-midnight. Alternate number 622-3808.

title: Heartwood
description: (near Mendocino) Tel. 877-3466. A retreat resort for women only. Bed & breakfast plus rooms/camping, meals.

title: Plexus
description: Tel. 451-2585. A power-house of feminist and lesbian resources for the San Francisco Bay area. Events calendar. Large classified ads section. $6.00 per year.

title: Pacific Center For Human Growth
description: Tel 841-6224 (switchboard). Crisis referral for housing, jobs, etc. Monthly newsletter and calendar of women's events, mental health services and switchboard. Offering these groups Lesbian rap group, Slightly Older Lesbians group, Women's Alcohol and Drug Abuse Group, Bi-sexual Women's Group, Black Lesbian Support Group. Under 30 Lesbian rap group. Also Lesbian incest survivors group and rape/sexual assault survivors group. One of the most successful and active gay centers in the world. A great first contact when new to the Berkeley/Oakland area.

title: Berkeley Women's Center
description: Tel. 548-4343. Info and referral/ classes/evening programs & groups/workshops on all areas of interest to women & for women only. It is also the home of the BERKELEY WOMEN'S HEALTH COLLECTIVE(Tel. 843-6194).

title: MCC
description: Tel. 533-4848. They own their own church and have a lesbian pastor plus lesbian student ministers. The congregation is about 60% lesbian and they have many social activities and dances as well as religious services and counseling. Worship is Sundays at 6pm and Thursdays at 7pm.

title: Center For Non-Traditional Religion
description: (corner of Prince and Fulton in Berkeley) Tel. 848-8505. This is a Women's Center of Goddess Worship. Frequent meetings/other activities.

title: Coven of the Laughing Goddess
description: Tel. 444-7724 or 653-4169. Dianic (ie women only). Z Budapest.

title: Eddie's Bar
description: Tel. 448-6579. Beer/pool table/clientele: all gay women and men. Atmosphere: very friendly. Highly recommended. Open 2pm-2amn days a week.

title: The Driftwood
description: (in the Old Town section of Eureka). Tel. 442-9788. Clientele: about 40% gay women, about 50% gay men and about 10% bisexuals and others. The atmosphere is often a walk on the wild side but somehow friendly. It's just a beer and wine bar but with a pool table and pinball machine but the bartenders are friendly and it is gay-owned. Recommended.

title: Womanyes
description: Tel. 444-9862 (recorded message) Custom and feminist T-shirts/retail/mail order catalogue 25c

title: Metropolitan Community Church Fresno
description: meets at Unitarian Church Tel.441--0105(taped message).Sunday meeting at 5pm at the Church.

title: Ash- Alcohol Services for Homosexuals, INC
The Palace/Rawhide Room
description: Tel. 264-8283. Dance floor/juke box/video games/4 pool tables. "Your best bet in Fresno". Hours: 3pm-2am.

title: Gay and Lesbian Community Services Center of Orange County
description: Tel. 534-3280 (HOTLINE) 6.30- 10.30pm; 534--0862 (COUNSELING); 534-3263 (EVENTS LINE: RECORDED ANNOUNCEMENT 24 hrs/day, 7 days/week). Women's group and social happenings. Referrals. counseling, library, newsletter, outreach. Many activities and sub-groups. Your essential contact in Orange County. Your best bet when new to Orange County.

title: Happy Hour
description: Tel. 537-9079. Dance bar with entertainment games and community benefits. The ALL GIRL BAND plays on Weds, Friday and Saturday, Sunday is western night. Happy hour Mon-Fri 4pm-7pm and it's a women's bar but men are welcome. Open 2pm-2am weekdays and Sat/Sun noon-2am. A very, very highly recommended old-timer.

title: Rumour Hazzit
description: 534-9370. Pool table, good disco music, young crowd.

title: The Mug
description: Tel. 534-9943. Entertainment center. Women's pool tournaments. The men outnumber the women but apparently it's quite OK.

title: The Turf Club
description: Tel.881-9877. Lately it's more women than men. Pool table/hard liquor bar/pin-ball/disco.Open7days 10am-2am.

title: Big Mama's
description: Tel.881-9310. Hard liquor bar/disco/pool table/video games.Open7 days a week 10am-2am

title: Driftwood Lounge
description: Tel. 581-2050.Disco/light sh<Ml/mist machine/pool table/video games. Open everyday2pm-2am.

title: Gay and Lesbian Students/University of California at Irvine
description: Office at ASUCI Irvine 92717 Tel. 833-7229. They sponsor speakers, dances, an annual Gay Awareness Week and a social group. With the Counseling Center they sponsor a very popular on going support group. Their office has a library of books and current magazines.

title: The Ranch
description: Tel.824-5352. Camping, swimming, hiking, star gazing, and bonfire. It's woman-owned. Special events in the summer.

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: Gay literature and periodicals. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Mountain Mommas
description: Tel. 656-0258. Enjoy an affordable weekend in beautiful Lake Arrowhead- all the comforts of home including unusual catered meals.

title: Inn Tahoe
description: Mail to Box 114 Tahoe Vista; 95732. Location:7170 North Lake Boulevard Tel. 546-2444.A gay resort with frontage and a beach on the lake and lake- front rooms. Some kitchens, moderate rates, gay owned and operated. Very highly recommended.

title: Coast Inn
description: Tel.494-7588. Has two bars. Quite OK for gay women.

title: Gay Community Services/Long Beach
description: Tel. 432-8047.A full service gay center staffed by really friendly, helpful people. Make this your first stop when moving to or visiting Long Beach. Counseling/referrals/volunteer support very welcome. Always extremely helpful to GAIA'SGUIDE.

title: Metropolitan Community Church/Long Beach
description: Tel. 438-9781.Call for location of services, etc- to move in 1983

title: Long Beach Women's Union
description: Office address 2025 East 10th Street(POBox14785)Tel. 928-2197 and 427 4840. Lesbian collective for social and political action. Contact the GAY COMMUNITY SERVICES for more details. This Group is growing. Monthly activities/annual picnic/meetings/movies/parties

title: Que Sera Sera
description: Tel.599-6170.A women's bar with dancing and games. Open Monday- Friday 6pm-2am. Sat/Sun2pm-2am. Dress code: no levis (I)

title: Gazebo Cafe
description: Tel.434-9921. Good to excellent food at very reasonable prices. Gay owned and operated. Open 24 hours a day. Clientele mostly gay women, some gay men and a few straights. (Corner of 7th and Redondo- just a few blocks from the QUE SERA SERA).

title: Commanche
description: Tel. 428 5545. Used to be INSPIRATION. Disco-dance floor/pool table/video game

title: Whoop's Coop
description: Tel.434-1449. A real old-timer and still going strong. Pool table/beer and wine bar.Clientele80% gay women.

title: Chelsea Bookstore
description: Tel. 434 2220. Alternative bookstore - featuring a wide selection of gay and lesbian literature and also has a whole section devoted to women's music.

title: Bed By The Bay
description: Bed & Breakfast. Guest rooms in private gay residence- San Francisco and Marin County. $24.00 and up. We provide information about SF's gay/lesbian activities.

title: Feminist Women's Health Center
description: Tel. 444-7664/444-5676. Full gynecological services/lesbian health and now their own sperm bank. Bv appointment only. Weekdays 9am-7pm.

title: Ruth Nodel
description: Tel. 658-0229. Massage practitioner/holistic counseling/relaxing, therapeutic massage for women. Private practice, sliding scale.

title: For Yourself
description: (near Rockridge BART) Tel. 658-1904. Sensuous supplies. vibrators. body oils, books, erotic art. Monday through Sat. 12 noon-6pm.

title: Becky Jacofsky
description: Tel.655-6761. a wonderful. helpful woman insurance agent-she advertises 'proud to be gay, proud to serve gays' 'I've used her for years, the best ever I' Located across from the Women's Place

title: Metropolitan Community Church/Ocean of Life
description: meets at Community Church by the Bay, (1 block off Newport Blvd).The pastor is a lesbian.

title: Newport Station
description: Tel. 631-0031. Very strict dress code regarding women's shirts. They must be buttoned from right to left (or is it left to right?)- anyway, they must button in the female way.

title: Scene One
description: (WestCovina) Tel. 339-5505 and 332-9265 Bar/restaurant/disco. Cocktails and Sunday brunch. All Gay and 80% women. Highly recommended.

title: Davis Lesbian and Gay Task Force
description: Tel. 753-2090. Affiliated with the GAY STUDENTS UNION OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA AT DAVIS. They offer: Coming Out Group, Lesbian Sharing Group and potlucks. Events tape and see MOM GUESS WHAT/Newspaper for current details.

title: For Yourself
description: Tel. 949-3417. Massage and body oils, books, and playthings. Open Tues- Sat 11am-5.30pm. We are geared towards women'.

title: The Advocate gay Visitors Guide to Los Angeles(& Palm Springs)
description: Order from: The Advocate, P.O.Box 5847, SanMateo, Calif.,94402.A Guide Book for gay accommodations, bars, restaurants, shops, cultural attractions, for men and women. The priceIs$4.95 each and add$1.25for postage and handling.

title: Lesbian News
description: Tel. 704-7825. L.A. Oriented monthly in big news-letter form. It's full of local resources and information- includes a very useful classified section. It's one of my own favorites. Subscription rates: Working women $8.50 per year or $10.00 per year for a family. Now in its 8th year.

title: Women's Referral Service
description:
Tel. 995-6646. Call for free referrals- services& products. Accountants/attorneys/banks/financial planners/insurance
consultants/therapists/physicians and many many more. Professional women's network

title: Open Quest Counseling Hotline
description: Tel.650-OPEN &650-6736.This is a professionally operated crisis counseling line for the gay community. All year and around the clock. A licensed counselor is just a phone call away.

title: The Homosexual Information Center
description: Tel. 464-8431. Data files, information services. Library/newsletter/biography etc Afternoon only. Weekends by appointment. Call first.

title: The Women's Center At Council House (WCCH)
description: Tel. 651-2930. Established to aid everywoman in securing quality healthcare, economic self-reliance, equality and an enriched life; was founded by the National Council of Jewish Women, Los Angeles Section as a place where the interests and concerns of the women of this community would be singularly important WCCH is the meeting place of many agencies, organizations and women's groups with a feminist perspective and goal.

title: Southern California Center For Women's Education & Therapy
description: located in StudioCityTel.761-3011& (714) 622-5563. Lesbian rap groups/programs-presentations/classes-courses/discussions/socials(like swimming, supper and movies) - the ideal alternative to the lesbian bar scene.

title: The Gay and Lesbian Community Services Center
description: Mail to: P.O.38777, 90038 Tel.464-7400. As far as I know, this is the most highly organized gay center in the world, with services and facilities for lesbians so complete as to make this a full-service lesbian center. Contact them when you first hit L.A. about housing, employment, military and veterans programs, social activities, disabled lesbians program, counseling and referrals and their open rap group for lesbians. SWITCHBOARD now includes: Lesbian Central- office hours:10.30am-5.15pm Monday through Friday, coordinating all Lesbian activities, referrals, etc. New groups; lesbian mothers and children socials& support/socials for pregnantlesbians.

title: Growth House
description: 787-1090. Offering; 'The Friday Night Club'- an alternative to the bars for gay women and men. Highly recommended. General counsellingandpsychotherapy.Educationadlegreeprograms.Affiliatedwith3universities

title: National Gay Archives
description: Natalie Barney/Edward Carpenter Library Mail to: P.O.Box 38100 Hollywood. Ca. 38100 Hollywood, Ca. 90038 Location: 1654 North Hudson Ave Hollywood,Ca.90028Tel.463-5450. Lectures, discussions. film nights, theater parties. Over 12,000 books and many more periodicals. Preserving and Gay/Lesbian heritage.

title: Alcoholism Center For Women
description: Tel.381-7805. Support for lesbians with a drinking problem. Counseling and 13 bed recovery home. Social activities, lesbian rap groups, coffee house nights and all women Al-Anon groups. Speakers Bureau- Training Workshop

title: Center For Feminist Therapy
description: Tel. 391-6321 Lesbian drop-in, a great way to meet new women and an excellent alternative to the bar scene. On Friday nights. The center also offers individual/relationship/group therapy

title: Society For Senior Gay and Lesbian Citizens (SSGLC)
description: (Downtown Los Angeles) Tel.621-3180 or 708-1978.Referral and information center. Luncheons, dinners, lectures, courses on self-defense and economic survival, card parties, field trips, rap groups one very thing from religion to what it's like to be a homosexual at 75'.24 hour hotline. Housing, nursing care, recreational facilities.

title: KPFK
description: 90.7 FM 8.30pm every Sunday. Lesbian Sisters-includes excellent calendar of events

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: BeachCities: 3681 Glendon Avenue, (West Los Angeles), 90025 Tel.838-6000.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Tel.748-0121.A Christian Church with outreach to the gay community. Rev. Jeri Ann Harvey,Pastor.

title: Universal Fellowship of Metropolitan Community Church (UFMCC)
description: International headquarters of the METROPOLITAN COMMUNITY CHURCHES(M.C.C.)- contact them for the latest details about the local churches. They publish a directory of all local M.C.C.'s -over 150 in 8 countries.

title: Mi Wei
description: Tel. 391-9264. Dancing, DJ Fri. & Sat. nights. pool tables. Clientele 95% gay women. Mixed races, ages. Open 1Oam-2am 7 days a week.

title: Iglesia De La Communidad
description: (Metropolitana IM.C.C.)Latina. Tel. 668-0979.An M.C.C.for the latin gay community offering counseling and holy unions

title: Temple Beth Chayim Chadashim
description: Tel.931-530 "Serving the lesbian/gay and Jewish Communities" They have their own temple building and their publication is G'vavim (the Temple Newsletter). Social activities and counseling services."Everyone is welcome to attend weekly Friday evening services at 8.30pm at our Temple."

title: Flamingo
description: Tel 666-3736. Spectacular tropical garden/ Sunday afternoon garden barbecues/dancing nightly (disco & garden dance floor, also Sunday Tea-dance) freeway close to everywhere. Lighted parking, security guard. Hours Mon-Fri. 4pm-2am. Sat. & Sun. 2pm-2am. Closed Tu. Cocktail hour each Weekday 4pm-8pm. Clientele: beautiful, friendly women. FLAMINGO is about as highly rated as you can possibly get - a must when visiting L.A.

title: Dummy Up
description: (Studio City) (one block west of Laurel Canyon, on alley off Ventura) Tel. 760-9936. Friendly, casual old-timer. Mixed races and ages.

title: Faces
description: (Hollywood) Tel. 466-1094. Thu-Sat. OJ/disco. 'Monday night at the Movies'. Very highly recommended.

title: The Big Horn
description: (N Hollywood) Tel. 760-9792. A real old-timer and still going strong. 'One of the best' & 'Excellent for women who are seeking a variety of music and not having to pay a cover charge for it.

title: Oxwood Inn
description: (Van Nuys) 997-9666. Entrance in the rear (private parking).

title: Plush Pony
description: Tel. 226-9302. Women's bar. Dancing/juke box/pool/disco Fri. Sat. Open 7 days a week, 2pm-2am. 17 years old and still going strong.

title: Peanuts Disco
description: (West Hollywood) Tel. 654-0280. Mostly gay women, but 'straight couples tend to try to monopolize the dance floor' -young clientele, ultra loud music - but good. A good-time place but not the scene for a quiet chat.

title: Catch One Disco
description: Tel. 734-8849. Open Weds. through Sat. only. OJ/pool tables/video games/2 floors - the ground floor is for women. 9pm-4am Fri. + 9pm-5am Sat. Lots of birthday parties.

title: Revolver
description: Tel. 657-5583. Video bar mostly gay men, but includes the separate women's space: Dyke Lounge.

title: The Palms
description: (West Hollywood) Tel. 652-6188. A real old-timer that might be closing/changing hands in 1983. Has been picketed by WHITE WOMEN AGAINST RACISM for alleged harassment of black women. Be sure and phone first to check new details (& report back)

title: Pink Elephant
description: (Santa Monica) Tel. 399-9579. A quiet, neighborhood bar that's friendly to gay women. Pick up your copy of LESBIAN NEWS there.

title: Rogers Backdoor
description: (Culver City) Tel. 391-9088. Mostly gay men no;;, but they are trying to encourage more gay women & it is a nice place. (Located north east comer Venice Blvd. & Beethoven Avenue).

title: The Exchange Club
description: Santa Monica; 90404. A new concept in women's clubs. It operates by membership only & has super-bar nights in different locations. Disco/entertainment/great premises each time. Watch LESBIAN NEWS and/or contact GAY HOTLINE for current information. Be sure and say hi fromGAIA.

title: S.S. Friendship & Co
description: (SantaMonica) Tel. 454-9080. Good music- some dancing. Clientele: 40% gay women. Located right across from the gay beach. 10am- 2am.

title: Clones
description: Tel: 66 CLONE Membership club holds bar/disco nights in different places on different nights. Ring them for correct, current details

title: Feminist WICCA
description: (Topanga 90290) Tel. 455-1464. A matriarchal spiritual center- crafts, tools, supplies. Mail order only. $2.00 for catalogue.

title: The Inner Works
description: (Santa Monica). A women's fine art and craft gallery.

title: All's Framery
description: Tel. 398,8231. Conservation museum quality - wood & metal + framing and stretching by friendly, helpful lesbians. B~ sure and say 'hi' to Ali from GAIA.

title: The Roommate Connection
description: in French Market Tel. 822-9866. A recommended service for gay men and women.

title: The Women's Garage
description: Tel. 884-5983. Owned and operated by two women and staffed by full-time female mechanics. Oil changes to engine rebuild - We take the time to explain things to customers". Full service automotive repair. Foreign and domestic. Excellent reputation for quality and professionalism.

title: Mixed Company
description: Tel. 465-5905. Introduces lesbians to gay men and vice-versa. For marriage, escorting, introducing to parents, etc.

title: A Pair of Toucans
description: Tel. 474-4344. Lesbian owned and operated- very nice, helpful people. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Seaworthy Women
description: (Santa Monica). Tel.659-6967.Sailing adventures for women by private charter cruises and sailing classes. Write to them for full details.

title: Open Quest Institute
description: (Silverlake) Tel. 650-1812. Individual and group counseling/psycho-therapist education & training program/quit smoking plan/potlucks and lesbian 'mixers. Repertory theatre workshop and A.A. "Gay women and men working TOGETHER." Say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Frog Pond
description: (Silverlake) Tel. 660-6222. Mixed gay bar/restaurant. Sunday brunch 11 am.

title: Westwide Bar
description: Tel. 935-1274. Piano bar, low key and friendly. Mostly gay men but quite good for women too. Recommended. Open 10am-2am Sun. 11am-2am other days

title: Zoo
description: Tel. 661 7337. Owned by gay men but quite O.K. for gay women, too. Excellent food in the restaurant. Recommended.

title: On The Fringe
description: (at Heliotrope) Next to the Zoo Restaurant (Hollywood) Tel. 662-2921. Many letters recommending this place. See LESBIAN NEWS of Los Ange!Aa for current happenings.

title: The Last Drop Coffee House
description: (Silverlake) Tel. 650=0736. An alternative to the bars and a good cup of coffee. Hours: Friday and Sat. 8pm-4am.

title: Marty's
description: Tel. 272-1048. Dining/wining/desserts. Open every day from 6pm, Fn. Sat. till 1am. Clientele: mostly gay women.

title: Yukon Mining CO
description: Tel. 851-1149. Coffeeshop/restaurant open 24 hours. Chentele: lots of gay women.

title: Fellini's
description: 2 12 blocks west of Highland) Tel. 936 3100. Open from 11.30am till about 2am - Sunday brunch is especially recommended. Look for discount coupons in local LA gay publications. Also get information about the new gay bar night next door and report back.

title: Chez Andr
description: (Studio City) Tel. 508-6066. Casualdining in a warm and friendly atmosphere.

title: Golden Bull Restaurant
description: (Santa Monica) Tel. 454-2078. Steaks, seafood, and Prime Rib. The food is apparently "excellent" the clientele is now more gay men than women but quite O.K. anyway. Located 1nSanta Monica Canyon.

title: The Greenery
description: Tel. 275-9518. Restaurant with a nice little coffee-shop atmosphere. The neighborhood 1sgood & gay and gay women are always more than welcome.

title: Feminist Women's Health Center
description: 90028 Tel. 469-4844. Self-help clinic, promoting self-exam, increasing abortion care. Programs, workshops, referrals.

title: De Colores Metropolitan Community Church
description: (Eagle Rock; 90041) Tel. 257-8370. Office: 2-6pm M-Th./Sunday worship: 5.30pm. Weds. 7pm-women only. A ministry for all colors - primarily women.

title: The Church in Ocean Park
description: 90405 399-1631 & 464-7400. "Our space is available for events such as concerts, films, discussions, forums, meetings & theater". Hours: Tu + Th. Bam-4pm/W&F: 12 noon-4pm. Closed Mondays.

title: "Affirmation"
description: 90046 Tel. 851-1695. Gay Mormons, large lesbian participation. Dances, regular meeting, counseling, referrals, newsletter.

title: Southern California Women for Understanding
description: 90005 Tel. 388-2446 (714) 776-6462. Our aim is to eradicate negative stereotypical images of lesbians by example and through positive educational programs about our concerns, lifestyles, issues and lives. Has a very full range of lesbian events.

title: The Alliance for Gay Artists
description: 90069, or call them at 851-7722 press release. The Alliance for Gay Artists in the Engertainment industry was formed to encourage the responsible portrayal of homosexuals in the entertainment media. They are a group of men and women who, for the most part, are employed as craftspeople in diverse positions in the industry. They began over two years ago as an actors support group. As other artists joined, their focus expanded from interpersonal support to interaction with the entertainment community.

title: Stonewall Democratic Club
description: 90039 463-3928. The largest gay democratic club in California. Chapter in San Francisco, too

title: Southern California Physicians for Human Rights
Saga Ski Club
description: 90027T el. 877-7242. Weekend and week-long ski trips also spring and summer: river rafting, camping, Palm Springs, Hawaii. Various other social events.Gay women and men.

title: Frontrunners
description: 90405 Tel. 508-0710. A Gay-oriented running club to promote camaraderie among gay men, gay women and the running community.

title: Califia Community
description: (Studio City; 91604) Tel. 766-9194. A multi-cultural feminist organization which sponsors conferences for women. Educational programs on issues which divide women. A multi racial group which brings together women from 23-60 In hs 8th year. Weekend and week-long retreats in terrific locations, usually with swimming pool, comfortable lodge accommodation, lots of forest space, rustic, relaxing atmosphere. Sliding scale, per person about $80.00-$70.00-$50.00 per weekend. Also Women of Color Califia Conference.

title: One INC
description: 90006 Tel. 735-5252. One of the very oldest of homosexual organizations in the world. Primarily educational, some publishing, institute with MA and PhD in Homophile Studies. Lectures/social events/research library with 7000 volumes and periodicals. Membership organization- mostly men but quite a few women, too. Catalogue on request.

title: Sunset Junction Neighborhood Alliance
description: 90026 Tel. 413-6562. "We put on a street fair each August to support the gay and lesbian groups. 200,000 attendance in 1982."

title: Legal Department of Gay/Lesbian Services Center
description: Tel. 464-7400. They keep up a truly enormous file on local attorneys - broken down into their respective fields and services like military, immigration, civil rights problems, race relations, etc. -very current and accurate information.

title: Carol Waymire
description: 90026 Tel. 661-8652.  Recommended by THE GAY AND LESBIAN COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER as an extremely active lesbian-feminist attorney.

title: Gayle Wilson
description: 90048 Tel. 659-9988. Second location: 3731 Sunset Blvd. (Silverlake); 90026 tel. 665-4151.

title: Sisterhood Bookstore
description: 90024 Tel. 477-7300 and 473-9090. Complete selection of feminist and lesbian books. Also pamphlets, journals, record albums, non sexist children books, posters, jewelry, T-shirts and GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Bread & Roses
description: 91423. Tel. 986-5376. Bread and Roses carries materials of interest to women of all social, racial, ethnic and economic backgrounds. Hours Monday-Friday 10 to 6. Saturday-10 to 5.

title: A Different Light
description: 90020. Tel. 668-0629. Gay literature-periodicals - aesthetera. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE. "We are a gay/lesbian literature store carrying a complete collection of available books and periodicals. Our clientel is approximately 60% gay male - 40% lesbian. We have a small gallery space with a new show each month. Book signing and reading parties. A complete m~I order catalog ($1.50). A terrific resource center for the lesbians and gay men of Southern California."

title: Gateway Village Restaurant
description: 93644 Tel.683-8222. Specializing in Italian and American food. Beer and wine. Owned by 4 women to whom you should say 'hi' fromGAIA.

title: Gay and Lesbian Community Service Center of Orange County
description: 92643. Tel. 534-3280 (HOTLINE) 6.30- 10:30 pm; 534-0862 (COUNSELING); 534-3263 (EVENTS LINE: RECORDED ANNOUNCEMENT 24 hrs/day, 7 days/week}. Women's group and social happenings. Referrals. counseling, library, newsletter, outreach. Many activities and sub-groups. Your essential contact in Orange County. Your best bet when new to Orange County.

title: Camping Women
description: See OC calendar each month in the LESBIAN NEWS for current info/activities which include hikes, roller-skating, hot-air balloon trip, backpacking, thanksgiving weekend in the bottom of the Grand.canyon .

title: The Advocate Gay Visitors Guide to Los Angeles(& Palm Springs)
description: 94402. a guide book for gay accommodations, bars, restaurants, shops, cultural attractions for men and women. The price is $4.95 each and add $1.25 for postage and handling.

title: GAF
description: 92234 Tel. 328-9079. Disco, lounge, and Games room. Open 9pm-2am seven nights a week. OK for gay women.

title: Palm Canyon Inn
description: Tel.325-5092. Very clean rooms/direct dial phones/jacuzzi/tv. Clientele: gay men & women. Full time restaurant.

title: Palm Canyon Bar
description: Tel. 328-9000. This is the bar at the Desert Palms Inn

title: Desert Paradise Hotel
description: 92262 Tel. 352-0229 Clientele: gay men and women.

title: Desert Knight Motel
description: Tel. 325-5456. An excellent hotel with a gay clientele. Children are not allowed and there's no bar but there is a great swimming pool and the emphasis 1son relaxation. Highly recommended old-timer. Gay and straight people mixing easily together.

title: El Mirasol Villas
description: Tel. 327-5913. Gay resort/hotel - swimming pool. Studio and hotel units. $60.00-$100.00 Open year round.

title: Hideaway
description: 92270 Tel.346-4720.Friendly people, lots of privacy, large swimming pool, volleyball court, color TV. shuffle board. 50% gay women and very, very highly recommended. Jacuzzi and most rooms have their own kitchens.

title: Gay/Lesbian Line of Stanford
description: Tel. 497-1488. gay events tape, includes info about the Women's Collective.

title: The Plowshare
description: 94301 Tel. 321-4748. General bookstore with many gay, lesbian and women's titles. They also sell women's records, offer meeting space, bulletin board and reading tables and are an excellent contact for local women's events information. MAIL ORDER SERVICE. They also sell GAIA'S GUIDE

title: Robyn's Travel
description: Tel. 328-5375. Special travel for special people .. women have a welcome here.

title: Holy Trinity Church/ San Gabriel Valley
description: Church Activity Center.  91101 Tel. 357-8529. Serving the spiritual needs of our gay and lesbian community. 4pm Sunday Services. Rev Joan G Johnson, Pastor.

title: Vermie's
description: (at Michilinda) Tel. 578-9359. Dancing, pool table. Local clientele -good atmosphere. Open Mon-Thurs 4pm-2am. Fn & Sat noon-2am; Sunday noon-midnight. Very, very highly recommended. Activities: sponsor softball and bowling teams. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Daily Double
description: Tel. 578-9701. Pool table,jukeboxx, club-like atmosphere. Open Sat and Sun 1pm-2am. Mon-Wed 5pm-midnight. Very, very highly recommended.

title: Page One
description: 91101 Tel.792-9011. We have a complete list of lesbian and feminist books. Also: records, buttons. jewelry, posters. T shirts, magazines and bulletin board. We sell GAIA'S GUIDE. Catalogues: $1 for the adult list. $.50 for the children's list.' Open Mon-Sat 10am-8pm; Sunday 12-4pm. Fri 10am-8pm

title: Chatterton's
description: 91101 Tel. 681-6803. Gay and feminist books and periodicals.

title: The Pomona/San Gabriel Valley Gay/Lesbian Coalition
Robbie's
description: 91766. Tel. 622 9511. Disco every night except Mon (closed Mon). Piano bar/video games/pool table. Woman owned and operated. Occasional live shows. Open 12 noon - 2am.

title: Bogie's
description: (at Sacramento) Tel. 243-7869. Dancing/pool table. Open from 3pm daily.

title: Calvary Metropolitan Community Church (MCC)
description: Tel. 368-0188. Sunday worship at 5pm/Thurs program at 7pm.

title: The Answer
description: 94063. Tel. 361-9444. Dance bar. Games.Recommended. Pool tables. Open from 4pm-2am.

title: The Advocate Gay Visitors Guide to San Francisco (& The Russian River)
description: Order from The Advocate, PO Box 5847, San Mateo, Calif, 94402. A Guide Book for gay accommodation, bars. restaurants, shops, cultural attractions, for men and women. The price is $4.95 each and add $1.25 for postage and handling

title: The Drum
description: Tel. 869-0656. Big disco in DRUMS RESORT. Shared with FIFE'S and open to the public. Clientele: gay & straight.

title: Rusty Nail
description: Tel. 887-1322. A gay people's bar and restaurant. Dancing/pool table/outdoor patio area. Highly recommended old-timer.

title: Fife's Resort
description: write PO Box 45. Location: 16467 River Road Tel. 869-0656. 14_acres located right on the banks of the Russian River. Elegant main lodge with decks overlooking our pool and rustic cabins & campsites. Dining room, games and bar. Your best bet ,n the Russian River area. Excellent reports. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Wildwood Ranch
description: 95446 Tel. 632.5321. A wonderful spot- a mixed retreat for gay women and men - ideal for relaxing. Especially great for couples. Swimming pool, jacuzzi, great hiking. Owner: Nicholas.' Very highly recommended.

title: The Willows
description: Tel.869-~279. The main house over looks the river and the lawn goes right down to the river. Canoeing/kitchen privileges. Very friendly & highly recommended.

title: Drums
description: Tel. 869-0656. Swimming pool/bar/dancing. Clientele: gay women and men. Recommended.

title: Highlands Resort
description: Tel. 869-0333. Hot-tub/lounge area/rustic cabins/inn-like atmosphere, beautiful swimming pool.

title: Mom Guess What!...(MGW)
description: 95814 (no 2041Tel. 456-5858 Totally non-sexist, non-porn gay newspaper~A gold mine of local resource information. , it's a must when visiting the Sacramento area. Pick up a copy at LIONESS or most of the locations listed here in GAIA'S GUIDE. If you visit their office, be sure and say h1from GAIA They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: 95817 Tel. 454- 4762. Social activities and services Sundays 11am & 7:15pm. The reverend is a lesbian and so is most of the congregation. A good place to pick up your copy of MOM . GUESS WHAT!

title: Dignity
description: Tel. 448-3777. See MOM .. GUESS WHAT' for current details. Gay women and men/Catholics.

title: Our River City Family
description: c/o MOM GUESS WHAT! Tel. 457-7589 or (MGW) 456-5858. Extremely active and successful social group of gay women and men.

title: Camping Women
description: Tel. 424-5100. "We provide camping trips for women'. This group is a real old-timer and still has an excellent reputation. The ideal alternative to the bar scene, it offers outdoor activities and social events too numerous to mention here.

title: Women Over 35
description: Tel. (Dean) at 371-3496 or see MOM GUESS WHAT! for current meetings and pot-lucks. Recommended as being very friendly people.

title: National Organization of Women (NOW)
description: 95807 Tel. 443-3470. Lesbian and feminist political interests.

title: Anne- Marie's (ne The Hut)
description: THE place for women to go in the Sacramento area. Many, many recommendations. Disco dancing/dj.

title: Parking Lot
description: Tel. 482-7772. This is the largest gay complex in the world. The swimming pools (one olympic size) disco dancing/2 bars/volleyball/sauna/ barbecue pits/great entertainment nights. Clientele: fluctuates between being more men, some times, and more women, sometimes. Tennis courts too.

title: Diamond Butterfly (ne Jason's Pub)
description: Tel. 366-9392. A women's bar/woman-owned. Some straight clientele too, I think. Your reports?

title: Bojangles
description: Tel. 383-9882. VERY young crowd. I think it's mixed gay/straight. Closed Tues.

title: Mercantile
description: The oldest gay bar in Sacramento.

title: The City/Broadway
description: Tel. 731-8226. THE CITY is the restaurant and BROADWAY is the disco. Clientel: mostly gay men but Thursday nights are best for women. Disco weekends.

title: Earhart's Cafe
description: (at 'S' Street) Tel. 442-2481. A highly recommended woman-owned restaurant. They feature local women's art and are open for lunch 1lam-3pm Mon-Fri; Dinner 6-11pm Weds-Saturday. Now featuring women's entertainment nights.

title: Pava's
description: Great food/clientele: lots of gay women

title: E&G's Cuisinery
description: Downtown Auburn Tel. 5588. Serving lunch and dinner. Relaxed country dining in an 1886 house. Closed Sundays and Mondays.

title: Lioness Bookstore
description: 95816 Tel. 442 4657. Their selection of lesbian buttons, cards, T shirts and books is excellent. They have the largest selection of feminist literature in the area. The women who run the store are friendly and helpful. Closed Sun & Mon - open Tues to Fri, noon-8pm/Sat noon-6pm. This is a new (projected! location as of March, 1983, so there might be a change in phone number and hours. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Continental Motel
description: West Sacramento 95961 Tel. 371-3660. Daily and weekly rates: kitchen units, direct dial phones, color TV and pool. Hot spa, barb q area. Next to shopping and bus line. Queen, king and water beds. Swimming pool. 'We are just 4 blocks from ANNE-MARIE'S & Gaywomen are more than welcome here'. Sayhi from GAIA.

title: The Aquarian Effort's Walk-In Health Clinic
San Bernardino Gay Hotline
description: Tel. 824-7618. Hotline/info/referrals/personal support. 7 nights per week from 6.30-10.30pm. Serving San Bernardino/Riverside

title: San Bernardino Gay Center
description: Tel. 824 7618/Hotline. Lending library/peer counselling/ rap groups/mediation & arbitration commission and speakeri bureau.

title: Big Mary's
description: Tel. 885-9243. A women's bar with jukebox, 2 pool tables, 2 pm-ball machines. Beer and wine only. Some gay men, sometimes. Highly recommended. Dance floor. Open 7 days a week from 3pm-2am.

title: Robin's Nest
description: 92404 Tel. 885-7068. Bar/restaurant service lunch from 1lam-2pm Mon-Fri, and Sunday brunch

title: Skylark
description: 2408 Tel. 885-9151. Pool tables/pinball/no food. Basically a men's cruise bar. Open noon-2am. 24 years old. Same ownership as BIG MARY'S

title: Stagedoor
description: (Highland)Tel. 862-9884. Small, intimate cocktail bar. Pool table, no dancing. Open 4pm-2am.

title: Two Doors Down
description: (Highland).Beerandwine till 2am/coffee and soft drinks after 2am. Video and piano bar.

title: Grand Central
description: 92401. Tel. 889-5204. Disco/young crowd/closed Mon/ cover charge on weekends.

title: Thursday's Child
description: La Jolla; 92037 Tel. 456-0957. Lesbian/feminist newspaper for the San Diego area. Includes DATE MATE column- complete events calender. Also news, reviews, poetry. Subscription/donation: $10.00 per year.

title: The PR Room
description: Tel. 257-2598. Beer and wine bar. Disco/video games/ pool tables. Open 7 days a week 4pm-2am. Be sure and say Hi from GAIA.

title: The Other Side
description: 94915. Strictly social group for gay women only_.Potlucks, dances, dinners, swimming parties, cookouts, hikes, card and game nights, bar nights and anything else you want. It's a real old-timer and one of the very best of its kind anywhere in the world. Monthly newsletter. Membership: $14.00 per year. Also couple memberships and newsletter subscription.

title: Papa Beach Paperbacks
description: 90025 Tel. 478-2374. Gay literature and small press publications. Open Mon-Thurs 9.30am-11 pm; Fri & Sat midnight. Sun noon-9pm.

title: Daybreak
description: 94040. Tel. 961-9953. Disco-lighted built up dance floor/pool tables and game machines/backgammon and chess. They feature Olivia recording artists and have womyn's concerts. After hours it's coffee, juices, rap sessions and feminist meetings. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and are very highly recommended. Beer and wine bar.

title: Chatterton's
description: 90027 tel. 664-3882. Gay & feminist books and periodicals. Open Mon-Sat: 10am-11pm. Sun: Noon-9pm.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of the Redwoods
description: 94941. Worship at Mill Valley Community Church, 8 Olive Street, Mill Valley; 94991. Worship 11am Sundays. Pot luck dinner Thur-sat 7pm, phone for location. Very nice people, say hi from GAIA.

title: The Book Shop in Ocean Park
description: 90405 Tel. 396-3659. Large selection of feminist books.

title: Brave Bull
description: 95351. Tel. 529-6712. Holds 500 people/great music/ pool tables/video games/seating capacity for 200 people. Free hot dogs with the munchies. Clientele: all gay-60% men, 40% women. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Willow
description: 94558 Tel. 944-8173. A secluded, get-away-from-it-all women s retreat on 40 acres, located one hour north of San Francisco in the mountains. A large wood and glass structure with hot tub, sauna, tennis court and swimming pool. Private bedrooms with bath for single or double or group occupancy. Trails for hiking or jogging. Intimate, comfortable and relaxing. A beautiful environment ... a very special place. Reservations required.

title: Casbah
description: Tel. 328-9000. This is the bar at the Desert Palms Inn.

title: Feminist Spirituality Center
description: 95822 Tel. 451-9970. Occult-astrology group. Ring this number and a Goddess-Rising Coordinator will return your call.

title: The Center For Women's Studies and Services (CWSS)
description: Tel. 233-8984. Feminist free university/film nights/self-defense/discussions/working women's lunch programs/exhibitions. Their newsletter: Feminist Bulletin.

title: Lesbian and Gay Community Center
description: 92102 Tel.692-4297 (24 hour hotline). Legal, medical, counseling, referrals, employment, rap groups, social events. Gay AA, speakers bureau. Military counseling/housing referrals.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Church: 4333 30th Street Tel. 280-4333. Sundayservices at 1Oam& 7pm. Also 8pm Weds. All kinds of other activities. Many gay women participate. Their publication: THE PRODIGAL.

title: Lesbians of Color
description: Info Tel. 280-3186 or 477-2926. Write PO Box 5602; 92105. Rap groups 2nd and 4th Sundays of each month at 2.00 pm.

title: Frontrunners
description:
Tel. (714) 295-4566. A positive oriented
RESTAURANTS running group for gay women and men runners. Visitors and newcomers always welcome.

title: Great Outdoors (GO)/Headquarters Office
description: 92138. Tel. (714)464-6983. A non-profit gay organization offering low-cost outdoor and social activities for women and men. Day hikes, backpacking, camping, outdoor education, snow and water skiing, bicycle rides, picnics and Chapter meetings. Monthly newsletter for activities calendar. Contact them for your own local group in: Orange County/Palm Springs/Pomona-San Gabriel Valley/ Riverside-SanBernardino etc, & Arizona: Phoenix and Tucson- new chapters all the time.

title: Amazon Sweet Shop
description: (in Campus Shopping Center) Tel. 286-9987. Woman-owned lesbian hang-out serving the best tasting ice-cream in the world., It's all home-made and they serve natural fruit drinks and spring water. Bulletin board/feminist and lesbian periodicals on sale. Open: Tues-Sun noon-11pm. Highly recommended. I get many letters all the time saying what friendly helpful people the women of AMAZON SWEETSHOP are.

title: The Club
description: Tel.239-4377. Cozy tables for sitting and talking... pin, ball, pool table, small dance floor and the music is good. 'Great atmosphere' Sundayafternoon, is showtime. 'Stop by after the beach ... come as you are.' Now fully air-conditioned, Two, bars: front= disco, back= quiet, conversation atmosphere. Both have dance floors and pool tables. Tuesday nights there~ a live band in the front bar. Highly recommended. The sign inside the door says 'This is a lesbian bar. You are a guest of the lesbian community; please bear this in mind and behave accordingly.

title: The Apartment
description: (on Mission Beach) Tel. 488-0033. Small, popular, active woman-owned bar. Great juke box, bar, pool table, fireplace and at-home atmosphere. Near the Boardwalk. Open: noon-2am. Monday nights: football on video screen. Tues and Weds: free videoscreen movies and happy hour prices.

title: The Rendezvous
description: Tel. 233-8483. Pool tables/darts/pinball. Open daily noon-2am. Daily specials and weekend specials. Clientele: gay men about 60%, gay women about 40%. Beer, wine, dancing nightly.

title: The Box Office
description: Tel. 284-5644. 'Nice atmosphere. Pool tables. Plenty of room for dancing. No cover charge. Video games. 95% women.' Very, very highly recommended. Opened in 1982. Especially popular with women of color.

title: Nickelodeon
description: Tel. 284-9518. Draft and bottled beers, fine wine. Open Mon-Fri 4pm-8pm, happy hour. A small bar (20x40)/video games/pinball.

title: Sorino's Dance Palace
description: (between Texas and Mississippi Streets) Tel. 298-8686. It's huge & wild. Big dance floor, DJ/video games/3 service bars. Recent reports are 'VERYmixed - everybody and everything.'

title: Park Palace
description: Tel. 299-7086. 'Fashioned after the game of Monopoly, this bar-restaurant combo is a pleasant change from the disco scene. PARK PLACE is a small bar with a pool table- a good place to take a friend for a drink and talk. THE BOARDWALK CAFE is an elegant restaurant serving dinner, lunch and brunch. Really reasonable prices and good wine and things like homemade soups. Outdoorflining too! No reservations required. Open 4pm-2am/4am. Clientele: mostly gay men but always some women there too - and always most welcome.

title: New Seed
description: Tel. 270-7620. Juice bar and tea room using over 400 different herbs; also natural food items.

title: The Farmhouse
description: Tel. 226-8300. Good homestyle cooking.Lunch 11am-2pm. Dinner 5pm-1Opm. Champagne brunch Sat & Sun 1Oam-3pm. Closed Sunday evening.

title: Kung Food
description: nr Balboa Park. Tel. 298-9232. Vegetarian cuisine 'in an atmosphere conducive to health, relaxation and enjoyment.' Open 9am-9pm. Closes Monday at3pm.

title: The Sandwich Factory
description: Tel. 235-6142. Full Delicatessen, homemade pies and desserts, and the tastiest sandwiches in town. Serving all of San Diego's Gay Community.

title: King Richard
description: (La Jolla) Tel. 454-6592. Lounge open: 10am-2am. Dining room: 6pm-1Opm Sun-Thurs, 6pm-11 Saturdays. Restaurant and pub.

title: The Prophet: International Vegetarian Restaurant
description: Tel. 283-7448. Survival food from the sea. 'PLANKTON is a total food source containing all the vitamins and minerals necessary for life. We are featuring these Spirulina plankton drinks: Plankton Smoothie, Prana High Cocktail, Neptune Seafood Delight, Radiant Light Mint Julep.' Lunch: Wed-Fri 11.30am-2.30m. Dinner: Tues-Thurs, Sun, 5.30-l0pm. Fri, Sat 5.30pm-11pm. Closed Monday.

title: Charmed Circle Feminist Books
description: 92116 (One block south of Adams) Tel. 296-9024. Records and tapes, non-sexist children's books, women's reading room, lesbian literature, cards and posters, women's art and jewelry. Hours: Tues-Fri 12 noon-7pm. Sat 10am-6pm. Sun 12 noon-5pm.

title: Plum's Books
description: Tel. 299-7098. Alternative bookstore with gay titles/feminist titles and magazines and newspapers. Open every day; Fridaysand Saturdays until 10pm.

title: The Book Mark
description: 92116 Tel. 280-3091. Gay and feminist titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and are open Mon-Thurs 1Oam-6pm, Fri & Sat 1Oam-midnight. Near Ken Cinema Bookstore and cafe. Now, they have their own cafe featuring coffee, tea, light menu. Taped classical music in the background.

title: Grass Roots Cultural Center Books & Records
description: 92102 Tel. 232-5009. Gay titles, feminist titles and GAIA'S GUIDE. New in 1982. Alternative bookstore.

title: Bookstop III
description: 92115. Tel. 582-2121. Well stocked bookstore with feminist titles and much, much more. Hours Mon-Sat 11am-9pm. Sunday noon-9pm.

title: Lysistrata Gallery
description: (at 30th) Tel. 235-8649 and 234-2500. 'The gallery proudly specializes in showing and selling art created by women artists and as part of its non-sexist policy happily encourages male artists to participate. The format is informal to outrageous. Shows change each month with a festive opening party with live music. Women's rock bands/workshops/seminars/artists' exchange/jam sessions.

title: Hotel Newport
description: 92107 Tel. 224-9406. TV lounge/private patio/ security building 12 block to the beach. Rates from $12.00 per night single/$19.45 double. Also cheap weekly rates. 10-15 minutes from the bars.A recommended hotel for gay women and men.

title: Imperial Motel
description: (East San Diego) Tel. 463-9245. 'A place where two people can feel comfortable asking for one bed.' Motel. $26.00 per day/$140.00 per week.

title: Clarke's Lodge
description: 92101 Tel. 234-6787. Color TV, pool, direct dial room phones, air conditioned. Now featuring cable TV and transport from trains & bus, etc. Rates $25.00 single or double/$33.00 for 2-4 persons. Motel.

title: Travel World Emporium
description: 92103 Tel. 299-8747 and 299-Trip. 'For special travellers'. Gay bus tours.

title: Sharron Voorhees
description: Tel. 298-8450. Attorney At Law. State Bar-certified family law specialist. Wills/partnerships/living together agreements/joint purchase agreements/dissolution of joint purchases/divorce/arbitration of property disputes.

title: Catherine Kroger
description: 92104. Attorney At Law. Partnership agreements/Personal injury - all accidents/DUI/Traffic violations/Immigration/ Wills & Probates/Lesbian & Gay Matters.

title: Ann Mellusi And Mary Joe Wagner
description: 92102 Tel. 231-1610. Individual counseling/lesbian couple counselling. Fees arranged on an individual basis.

title: The Lesbian Clinic
description: (Pacific Beach) 92109 Tel. 488-8325. The Lesbian Clinic is part of the Women's Clinic. 'Sensitive GYN care with women counselors and practitioners.'

title: Stepping Stone
type: Alcoholism, Chemical Dependency, Drug Abuse Counseling

title: The Advocate Gay Visitors Guide to San Francisco
description: Order from The Advocate, 94402. A Guide Book for gay accommodations, bars, restaurants, shops, cultural attractions, for men and women. The price is $4.95 each and add $1.25 for postage and handling.

title: Gay Youth Community News
description: 94114 Tel. 552-6025. News, a calendar of events, a list of resources, a legal column, a health column and advertisements from businesses which welcome Gay Youth. THE ONLY NATIONALLY CIRCULATING NEWSLETTER ADDRESSING THE STRUGGLE OF LESBIAN AND GAY YOUNG PEOPLE. $7.00 per year.

title: Gay Events Tape
description: 94114. Tel. 861-1100. Operates 24 hours to promote community events and non-profit organizations that serve Lesbians and Gays in ttie San Francisco Bay Area. It's a 3 minute taped minute which talks too damned fast. You can buy advertising time on it. I probably will.

title: San Francisco Women's Switchboard
description: Tel. 431-1414. Operates 6pm-8pm evenings. Taped message other times.

title: San Francisco Beat
description: Tel. 552-1312. Taped message which reads you all the gay news from everywhere/USA. Includes some macabre horror.stories punctuated with cheerful jingle-music. It's a riot. Office: 174 Henry Street, the contact News Hotline is 564-8912.

title: Gay Referral Switchboard
description: 94101 Tel. 992-5255. We are a telephone referral service for gay women and men in the Bay area.' Barn-midnight.

title: Gay Youth Community Switchboard
description: 94101. Tel. 552-6025. Providing referrals: housing, emergency housing, food, clothing, jobs, medical services, mental health services for Lesbians and Gay Youth. Also information about social events, activities and services for Lesbian and Gay Youth. Hours: 10.00am-4.00pm. After hours please leave a message. Request input from other organizations.

title: Women's Building
description: 94110. Tel. 863-5255 or 431-1180. To book events tel. 552-2709. Information, technical assistance and support for existing and emerging Bay area's women's Social change groups. Additional phone 431-6944. Monthly newsletter $3.00 per year- includes a calendar of events for women. Drop-in room, lesbian rap groups, + VIDA gallery. (864-VIDA). WOMEN'S BUILDING staff are on duty Mon-Sat noon-5pm.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: At the Gay Community Center, 150 Eureka.Tel. 863-4434.

title: Bay Area Career Women
description: 94114. Social events include alternation business meetings and seminars with dinners and dances. A great group - write for newsletter.

title: Samois
description: 94101. A support & social group for women interested in SIM - sexuality based on a consensual exchange of power. Write well in advance for meeting times and/or see PLEXUS.

title: Support Group For Slightly Older Lesbians
description: at the Women's Building, Dover Hall 3543-18th Street Tel. 431-1180. They meet Weds at 7.30-9.30pm. Child care arranged with 24 hour notice. Slightly older =over thirties (gawd, where would that put me??)

title: Gay Youth Community Coalition of the Bay Area
description: 94114. Tel. 552-6025. The coalition works on projects which will benefit young gay people throughout the Bay Area and the country.

title: Lesbian Rights Project
description: 4th Floor, San Francisco CA 94103. Tel. 621-0675. Providing day-to-day counseling and legal representation to lesbians who, because of their sexual orientation, experience a multitude of legal problems. A non-profit public interest law firm, clients are not charged attorney's fees. Priority is always given to lesbians who cannot afford a private attorney.

title: Clementina's Baybrick Inn
description: Tel. 431-8334. Bar/restaurant/disco/ accommodation. Extremely nice. Opened September 1982. Too many rave reviews keep coming in for me to repeat all the recommendations. Anyway, it's lesbian-owned, THE new place to go in San Francisco & my friend Karen likes it better than the greengrocers.

title: Olive's Oil's
description: Tel. 495-3099. Small and intimate, located right on San Francisco Bay. Community minded. The bar of your dreams. New in 1982.

title: Maud's
description: 94117. Tel. 731-6119. Dancing, entertainment. pool table, ping pong and an outdoor rear patio for summertime drinking. It has a friendly atmosphere and is highly recommended. Open: noon-2am everyday of the year. 17years inbusiness (now, there is one fact I didn't need to be told).

title: Peg's Place
description: (Between 11th and 12th Ave.) Tel. 668-5050. Cozy fireplace in front, disco in back. Dancing, pool table and other games. Very highly recommended. Open 4pm-2am. "Probably your best bet in San Francisco if you're on your own." Regulars are older professional types.

title: Macante's (ne Kito's)
description: (at 17th Street) Tel. 861-4783. Very highly recommended lesbian bar. Happy hour/pinball and card games - just remodeled featuring 'the living room sofa'. Women's entertainment nights. Open 4m-2am. Highly recommended.

title: Amelia's
description: (between 17th and 18th Streets) Tel. 552-7788. Upstairs/downstairs bar& disco. Very large, crowded and the DJ is great. Lesbian cruise bar, friendly. It's been remodeled, still has no locks on the powder room doors, however. Not the place to go for a quiet chat.

title: A Little More
description: (at Potrero). Tel. 864-9123. A real old-timer. It's very popular, a small place built around the dance floor, recommended.

title: Scott's
description: Tel. 864-9534. Your friendly neighborhood lesbian leather bar. Black/3rd world, friendly and fun.

title: Cafe San Marcos
description: Tel. 861-3846. 'Small and classy'. Recommended. However, more women use the restaurant than they do the bar. The restaurant is open 1Oam-11.30pm and the bar from noon-2.30am.

title: Valencia Rose
description: Tel. 552-1445. Many recommendations. Hostel accommodation too-very, very inexpensive. Located right near the Women's Building.

title: Finocchio's
description: Broadway. '4 shows a night, they're all different and they're all good. Audiences invited to stay for as many shows as they wish without paying any further admission charge. An extremely entertaining and friendly place. The cover charge was $5.00.'

title: Fanny's
description: Tel.621-5570. Lunch and dinner and entertainment nightly.

title: Artemis Society
description: 94110. Tel. 647-4144. Women's cafe/ coffeehouse. They serve a wide variety of sandwiches, salads, quiches, beer and wine. Special happenings with good food and atmosphere. Very highly recommended, especially the Sundaybrunch. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Cafe Commons
description: 94110 Tel. 282-2928. We are a woman-owned coffee house with a large menu plus beers and wine. Outdoor deck area and patio.'Open7days a week; 7am-9pm/M-F & 9am-9pm Sat/Sun/holidays... a place that's very, very highly recommended for gay women and their gay men friends. (Located right nearArmy Street)

title: Mary Midgett's Coffeehouse
description: 94117 Tel. 864-0876. Coffeehouse evenings in a private home. An alternative to the bar scene - rap groups/ entertainment/poetry readings and women singers. Open every Friday from 6pm-10pm. Admission charge is $5.00. Sounds good... but... there are conflicting reports. Play back, please.

title: Nosheria
description: 94108 Tel. 398-3557. A woman-owned and operated restaurant featuring terrific sandwiches and desserts. Outdoor seating,open Mon-Sat, 7am- 6pm.

title: The Neon Chicken
description: 'More than just another restaurant'. Very, very gay.'

title: PS
description: Tel. 441-7798. Continental cuisine, dinner, and lunch. Entertainment. Open 11am-2am.Very highly recommended.'The service (by an all gay staff)was superb, the atmosphere was great, and the food was stupendous. Piano bar.

title: Church Street Station
description: Tel. 861-1266. 24 hour all gay coffee shop and restaurant. Recommended.

title: Noble Pies
description: (near Diamond) Tel. 826-7437. Gay owned and operated restaurant and take-away.

title: Fickle Fox
description: Tel. 433-4922. Most gay men but quite okay. They serve good food.

title: Old Wives Tales
description: 94110. Tel.821-4675. Women's visions and books. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and have been extremely helpful. Open Mon-Fri Noon-7pm. Sat: 10am-6pm, Thursday:noon-9pm, Sunday noon-5pm. Thursday night events.

title: Modern Times
description: (between 20th and 21st) Tel. 282-9246. Very, very large selection of feminist and gay literature. Send $1.00 for 96 page catalogue. Also many non-sexist children's books.

title: Multi Media Resource Center
description: 94109. Tel.673-5100. A very good alternative bookstore with feminist and lesbian books, posters, T shirts, vibrators. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE. Catalogue available

title: Wing Cafe
description: 92102 Tel. 239-9906 & 239 9709. Lesbian and feminist coffeehouse that also houses a woman's art gallery and cabaret theater. Open: Mon-Fri 7.30am-4.30pm and Fri/Sat 7.30pm-11.30pm. 'Going strong'. Say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Walt Whitman Bookshop
description: 94109. Tel. 771-9754. Alternative book- store, gay/lesbian titles, catalogue $1.00.

title: Bound Together Book Collective
description: (near Ashbury); 94117 Tel. 668-2785. Gay titles, women's titles.

title: Paperback Traffic
description: 94109 (near California Street) Tel. 771-8848. Good selection of feminist books. They sell Gaia's Guide.

title: City Lights Books
description: (near Broadway) 94133. Tel. 362-8193. Gay titles, women's titles.

title: Charing Cross Road
description: Tel. 552-4122. New & previously read books/includes a good women's section.

title: Aardvark Books
description: (near 14th Street) 94114. Tel. 552-6733. Gay Titles, feminist titles.

title: Sunset Boulevard
description: (near 6th Avenue) 94118. Tel. 387-2272. Gay titles, women's titles.

title: Civic Center Books
description: (near Larkin) 94102 Tel. 885-5072. Gay titles, women's titles.

title: Studio
description: 94110. Tel. 641-9299. Art gallery/films/slides/courses/open mike poetry nights. A women's art center. Gallery hours: 12 noon-8pm.

title: Aura Occult Shop
description: 94110 Tel. 641-1710. The best of psychic oils and tarot cards. Spiritual and astrological services available. Open by appointment. Brochure $3.00. We are not for profit.

title: Fantasy Tours
description: 94107 Tel 821-6888. A San Francisco Gay Visitors' Personalized Service Bureau. Relocation service for those moving to San Francisco/Bay area. Comfortable accommodation in private gay homes. Complete, updated listings of gay bars, restaurants, etc in the Bay Area. Financial and secretarial services.

title: Good Vibrations
description: Tel. 282-2202. 'We have a large selection of electric and battery-run vibrators at very reasonable prices. We are happy to counsel our customers about vibrators and have a try-out room. mail order catalogue: $0.25. Open Mon-Sat noon-6pm. Also books.

title: Labyris
description: 94103 Tel. 861-8668. Extremely reliable, extremely helpful. Domestic and foreign cars/no body work/tow service can be provided. Very high quality work in business a long time and still going strong. Many, many recommendations for them.

title: Awards By Chris
description: (at25th) Tel.282-0795.Custom medals/trophies/ plaques and engravings.Friendly, helpful, highly skilled womyn.

title: Bed-By-The-Bay
description: Sausalito, California 94966. Tel.383-7430/453-6405/334 7262.'Offers you a comfortable lodging with a gracious gay host in a variety of San Francisco locations.'Prices from $23.00to $56.00 per day.

title: Clementina's Baybrick Inn
description:
Tel.431-8334. Hotel for women and bar/restaurant/disco. Lesbian-owned and operated. Champagne breakfast especially recommended by Karen.Besides that, the rooms themselves are clean, comfortable and
KABUKI HOT SPRINGS:1750 Geary Boulevard(at Fillmore)Tel. 922-6000. Sunday and Tuesday 10am-10pm is women only. Large jacuzzi/steam/cold tubs. Admission is $7.00. Acupressure available. Located in the JapaneseCenter.
charming.Quite reasonable.

title: New Women's Inn
description: 94110Tel. 285-4140.Women-only hotel/rooming house.Very friendly place, very reasonable rates. My friend Dee stayed there and said,'I was the only straight woman thereI!!! Very, very highly recommended

title: Valencia Rose
description: Tel. 552-1445.Extremely inexpensive hostel-type accommodation for gay women and men. It is, in fact, the winter quarters of James-the Token.Highly recommended, of course

title: Hotel York
description: 94109Tel. 885-6800. A 102-room luxury gay-owned and operated European-style hotel conveniently located in downtown San Francisco. Home of THE PLUSH ROOM CABARET which is a must when in San Francisco.

title: Spreckles Mansion
description: 94117 Tel.626-5460. This famous mansion with 'chequered' history is now an extremely comfortable and hospitable hotel. Continental breakfast and complimentary afternoon wine served in the library.The clientele is gay men/women and others. The atmosphere is very San Francisco. We've now expanded to the grand old house next door- giving us four additional suites.'All the rooms are exquisite and gay women seem to JUST LOVE IT. Don't forget to sayHi from GAIA

title: Mary Elizabeth Inn
description: Tel.673-6768. Rooms by the week/with meals. Women only but it has a curfew.

title: Red Victorian Hotel
description: 94117 Tel. 864-1978. Clean, comfortable, a good place for gay people

title: El Dorado
description: 94103 Tel.552-4660. 'A nice clean comfortable place with terrific service, owned by a friendly gay guy who does welcome women although the clientele is mostly gay men. About $32.00for 2 a day without bath.

title: Women's Training Center
description: 94114 Tel. 864-6835.Women's Gym and Weight Training Center. Restaurant service, and Nautilus Equipment/free weights/experienced trainers/sauna& massage.$100.00 membership for three months. $5.00 for one visit. They really are friendly, helpful people

title: Osento
description: Tel. 282-6333. In fact. there is nothing else like it int he whole world - a Japanese-style bath house for women only. Based on one in Japan, it has one jacuzzi, ultra-relaxing atmosphere- all very dimly lit by soft blue lights.The background1s mellow, futuristic Japanese music. There is a small patio iz back.$6.00 entrance.Massage ($15.00)is also available

title: Kabuki Hot Springs
description: (at Fillmore)Tel. 922-6000. Sunday and Tuesday 10am-10pm is women only. Large jacuzzi/steam/cold tubs. Admission is $7.00. Acupressure available. Located in the Japanese Center

title: Sutro Bathhouse
description: Tel. 626-9444.'Garden like setting-very dimly lit. Sauna, steam bath, snack bar, hot-tub.' Sunday from 6pm-midnight is women only. A sexually oriented sauna with lesbian-only nights. Ring up and report back

title: The East West Healing Center
description: (at Sanchez) Tel.863-1980 Hours are from 9am to 5pm on Wednesdays.The clinic offers both diagnostic and therapeutic services through acupuncture and Chinese herbal medicine.The clinic will concentrate much of its effort on treatingSTS(sexually transmitted diseases)

title: Lyon-Martin Women's Health Services
description: 94115 Tel. 921-1243. All women staff - mostly gay. The hours are 6pm-1Opm. The emphasis is on preventive medicine.Lesbian health problems are given top priority. Monday is general clinic night and Wednesday is for gynecology

title: Buena Vista Women's Services
description: Tel. 771-5000. Lesbian gynecology clinic. Moderate fees.

title: Acceptance House
description: 94115 Tel. 931-4994. Acceptance House is the oldest gay residential treatment program in the nation.
type: Alcoholism, Chemical Dependency, Drug Abuse Counseling

title: LAMDA News
description: 95159 office 615 Stockton Ave 95126 Tel. 295-1340. Non-sexist gay monthly newspaper. Includes a very handy directory for the entire area. Pick up your copy in any of the places listed here.

title: Our Paper
description: 95126. Tel. 289-1088/297-9506. Santa Clara County's bi-weekly gay newspaper. Well balanced from every point of view, it's an excellent source of resource material. Free in most bars/$12.00for a six-month subscription.

title: Billy de Frank Lesbian & Gay Community Center
description: (between south 2nd and south 3rd)Tel.293-4525/hotline and info. 293/AGAY after-hours and business line. Lesbian rap group, Friday evening. Women's coffeehouse,Wednesday evening. Slightly older lesbian group/GayAA/youth group/disabled group. Open Mon 6pm-9pm Tues, Weds, Fri etc 6pm-9pm.

title: The Savoy
description: (Cupertino)Tel. 446-0948. Video games/live entertainment nights. Open 7 days a week 2pm-2am. Sunday brunch.

title: Buck's Saloon & Ice Cream Parlour
description: Tel. 279-9825. Fancy ice-cream and drinks/dance floor/video games/pool tables/ lounge bar. Separate video games room. Open daily from 11am-2am.

title: Kevin's
description: (Cupertino). Kevin also owns the women's bar TOYON.

title: Interlude
description: Tel.244-2829. Piano bar and dancing. Gay women use the restaurant more than they do the bar.

title: Dean Enterprises
description: 95159. Introducing a Northern California gay/bi dating service for men and women. Confidential, reliable, convenient. Mail forwarding service available. Meet by phone or mail.

title: The Mediation Institute of California
description: 95110. Tel. 298-5353. Chuck Foley MS- Specializing in relational mediation, divorce, child custody, runaway negotiations, etc, etc.

title: Journey/s Inn
description: 93401. Tel. 543-1177. Disco dancing. Open 1pm-2am and very, very highly recommended. Snacks served. Happy hour 5-7pm, $1.50 pitcher beer, day Tuesday. One visitor's comment: 'mixed, friendly crowd, good tunes and good vibes. The atmosphere is nice.'

title: B Stree
description: Tel. 348-4045. Bar and restaurant. The bar is about 100% gay: men 80%, women 20%. Sunday brunch is especially recommended. During the week- daytimes, the restaurant has a mixed gay/straight clientele and is a bit on the expensive side but the food is excellent.

title: BJ's
description: 94901 Tel. 454-3722. Gay women and men mixing together equally and happily. Not a fancy place but a good feeling. And fun. Highly recommended by WISHING WELL.

title: Dignity
description: Orange County 92701. Tel. 972-1509. Liturgies, raps, many activities.

title: Womancare
description: Tel. 298-9352. A Feminist Women's Health Center.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: 93120. Mail to PO Box 2256, Santa Barbara. Tel. 966-6770. Many women. Sunday evening service, social activities and info.

title: Gay/Lesbian Resource Center
description: 93101.Tel.963-3636.Drop-in center for info, 'coffeehouse nights', raps for women, counseling etc. Referrals/GayAA/ evening events every night. Their publication THE BULLETIN.Open 1Oam-4pm Mon-Fri/ 1Oam-3pm Sunday.

title: Women's Community Building
description: (room 1) 93101 Tel. 965-6073. Answering machine, most of the time. Their publication COMMUNITY NEWS DATING SERVICE

title: Gay People's Union/University of California at Santa Barbara
description: Meets 7pm in the Women's Center of the campus.

title: Gay/Lesbian Radio Collective
description: Tel. 963-3636. Airing time: Weds 7pm-1Opm 91.9FM. A project of the Gay/Lesbian Resource Center. The program welcomes chats with out of town visitors.

title: The Unicorn
description: Tel. 965-6701. Small dance floor, good sounds, pool table, beer and wine bar. Clientele: mostly gay women most of the time- great, friendly women!

title: The Pub
description: 962-3911. A very friendly all gay bar. Lots of women do attend now. There's a pool table and a very large dance floor. Live DJ on weekends. Open until 2.00am and highly recommended.

title: Baaudelaire's
description: Tel. 964-9007. A straight coffeehouse-type place with woman-only Wednesday nights. It is well attended by the lesbian community. Beer/wine/record music and dancing. $1.00 cover charge. Very highly recommended.

title: Matrix
description: Santa Cruz Ca. 95060. Tel. 429-1238. Monthly women's newspaper $8.00 per year. Lots of lesbian news and events listed. Monthly calender.

title: The Blue Lagoon
description: Tel.423-7117. Conflicting reports. (1) male-dominated cruise bar/not a comfortable place for women a tall.(2)a nice.quiet bar with no dancing. Excellent for gay women who just want to drink together and chat quietly.

title: Cha Cha's (ne Mona's Gorilla Lounge)
description: (off Soquel Drive and the intersection of Highway D). Wednesday is women's night and they do hold benefits for MATRIX, but mostly its gay men/some straights too.

title: Caffe Domenica
description: Tel. 427-3520. Located right next to the MATRIX office, this has become a feminist hang-out and a good place to meet new women.

title: Bookshop
description: Tel. 463-0900. Excellent Gay/Lesbian section. They sell MATRIX and have a Gay/Lesbian bulletin board. Open 10am-10pm.

title: Santa Cruz Women's Health Center
description:
95060. Tel. 427-3500/ emergency service till midnight 452-5211. Gyn/health therapy. Their resource book: LESBIAN HEALTH MATTERS, which, as well as being a landmark, is excellent. Center hours: Mon 10am-4pm/Tues 10am-7pm/Weds 10am-4pm & 7pm-9pm/Thurs 9am-4pm/Fri 10am-4pm/

description: which, as well as being a landmark, is excellent. Center hours: Mon 10am-4pm/Tues 10am-7pm/Weds 10am-4pm & 7pm-9pm/Thurs 9am-4pm/Fri 10am-4pm/Sat 9am-1pm.

title: Gertie's
description: Tel. 576-9247. Open Thurs. 4-10pm/Fri 4pm-10pm/Sat 4pm till late (entertainment on Saturday nights). Sunday brunch at 10:30. Friday & Saturday night full dinner menu- and it is excellent and reasonable. Very friendly women/helpful to visit. GERTIE'S IS A WOMAN-ONLY SPACE. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Heartwood Spa
description: Sunday night is women's night. Outdoor hot-tub. Very highly recommended.

title: Santa Rosa Inn
description: (near the Expressway) Tel. 584-0345. Recommended. Very loud disco. Pool Table. (Alternate phone number: 584-9805) 80% gay men/ 20% gay women.

title: Revelation
description: Tel. 526-2225. Natural sandwiches, soups and salads. Fast food, vegetarian, great desserts.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of the Everlasting Light
description: Tel. 943-5277. A quite charming voice (female) comes on with a taped message of current events.

title: Scotty's Den
description: 95206. Tel. 462-2624. Beer and wine bar. Pool tables/ dancing/a woman owned bar for women.

title: Lesbian and Gay Associated Engineers & Scientists
description: 94086. A social/professional/political group doing a mainstream outreach and want to go national. They have a resume file, a questionnaire for employers, companies who recruit through them, placement specialists who work with them.

title: Paradise (ne Willie's)
description: Tel. 466-2277. One of the nicest bars in the

description: 95206. Tel 463 6916. Monday is best for women. Sunday beer bust: 3pm-7pm -very well attended by women.

title: Wicca Mountain
description: 95490. Location address: 3540 Ridgewood Road Tel. 459-5776. A special retreat for womyn only. Swimming pond and camping space ($3.00 per night). They also have a summer camp for young womyn 7-13 years of age (June/July). All reports are good ones.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Ventura Ca 93001. (Uses Unitarian Church, Sunday evening services 7pm) Tel. 653 5291. Many women involved, Sunday services plus social activities and resources.
