description: 94520 Tel. 938-4550. Dance bar/games/special women's entertainment nights and very highly recommended. 'The environment is good and so is the music (live DJ).' Open Monday to Friday 4pm-2am/Sat 6pm-2am/Sun 3pm-2am.

title: The Wild Goose
description: (West of Leaward Ave- in a back alley on the north side of the street, right next to CARPENTERIA) Tel. 653-9194. Apparently there are signs saying 'this is a no-touch bar' and 'there should be no flying of colors'. However, this is a REAL friendly place with taped disco music, pool tables and highly recommended.

title: Ollies of Oakland
description: Tel. 653-6017 Lesbian super-bar complex Dance Hall/Gallery/Performance Space (the very best in womyn's entertainment)/Music/Film Shows/etc. Restaurant and recommended by everybody.

title: Bench & Bar
description: 94607 Tel. 444-2266. It's straight during the day and gay at night only. Disco/lunch/brunch.

title: Cheese and Coffee Center
description: Tel 848-7115. Outdoor seating and deli. Clientele: women. (Located in Trumpetvine Court)-downtown Berkeley

title: Revol
description:
(Oakland) Tel 652-6870. The bar is MGM but the adjoining
Restaurant is slightly more mixed and is worth going to anyway because the food and service
are very good. It's fairly expensive

title: The Old Mole
description: University Walk (between Grove and Milvia) Berkeley 540-6077 Monday-Saturday 10am-11pm. Serving espresso, drip coffee and pastries Now offering a fine selection of books by and about women - fiction and non-fiction, cloth and paper for your delight and special gifts.

title: Jubilee
description:
Tel. 534-4055 Just off HighStreet, in Oakland You have to knock at

description:
Tel. 536-6064. In Oakland, near Fruitvale/Freeway 580. Kitchen
privileges, no pets.

description: (Oakland) (by 40th Street); 94611. Tel. 547-9920. Over 9000 titles... by, for and about women. Children's area, bulletin board, lounge, library, wheelchair accessible. Parking in rear. Information center open every day of the year! I 10am-6pm & until 9pm Tuesdays. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: The Brick Hut
description: (near Alcatraz Ave) Berkeley Expanded menu, spacious new restaurant.

title: Sandwiched Inn
description: Tel 655-1202. Lunches and dinners. Women owned and recommended Outdoor courtyard Open 11am-7pm Mon-Fri and Sat till 6pm.

description:
Mail to PO Box 5844 Berkeley 94705. Location: 4118
Telegraph Ave; 94609. Tel. 653-4169. Kwan Yin and Venus of Willendorf image candles, oils, incense charcoal, ritual supplies. They also sell the mysterious and esoteric GAIAS GUIDE. Send SASE to their PO Box for a truly marvellous mail order catalogue

title: Z Budapest
description:
write PO Box 11363, Oakland; 94611 Tel. 444-7724 (for appointment).
International feminist psychic. Psychic consultations, trysting of couples, house blessings, parties, rituals.

title: Point of Departure/Travel Servie
description: 94709 Tel 845- 6636. A woman owned and operated travel agency, interested in furthering international feminist contacts around the world, to promote both professional and activist networking and women's cross-cultural understanding and friendship. Future plans include feminist/group tours to other countries. Open 9:30am-5:30pm & Sat 9:30am-3:30pm. Be sure and say hi to Jo Ann from GAIA.

title: Sante
description: Tel. 526-5900. Fully equipped gym/sauna/jacuzzi/steam baths/personalized exercise program/massage. Mon-Thurs 7am-9pm/Fn 7am-7pm/Sat 10am-5pm/Sun 11am-3pm. Managed and operated by women, this is a unique fitness center for women only.

title: Royal Hawaii Restaurant
description: Tel. 465-0539 Szechuan and Polynesian cuisine. Sun-Thurs 7am-9.30pm Fn & Sat 7am-11 pm.

description: Tel845-6458 A women's collective dishes out the richest ice cream to a long line of afficianados ' Also now located in Walnut Square. Berkeley Open Mon-Sun 12 noon-11pm, Fri and Sat 12 noon -12 midnight. 'Lots of dykes go there, too

title: Cody's Books
description: Berkeley 94704 Tel. 845-7852. General bookstore with gay and feminist titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Vegetarian Fare
description: Tel. 843-5316. Fine vegetarian food, lovingly prepared Now open for lunch Mon-Fri 12-3 Also dinner every night, 5-10pm. Nightly specials.

title: Piedmont Spa
description:
(40th) Oakland Tel. 655-7174 Mon-Fn 10am-6pm/
Sat 10-5pm. Women owned and operated. Esalen based massage with sauna. Facials and sauna.

description: 80302 Tel. 444-0202. A small Arts college including dance, music, psychology, Buddhism, etc. Women and feminism in Buddhism symposium. It's extremely successful. About half the participants are Lesbian feminists.

title: Womanventure Ranch
description: Tel. 388-7288. Open year round/call for directions.

title: Big Mama Rag
description: 80206. Tel. 322-2010. Feminist newspaper with lesbian content and lots of local resources. $7.00 per year.

title: The Gay and Lesbian Community Center of Colorado
description: 80218. Center: 1436 Lafayette St Tel. 831-6268 or 837-1598. This center is a truly successful alternative to the bar scene. Includes the EVERYWOMAN'S COMING OUT & SUPPORT GROUP, coffeehouse nights, gay/lesbian educators group, young lesbian mothers' group and Spanish information and support group. The center receives over 2,300 call and visits each month. Open from 10am-10pm Monday through Friday and 12 noon-10pm on Saturdays. They keep files on businesses, medical, counseling, housing, jobs, and much more. Extremely helpful to GAIA'S GUIDE. Their publication: COLORADO GAY & LESBIAN NEWS.

title: The Exit
description: (at south 21st Street) Tel. 634-9276. Pool table/sandwiches/ terrific soups/lunches served every day. 'Gay Women are Welcome Here'.

title: Hide and Seek Complex
description: Tel. 634-9303. Big disco with 3 bars. Lunches/dinners/drag shows/pin-ball and pool tables. Includes the separate women's bar NOW/WOMEN-disco. Tel. 473-3549.

title: Datacall
description: (Gay Community Center): Tel. 831-6268. Angry about police abuse or dis- crimination? Phone and report it. Alternate phone: 320-5972.

title: Pike's Peak Metropolitan Community Church
description: meets at Unitarian Church 730 North Tejon Tel. 634-6186. Gayand Christian religious counselling/worship services.

title: Chrysalis Metropolitan Community Church
description: St Paul's Church: 1615 Ogden Tel. 329-0562. The congregation is highly lesbian. The pastor is Judy Dahl. Very supportive people.

title: The Group
description: Tel. 831-0998. Outdoor/warm weather: bicyle trips, camping, picnics, hiking, running, backpacking, rafting and volleyball. Outdoor/cold weather: downhill and cross country skiing and ice skating. Year round: roller skating, concerts, movies, card games, photography and pot luck.

title: Parents & Friends of Gays
description: Tel. 333-0286. Or check with Gay Community Center if there's any change in phone number.

title: Lavender and Old Lace
description: Tel. 322-8153. Lesbian S/M support group. Check with Gay Community Center if there happens to be a change in phone number.

title: Dignity/Denver
description: Tel. 480-1924 (Recorded message). Gay Catholics and their friends.

title: The Globe Internaitonal
description: (at 45th) Tel. 294-0323. A gay women's bar/ owned and operated by women. Great disco and pool room. Very highly recommended. Open 7pm-2am Tues-Sat.

title: Three Sisters
description: Tel. 458-8926. Community minded all-lesbian bar. Dancing/pool table/game room.

title: Slightly Older Lesbians (SOL)
description: Tel. (Shirley) 428-80?3, This group meets the 4th Sat of each month at 7.30pm - at different locations. Ring the-Gay Community Center if there's any change in the phone number.

title: The Highland
description: Tel. 455-9978. A neighborhood type gay bar for women and their gay men friends. Great Mexican food/parties/2 pool tables. They sponsor a national league bowling team and have regular pool tournaments.

title: Garbo's
description: Tel. 837-8219. Ultra elegant gay bar for women and men. Piano bar/excellent food.

title: The Grove
description: Tel. 320-9205. A gay bar for women and men. 3.2 beer, juice, soft drinks.

title: Lipps
description: Tel. 233-5420. A gay bar for women and their gay men friends.

title: BJ's Carousel & Restaurant
description: Tel. 777-9880. 'The nicest gay women in Denver come here.'A wonderful bar-gay artwork exhibited. Opens daily at 10am.

title: Rocky Mountain Women's Center and Bookstore
description: (1547 High; formulated address) Tel. 320-5972. Was WOMAN TO WOMAN - new plans. Perhaps check for recent details with the Gay Community Center.

title: Cafe Du Monde (ne Nepenthes)
description: 1416 Market Tel. 534-5423. Lunches/expresso/women * entertainers. Open 11am-midnight weekdays and till 2am weekends.

title: New York Cafe
description: Tel. 321-2337. 'Supportive to gay women and men.'

title: Category Six/A Gay & Lesbian Bookstore
description: 80218 Tel. 832-6263. An excellent first stop in Denver. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and are extremely helpful, friendly people. Open Monday to Saturday 10am-7pm, Sunday 1pm-5pm. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Woman Wise Healthcare
description: Tel. 320-1020. General health care clinic for women. Gyn care. Internal medicine physician.

title: Denver Book Barter
description: Tel. 831-9768. Used books. Some feminist/gay and lesbian titles.

title: Trilogy Bookstore
description: 80203. Tel. 722-7612. Good selection of gay/feminist and lesbian books. Open, weekdays 10am-9pm/Saturday to 7pm/Sunday 1-5pm.

title: Together Books
description: 80203 Tel. 832-5171. Alternative books. Gay titles/lesbian titles/feminist titles. Open 9am to 6pm weekdays/Saturday 9am-7pm/Sunday 1pm-5pm.

title: Womanschool Network
description: (Lakewood)Tel.238-7837. General classes in subjects of interest to women-includes self-defense.

title: The Club
description: Tel. 542-9847. A gay bar for men and women.

title: New England Womyn's Musical Retreat
description: Information from Bloodroot. Probably first weekend in September.

title: The Greater Danbury Women's Center
description: 06810. Tel. 743-3010. The Center is open Monday and Friday 9.30am-4.30pm. Tuesday 9.30am-1.30pm. Wednesday and Thursday 12 noon-4.30pm. Call about monthly social in private home.

title: Bloodroot
description: Black Rock; 06605 Tel. 576-9168. Lesbian-owned and operated vegetarian restaurant and feminist bookstore with wine and beer and women's music. Open for lunch; Tues, Thurs, Fri, and Sat; 11:30am-2:30pm. Dinner: Thurs, Fri & Sat 6pm-11pm. Sunday 11am-2:30 brunch. Sunday and Tuesday dinner 6pm-9pm. Wednesday night: women only 7pm-9pm. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Birds Of A Feather
description: Tel. (914) 669-5650 (NY Area).Take l(nterstate Highway) 84 East to 1-684North, get off at Brewster Exit- really fantastic. It's a mixed gay bar and very well mixed. The women are friendly, beautiful and the place is out of this world. It's owned by two gay men who are pro-lesbian. It has a glassed-in dance floor, all wood, meeting rooms. game room, friendly bar and a lot of nice people. Once a month the SPARTACUS/SAPPHO STUDENTS ORGANIZATION meets there (Gay Studens' Union. Western Connecticut State College in Danbury, Connecticut). Very, very highly recommended.

title: Spartacus/Sappho Students Organization
description: Western Connecticut State College Danbury Ct, 06810. Beatrice Wallace, President. Say hi from GAIA.

title: The Retreat (ne Fall Village Inn)
description: Tel. 824-7479. Rooms for women in a charming old colonial home, situated in the foothills of the Berkshire mountains. Open daily year round. Three fireplaces. Very comfortable. Reasonable rates. Renovated barn also available for a more private visit. Pool and tennis court for w~rm weather use. The property borders the Housatonic River, ideal for canoeing and fishing. AppalachianTrail nearby for those who enjoy hiking and backpacking. Cross country and downhill skiing areas locally for winter sports lovers. Ice skating too. Bring your own gear. Owned and managed by women. Call for reservations and be sure and say Hi from GAIA. (Opens March, 1983).

title: Women's Music Archives
description: 06430 Tel. 255-1348. Contact them for information on annual womyn's musical retreat.

title: Hill Center INC
description: 06105. Tel. 249-7691. Monday to Thursday 9am- 9:30pm, Friday to 4:30pm. 'Multi-program Community Center. Men's and women's alliance against sexism. Meeting place for gay groups, workshops, etc.' Home of Lesbian/Gay Task Force/Lesbian AA Wednesday 8pm and 'Your Turf' /Teenage Lesbian/GayGroup Friday7pm. will ring you back in about 10 days.

title: YWCA
description: 06101 Tel. 525-1163. Lesbian RAP Group and Teenage Lesbian Group. Overnight accommodation, gym and swimming pool.

title: Commercial Street West
description: Tel. 249-6653. Mostly women. Dance bar. Two women own it.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: HARTFORD: at St Elizabeth Chapel, 118 Main Street; 06101. Tel. 522-5575 (24-hour Gay Switchboard information and referral service).7.15 *** Sunday Service.

title: Evergreen
description: Tel. 527-9B95. Green plants, tiffany lamps, dancing. A community-oriented woman owned bar. 'Very friendly'. Really good reports about this place keep coming in. Pool table. Quiet bar. Hours: Monday-Friday 2pm-2am. Saturday 2pm-3am. Sunday 6pm-2am. Wednesday and Friday: 2 for 1 Happy Hour.

title: Aurora
description: Art/politics/fiction/poetry/criticism. Contributions are welcome. Very high standards and one of my own personal favorites

title: Sonya Wetstone's Books and Cheese
description: Tel. 232-3710. Women's books, lesbian titles and cheeses from everywhere.

title: Edible Art
description: 06501 Tel. 229-4103. Vegetarian whole food. Women run and operated. Clientele: Lesbian/Gay/Others. international cuisine. Elegant atmosphere informal. Leisurely meal. They play women's music and classical music. They're open Thursday, Friday, Saturday 6:00pm-9:00pm. Reservations only. Beer and wine license.

title: Warehouse Two
description: (off Rte 91) From 91 North, take West Service Road. Exit on left side. Lots of good music. Clientele: mostly gay women. Sunday tea dance. All the beer you can drink from 6-9pm for $2.00. This place is hopping and recommended.

title: Women's Liberation Center
description: 06511 Tel. 776-2658. Home of the Womenpower Coalition, Feminist Union, Rape Crisis Center, Office Workers of New Haven. Newsletter with events calendar. Coffeehouse nights. Make this your first stop when in New Haven. Contact them regarding Yale Lesbians and Lesbian RAP Group meets Monday nights.

title: Frank's Place
description: Tel. 443-8883. A gay bar for women and men. Piano bar now features women entertainers at weekends. Open till 2.00am.

title: The Nitch
description: (Mildale towards New Haven) tel. 628-7050. A lesbian owned bar for women. Good music and a small dance floor. many letters of recommendation.

title: Women's Center of South East Connecticut
The Brook-A Disco/Cedarbrook
description: Tel. 226-6204 Highly recommended all-gay bar with a separate women's room. Good disco with lighted floor.

title: Lesbian Switchboard
description: Tel. 387-5525. Donations/correspondence, etc to: 1638 K Street, North West; 20009.

title: Diplomat Magazine
description: NE 20002 Tel. 398-8297. 'News coverage that will give the reader a closer look at being a member of the Third World/Lesbian/Gay Community'. Includes 'Capital Update column. Subscription $9.00 per year. (I haven't seen one, yet.)

title: The Washington Blade
description: If you want more information about these groups, etc, in the Washington DC area please see the WASHINGTON BLADE: Friends Gay Radio/Sapphire/ Sappho (3rd World Lesbians)/Coalition of Gay Sisters (COGS)(Social Group)/Friday Night Live (Social Group)/Lesbian Mothers and Gay Fathers (parents who are gay)/Parents and Friends of Gays/International Lesbian and Gay Association/National Gay Task Force/Gay Community Center/Gay Restaurant Owners of Washington/Lesbian Rights Task Force of NOW

title: The Washington Blade
description: NW 2004, Suite 315. Tel. 347-2038. Weekly big newspaper. Contains an indispensable gay directory of women's events and groups plus a bar guide which actually indicates which bars are for women. Also has Baltimore and Virginia resources. $25.00 for 50 issues. Discreet mailing.

title: Gay Community Center
description: NW, 20005. Tel. 232-7103. Full range of activities and services. Women's coffeehouse Saturday nights.

title: Washington Area Women's Center
description: NW Tel. 347-5078. Referrals, library, dances and special events, classes, support groups, art on the wall. Their newsletter is IN OUR OWN WRITE.

title: Off Our Backs
description: (212): 20009. Feminist News Journal. Somewhat third-world orientation. 'Chicken Lady' news, resource section, classified ads. Individual subscription $8.00 a year. Sample copy $1.50. Free to prisoners.

title: Bet Mishpachah
description: services held at Christ United Methodist Church 1 St SW between 3rd and 4th. For information call 833-1638, and see BLADE DC for current details. The gay and lesbian synagogue of Washington DC. Sabbath Service and Oneg, every Friday, 8.30pm. Women's Outreach Service- First Friday of every month.

title: Washington Women's Art Center (WWAC)
description: NW 20009 Tel. 332-2121. A cultural center for women. Art gallery, exhibitions, classes, poetry readings. Newsletter.

title: Universal Fellowship of Metropolitan Community Churches
description: NE Suite 210 20005 Tel. 543-2260. Pubhcat,on: GAYSON THE HILL.

title: Adventuring
description: Main Office Mail to Box 2584: 20013 Tel. 667-7768 (Peter Kostik, Coordinator). 'Providing informal, low cost outings for gay women and men who enjoy outdoor activity. The trips are organized by individual members and have included hiking, caving, country weekends, hang gliding, rafting etc.'

title: Whitman-Walker Clinic
description: North West Tel. 332-7114. Lesbian health/ GYN care/VD testing.

title: Phase One
description: SE Tel. 544-6831. (Now, how would you like to have to edit this one?) 'During the week, a hang-out for the regulars who all seem to know each other but are not- and large- totally unfriendly to strangers. Small dance floor and pool table. Weeknights: slightly macha atmosphere... But it's totally different on weekends... tuxedos and political types... super women in ankle strap heels +. suburban + ki-ki +++' Another recent comment: 'outside the bar the atmosphere is tense, because of its proximity to the military base, but inside, it's great- very relaxed, very soothing. '(&I, for one, would love to go there...)

title: Zombies
description: Tel. 723-0313. 'Clientele: quite enthusiastic and basically a good time.

title: Club House LTD
description: North West tel. 882-7471. Big disco/good time and dance bar. It's 'Ladies Night' every Thursday- $5.00 admission. Clientele: basically black. ALL WELCOME.

title: Lesbian Health and Counseling Center (LHCC)
description: NW Tel. 332- 5295. All workshops held at the WHITMAN-WALKER CLINIC. To register or obtain more information, call Loraine Biros at 588-8115 or LHCC as above.

title: La Zambra
description: NW Tel. 667-1050/1051. Hours 11am-2am. Monday nights women only.

title: Friends
description: NW (near Du Pont Circle) tel. 293-2025. Piano bar and good food, reasonable prices. Has a separate bar room for women only. Dancing. Recommended.

title: Chapter 11
description: SE Tel. 347-3792.  By the STAR building, has been hosting some fabulous drag shows.

title: Mr Henry's Connecticut Avenue
description: NW Tel. 667-5115. All you can eat night. Spaghetti Night. Sunday Brunches. Show Nights. Open 7 days a week. Open Fridays and Saturdays 24 hours. Steaks, seafood, sandwiches, lunch and dinner. (Across the street from the Sheraton Park Hotel).

title: 1440 Hotel
description: North West; 20005 Tel. 232-7800. Your hotel in DC- friendly people, convenient location. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: LAMBDA Rising INC
description: NW 20009 Tel. 462-6969. Gay bookstore with women's titles/lesbian titles/GAIA'S GUIDE. Also women's records, posters, buttons, jewelry, used books, T shirts, greeting cards, guides and gifts. "We are now undeniably the largest and best stocked source for gay/lesbian literature in the world. Rare first editions and signed copies of such authors as Radclyffe hall, Gertrude Stein and Rita Mae Brown abound.

title: Lammas Women's Shop
description: SE. Tel. 546-7292. Books, women's music, gifts. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Geppetto Italian Cafe
description: NW (Georgetown) Tel 333-2602. Italian Restaurant. Open: Sun 4pm-11:30pm. Mon-Thurs Noon-11:30pm. Fri. & Sat. Noon-1:30am.

title: Metro Cafe
description: SE. New on the hill. Sandwiches, dinner and drinks 3am weekends, midnight weekdays. Closed Sundays.

title: La Plaza
description: NW (down the street from Morgan's) Tel. 667-1900. Spanish cuisine. Cozy ambience. Good prices. Open 5-11:30pm 7 days a week. Free valet parking.

title: Splash
description: SE Tel. 546-3604. They gay place to shop on Capitol Hill; great women biographical card games, lots of cards for lesbians. Scores of bold gift ideas. (Near Metro on Eastern Market Row.)

title: Central Travel Consultants
description: (comer 18th and G Streets NW) Tel. 347-0671. "Travel suited specifically to your needs and expectations... opening doors to a beautiful gay world travel. Free tote bags. Serving gay women and men."

title: Women's Community Bakery
description: SE. tel. 546-7944. A women's non-profit collective. Natural whole grain breads and honey sweets.

title: GLAD- Gay Lesbians At Delaware
description: Tel. 738-8066. This is the gay group of the University of Delaware, Newark. Offering Delaware Gay Community Coffeehouse Friday evening, usually attended by about 50 people, women and men of all ages and orientations. Special entertainment events. Referrals, counseling. Very helpful to GAIA'S GUIDE, Contact them for information about the new publication WOMEN"S COMMUNITY NEWS.

title: Renegade Restaurant and Lounge
description: Highway One at Reheboth Avenue. Route 1 Box 11, 19971.Tel.227-4713. Brunch daily, Sunday tea dances, Raw bar and Tropical drinks on the patio. Guest houses, swimming pool, show-bar and restaurant. Community benefits, games. Bar open 11am-2am weekdays, 11am-4pm weekends. The clientele is mostly gay men but We're OK for women too.' Say that GAIA sent you. Recent comment: 'they now have a sauna and the bar is unusually nice. The guest accommodation is motel style. Gay men and women mixing very, very well together.'

title: Nomad Village/The Other Room
description: RT 14-Box 158 Tower Shores, 19930.Tel. 539-7581. There is a beach and swimming pool.

title: Renaissance
description: (comer Orange) Tel. 652-9453. Gay bar. Special women's nights.

title: Copa
description: At Merlin Beach Hotel. This disco show bar (a real old timer) has recently reopened at the same location.

title: Marlin Beach Hotel
description: 33316 Tel. 467 6551. Luxury hotel/resort with 100 rooms, many with spectacular views of the Atlantic Ocean. Swimming pool with poolside bar and Pool Deck restaurant. Air-conditioned with direct-dial phones and TV. Entertainment in the bars and restaurant. Mostly gay men but 'gay women should never feel out of place there.'

title: Metropolitan Church of the Palms
description: 33902. Church address 1414 Dean St Fort Myers; 33902. Tel. 995-1458. They have their own church at 1414 Dean St in Fort Myers. There's a very good mixture of gay women and men.

title: The Club
description: Tel. 332-1789. Disco dance bar. Beer and wine only. open 12 noon-2:00am daily. Clientele: gay men and women.

title: Jolly Rogers
description: Tel. 939-5606. Disco bar. Beer and wine. Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday 2pm-2am. Thursday, Friday, Saturday 2pm-4am. Recommended.

title: Spectrums
description: Tel. 373-0149. Two bars- one for gay women, one for gay men. Tuesday is women's night. Dance bar, highly recommended.

title: Melody Club
description: Tel. 378-3772. Two bars, one for men and one for women. Pool tables and video games.

title: Women Producing Women
description: Tel. 495-2262. Production company for events/concerts any event that would bring women together plus Sunday afternoon coffeehouse once a month plus referral service for gay women visitors to the Gainesville area.

title: Breakthrough Counselling Service
description: Tel. 377-0234. Counselling service for women only.

title: Feminist Tarot Reading/Flash Silvermoon
description: 32666 Tel. 475-2432. Flash Silvermoon is an experienced and ethical psychic. General readings and specific questions on all matters. In person, also mail or phone, Send $15.00 money order for tarot reading, $30.00 for astrological chart and birthdate/time/place. Discretion is assured as well as accuracy.

title: Top's Lounge
description: Tel. 921-6563. Reasonable drinks and superb atmosphere. Dancing, pool tables, Clientele 100% women-open 4pm-4am, 7 days a week. Pin ball machines, large TV screens for special events. Local and out of town artists featured when available. Free parking.

title: Top Flight Travel
description: 33021 Tel. 963-0940. enquire about the Gay Windjammer Cruises for women and men. "Out of the closet-and into the plane!" Alternative phone number: 625-3113.

title: T's and Things
description: 33024. Tel. 961-0525. Personalized sportswear. Retail or wholesome. Free pickup and delivery. Serving all your needs with personalized service.

title: Back Door Disco
description: 32211: Tel. 725-9749. "We are a disco for gay women. Beer and wine- boutique and western bar. Disco, pool tables, other games, food is served and there's occasional women's entertainment rights. Open 4pm-2am Mon-Sat Very highly recommended. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: The OP Club
description: Tel. 358-5817. 3 bars, huge dance floor. Clientele: all gay and mostly women.

title: The Little Dude
description: (also called THE DUDES or MY LITTLE DUDE) Tel. 384-1210. Noisy, crowded, friendly. Pool table. 90% gay women. Located across from Farmbest Dairy. Recommended.

title: The Junction
description: Tel. 388-3454. Beer and wine bar. Friendly atmosphere. Clientele: gay men and women.

title: Gay Nell's Books
description: Tel. 358-8394. By appointment only. Call for location.

title: Womanrise
description: Tel. 399-1608. T-shirts/Buttons/Posters etc. Call for appointment/location Say "Hi" to Audrey from GAIA.

title: Claire
description: Tel. 296-5558. Fantastic decor. Women only Tea dance every Thursday 5:30pm-8:30pm. Recommended as quite an experience.

title: The Copa
description: Tel. 296-8521. Huge Disco with an old theater building. Taped message with coming attractions. Very big welcome to gay women. In fact, next to CLAIRE, probably your best bet barwise in Key West.

title: Saloon One
description: Applerouth Lane (across from COPA). Basically a gay men's bar, but women do go there. Movies/Food/Western type atmosphere and people.

title: The Weekly News (TWN)
description: (Suite 20) Miami Tel. 757-6333. Available in bars and bookstores or $20.00 annual subscription.

title: Athena
description: Fort Lauderdale Fl 33339 tel. 763-2967. lesbian and feminist magazine published by Athene Publications Inc.

title: Birds of a Feather Production Co
description: Tallahassee Fl 32301 Tel. (904) 877-5921. Producers and promoters of Women's Music. Sales Rep for Birds of a Feather in S. Florida is Jan Rubin, Tel. (305) 667-4794. Sales Rep in Tampa is Kris Eisenschmidt, Tel. (813) 974-4520.

title: Gay Hot Line
description: Tel. 763-2857. Legal aid, medical aid, psychological aid, phone counseling, support groups and Heavy Rap Sessions. ONLY EMERGENCY CALLS AFTER MIDNIGHT.

title: Room Mate Finders of Broward and Palm Beach Counties Fort Lauderdale Florida
description: Tel. 563-6667 and 942-2402. Fast results. Member of Better Business Bureau since 1977 serving lesbians and gays which comprises a large part of our business. Recommended.

title: The In Town
description: Tel. 447-5674. Clientele: almost 100% gay men but they do encourage lesbians to come and visit. Some dancing, juke box. Generally older crowd. Seems OK.

title: Pro Shop
description: Tel. 447-9726. Beer and wine bar. Pool table. Clientele: almost all gay men, but gay women welcome.

title: Sappho's 1
description: Tel. 854-7262. Mirrored ceiling, disco lighting plus dim lighting, cool quiet fountain patio, umbrella tables and green plants. Disco show bar. Highly recommended. Women only.

title: Candlelight Club
description: Tel. 444-4555. Private club, elegant, piano bar atmosphere. Be sure to dress for the occasion. Apparently great food though.

title: Cocoplum
description: Tel. 445-7439. Recommended as good and gay - casual attire, shorts, etc. The food is great and it's a good place to meet a friend for lunch during the week or for just 'hanging out' on the weekend.

title: Vision (Was Visa) Travel
description: Tel. 331-3344. Trips for gay women. The owner is active in MCC/Etz Chaim. They provide a resource list for gay women and men and gay weekend cruises to Nassau. Gay trips to Nassau/San Juan and St Thomas. Gay tours to Disney World etc and Key West. Projected gay trips to Greece. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Room Mate Finders
description: Tel. 448-5299. Open Monday to Friday: 10:00am -5:00pm. Saturday: 10:00am- 2:00pm. Fast results. Member of Better Business Bureau. Four years old.

title: Zodiac Lounge
description: Tel. 767 4624. Disco, light shows, wall panels and lighted floor. Two shows nightly and a games room. Open 3pm-2am. A highly recommended old-timer. OK for gay women.

title: Yum Yum Tree
description: (US1 - Hollyhill) Tel. 253-5811. Disco bar. Pool tables. Seating for 215 people. No food now. Drag shows/very good hght show. Women bartenders.

title: Landmark- Bar Restaurant and Hotel
description: (Daytona Beach) Tel. 252-3776. Disco and Shows includes the gay men only Barn Door.

title: Our Motel
description: (Daytona Beach) Tel. 255-3144. guests use the Holiday Inn, Pool and Private Beach. Highly recommended.

title: JJ's Den (Jae&Jill)
description: Tel. 561-0242. Pinball machines, pool table. It opens around 12.30pm and they have a big screen where one can watch the soap opera. Beer and wine bar serving food. Juke box, weekly live entertainment. JJ's has its own softball team. Very, very highly recommended. Delicious food.

title: Shangri-La Disco Lounge
description: (no 7): 33317. Gay women downstairs/ gay men upstairs. 2 bars/one excellent restaurant/drag shows. Opened February 19B3and highly recommended.

title: Backstreet
description: Tel. 467-8990. Disco and show bar. Pool room. Food Is served. It's recommended.

title: Papillon
description: Tel. 296-2491. Uses Atlantic Shores Motel swimming pool which Is most popular with gay women.

title: Ellie's Nest
description: 33040 Tel. 296-5757. A guest house for women only. The surroundings are tropical and the people are friendly. The rates are reasonable and each room is named and decorated after a famous woman (Gertrude Stein, Alice B. Toklas, Georges Sand, Tallulah (I'd like to stay In that one), Patience and Sarah, etc. Exotic swimming pool, patio and sundeck. Continental breakfast is served and there s lV In every room. (Well, what more could you possibly want?)

title: Spindrift Motel
description: (was FLORIDIAN MOTEL OF KEYWEST). 33040 Tel 296-3432. Near beaches and restaurants. Special packages available. (Mention GAIA'S GUIDE for 10% discount.) May be opening lesbian bar soon right on the premises. Woman owned and operated. Be sure to say Hi to Helen and Nancy from GAIA. Feel free to call there for information on the Key West area.

title: La Terraza De Marti
description: Tel. 294-0344. Charming sparkling blue swimming pool with poolside bar. Sundeck upstairs. Peaceful atmosphere but rowdy tea dances. Gracious gay living. Don't miss the La Tee Da Tea Dance every Sunday from 4Pm-8pm. Extremely popular with gay women. The whole place Is highly recommended.

title: Alexander's
description: (Old Town). Near COPA and MONSTER.Tel. 294-9919. 7 room guest house, 3 with private bath. 2 efficiencies. Swimming pool/continental breakfast. good sundeck. Very helpful to GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Sea Shell Motel
description: 33040 Tel. 294-7519. Small friendly motel with 16 house-keeping units just 3 blocks from Reynolds Pier. Until Dec 16th, our rates are $15.00 per nite for an air-conditioned private room/TV. Includes continental breakfast. Clientele: gay women and men.

title: Southwind
description: Tel. 296-2215. Motel near the Beach and Queer Pier. There's a large swimming pool in a tropical courtyard. Motel rooms. 1 bedroom apartments and 1 efficiency. Definitely trying to encourage gay women. Beer and wine bar by the pool. Color 1V. Woman owned. Clientele: gay men, some straight and some lesbians.

title: Oasis Guest House
description: Tel. 296-2131. Luxury guest house. Pool, hot-tub. Plus A/C private baths. Gay owned and sounds quite nice.

title: Curry House
description: Tel. 294-6777. Old-fashioned rooms. Garden hot-tub. Mostly gay men but women always welcome.

title: Pier House
description: Tel. 294-9541. 1-800-432-3414 (toll free in Florida) 1-800- 327-8430 (toll free in USA). Charming apartments and suites. Large pool and private beach. Rooms $145.00-$200.00 per night. Suites $225.00-$450.00 per night. Not gay owned but gay staff and gay women most welcome.

title: TJ's Upper Deck
description: Tel. 366-4556. Light Meals- emphasis on restaurant Small dance bar and quiet bar. Clientele: Gay men, some straights and very few gay women. Closed Sundays. Gay evenings only.

title: Green Parrot
description: Tel. 682-9101. Dancing, pool tables. regular drag show. Food is served and it's highly recommended.

title: Kathy's
description: Mail to PO Box 823; 33460. Location: 23 South Dixie Highway Tel. 586-5664. Dancing and pool table plus pin-ball and other games. Women guest artists and community benefit nights. Snacks are served. 'Built by Women for Women.' KATHY'S is a private club, but a copy of GAIA'S GUIDE and valid ID will get you in. Say that GAIA sent you. Entrance is at the back. You can either buy a key for $10.00 for the year (good for other discounts) or pay $1.00 each time you visit KATHY'S. Clientele: strictly women only.

title: Club Madeira
description: (was the OTHER END LOUNGE, INC): 13143 Gulf Boulevard; 33708. Tel. 392-8124. A beach bar right across from the beach on the Gulf of Mexico. The clientele is mostly women and very friendly- there's lots to do here and many new faces to meet- the only bar of its kind in the area. Dancing, snacks, pool, and other games, community benefit nights, special women's entertainment nights. Dockside lounge and (projected) sun deck. Beer and wine. Open during the day Monday thru Saturday 10am-2am. Sunday 1pm-2-am. Very highly recommended.

title: The Well of Happiness
description: 33708 Tel. 393-3375. Fiction/non-fiction/records/T-shirts/jewelry/stationary/cards/peer counselling/bulletin board and 'SALON' at the Bookstore- pot-luck suppers, speakers, etc. Hours: 4-9pm Sunday to Friday. 12 noon to 9pm Saturday.

title: Metropolitan Community Synagogue (ETZ Chaim)
description: (Miami) 33180 Tel. 931-9318 and 756-6600. For Gay/Jewish women: Shabbat: 8.30pm (sharp) each Friday evening with a social hour to follow. The 8th lnternat10nalConference of Gay and Lesbian Jews will be held August 4-7 1983 in Miami. Contact the synagogue for conference material.

title: Womyn's Town (ne Chez Louise)
description: (rear)33145 (Miami) Tel. 442-2472. Game room/pool tables/show room/barbeque/Sunday brunch/disco. A new woman-only bar in a 3 bar gay complex.

title: Sebastians
description: 33145(Miami) (Located at South West 17 Avenue at US1)Tel. 854-7262. Once more, highly recommended. Patio lounge, hquor bar and disco. Open 4pm-3am weekdays and 6pm-3am Sat. 7 days a week

title: Valencia Resort
description: 33316 Tel. 463-5811. Hotel rooms, 1 bedroom apartments, efficiencies. Right on the beach. Clientele: mostly gay men but gay women are welcome too. (Backs on the Merlin Beach complex).

title: Las Lechuzas Disco
description: (Miami Beach) Tel. 672-9422. Showbar and disco. Latin/lesbian clientele. 'Liquor bar. Shows Fridays and Saturdays, but very quiet during the week. Open: Mon-Thurs 10pm-3am (no admissions charge). Open Fri-Sun: 9pm-5am with a $3.00 admission charge.

title: Mr Coney Island
description: (Miami Beach)Tel. 861-6464. 'We support "Gay Human Beings" human rights.'

title: Windjammer
description: 33139 Tel. 373-2466. 'Barefoot Cruises' For the gay community. Women-only tours to the Caribbean, etc.

title: Parliament House
description: Tel. 425-7571. This is one of the largest gay reasons in the world. Hotel/restaurant/swimming pool/disco/boutique complex. BUT: at least 90% gay men.

title: Women's Art House
description: Tel. 843-5125. Home of 'Women in Art' exhibits. Also Women's Writers Group. Covered dish socials and meetings.

title: Fiesta Room/La Royale
description: Tel. 763-9110 and 763-9476. Pool/Dancing/Shows/Video Games. Outdoor Patio Bar.

title: Aquarian Lounge
description: 32506 Tel. 455-9006. All women's show and disco. Games and women's entertainment nights. Happy hour from 5pm-8pm, Tues., Weds and Thurs. 'Young crowd, beautiful women, very friendly clientele. In the process of forming their own band.' Right near the pretty white beaches of Sarasota.

title: Red Carpet
description: 32506Tel. 453-9918. Gay owned and operated beer and wine bar. Opens about 11am/Sun 1pm.

title: Red Garter
description: Tel. 433-9229. 'Cruise bar' but totally mixed'. Opens noon-2am. Disco and floor shows.

title: Gay and Lesbian Alliance (GALA)
description: 33579 Tel. 365-4669. 6.00pm - midnight every night. Hotline/Referrals (including bars/crises/Medical Aid). GALA meets the 1st and 3rd Thursday of each month at the Women's Center, Gold Tree Plaza, corner 2800 Ringling and Tuttle Ave. Their telephone no. is 366- 1700.

title: Sporters
description: Tel. 366-3055. An extremely community minded gay bar- clientele: 95% gay women. Pool tables/order games/dancing. Opens daily at 11am and very highly recommended.

title: Club Madeira
description: (Madeira Beach)Tel. 393-9013 or 894-5665. 'Right on the water and caters primarily to lesbians. They serve beer and wine from 2pm to 2am seven days a week and caters primarily to lesbians. They serve beer and wine from 2pm to 2am seven days a week and frequently have live entertainment. '(By the way, the drinking age in Florida is 19).

title: The Lighted Tree
description: (Pass-a-GrilleBeach)Tel. 360-0373. 'Open from 11am to 2am. Half a block from the beach, they serve beer, wine, salads and sandwiches on a tree-shaded patio, that even has a fresh water shower for rinsing off the sand before you breeze up to the bar for refreshment. The clientele is about equal numbers of lesbians and gay men, all of whom seem quite friendly. There is also a guest house.'

title: La Salle Motel
description: 33577 Tel. 365-2432. Centrally located/5 minutes to the beach/TVs in all rooms. Moderate prices. No longer gay owned but recommended as OK anyway.

title: Engine Room
description: Tel. 894-8184 Dance Bar. Basically a gay men's bar but 'gay women are more than welcome here.'

title: Pagoda
description: A Womyn's Space: 207 Coastal Highway Tel. 824-2970. Right on the ocean, PAGODA is a unique complex of monthly cottage rentals and a lodge house with  theater space/small whole food store/short-term sleeping rooms. Shared neighbourhood swImmIng pool. Extremely reasonable rates and NO PETS ALLOWED (which I think is great). Rave recommendations about this place keep coming in year after year. Their latest project: CRONES NEST for older lesbian women.

title: The Lighted Tree
description: (Pass-a-GrilleBeach)Tel. 360-0373. Gay guest house of three rooms that has just been remodeled. $26 a day single, $36 a day double, and recommended.

title: Club Park Avenue
description: Tel. 599-9143. Dancing/pool games/gay women bartenders/gay-run (and very well run). Closed Sunday and Monday. Gay women welcome.

title: Everywoman's Center
description: Tel. 974-2654. At the University of Southern Florida Referral service.

title: BJ'S (ne Margie's)
description: Tel. 879-9459. A dance bar with a good table and very friendly atmosphere. Clientele: mostly gay women. Open till 3am and recommended.

title: El Goya
description: (Ybor City) tel. 247-2711. Show bar and disco.

title: Fire House
description: Tel. ? More gay men than women, but never any hassle.

title: Rene's Lounge
description: Tel. 872-9631. A real old-timer, with a swimming pool/barbecues/T dances. Used to be mostly gay women, now it's mostly gay men.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of the Palm Beaches
description: 33401 Tel. 655-9228. Their newsletter: Emerald Wave. Sunday Services 11:00am and 8:00pm.

title: Crane's Nest
description: Tel. 582-9860. Highly recommended by the other (men's) gay bars in West Palm Beach.

title: Birds of a Feather Production Company
description: 32314 Tel. (912) 872-3664 (Georgia). Production company and SOUTHERN WOMEN'S MUSIC NETWORK, which does distribution for OLIVIA, PLEIADES records etc all over the south east.

title: Cruise Weekly
description: from R&R Publications, Inc: 30308 Tel (404) 892-0062. Guide to bars/restaurants/organizations etc in Georgia, Florida & Tennessee.

title: Metropolitan Gazette
description: 30324. It includes Womyn's Word and 'Go_For It!' Bar/Restaurant/Organization Guide which includes religious groups/sports/political/ ethnic/racial/arts/media. 13 issues for $13.00.

title: Alfa
description: 30324. It includes Womyn's Word and 'Go For It!' Bar/Restaurant/Organization Guide which includes religious groups/sports/political/ethnic/racial/arts/media. 13 issues for $13.00.

title: The Atlanta Gay Center, Inc
description: North East Tel. 876-5372 (business line). 892-0661 HELP LINE operates Mon-Fri 12 noon-10pm/Sat noon-6pm. Offering a wide variety of health, mental health and social services for gay people. The center is open during the evening and on weekends.

title: Weekday
description:
WTBS at 11.35am-12.05pm Contact Super Stat10nWTBS, 1050 Techwood Drive, NW; 30318 Tel. 892-1717. A half hour talk, news and feature program for todays
woman.

title: Feminist Women's Health Center
description: NW Tel. 874-7551. Many facilities and services including a self-help artificial insemination clinic.

title: The Sportspage
description: Tel. 636-7517. EVERYBODY knows and loves this place, but I just want to say how much I enjoyed their Tuesday night show, featuring lots of attractive women lip-syncers/dancers. I couldn't believe the quality of the show. Hours: Mon-Fri 4pm-4am/Sat & Sun 12:30 till whenever. Disco nightly and very, very, very highly recommended. Now: full service restaurant/Sunday brunch from 1pm.

title: Arney's
description: Tel. 320-1219. Clientele: nowadays, mostly gay women.

title: Pharr Library
description: NE (Rear) Tel. 262-2525. Both men and women.

title: Gallus
description: Tel. 892-8983. A real old-timer still recently recommended for 'marvelous and romantic atmosphere. 'Sunday nights are especially recommended.

title: Gabriel's Midtown Restaurant
description: (between P'Tree and Juniper) Tel. 885-1502. Continuing to support the gay community. Featuring both health food and regular menu items. Beer and wine. Open till 11.30pm on Friday and Saturday. Saturday and Sunday Brunch from 8.00am to 3.00pm.

title: Charis Books & More
description: North East Tel. 524-0304. Feminist books and records. Couches for reading plus a children's play loft. Women's art gallery, coffee/teas and referral service plus records, buttons, posters, jewelry, magazines. Poetry readings and women's music nights. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Ansley Mall Bookstore
description: 30324 Tel. 875-6492 AlterMllve bookstore with gay titles/women's titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Hotel York
description: 30308 Tel. 874-9200. A beautifully restored HoteI offering tum of the century elegance as the PleasantAlternative.

title: Ray's Enterprises
description: NE, Suite 210 Tel.351-6991/351-6904 Sine~ 1976Atlanta's OLDEST, Atlanta's LARGEST, Atlanta's BEST Roommates Service Member of the National Association of Roommate Referral Agencies. 'We guarantee our service in writing'.

title: Reflections
description: (Mail to: Box 4524, Martinez; 309071 Location 1632 Walton Way Tel 733-2603. Clientele: 70% gay men/30% gay women. Open Mon Sat Closed Sun Disco

title: Deep Purple
description: 31901 Tel. 322-9107. Drag shows and disco/open 6 days a week from 9pm to 2am. Closed Sun. Since 1975. Drag shows and disco.

title: Bottoms Up Lounge
description: Disco, pool table. Unconditional- any news?

title: Swiftwaters
description: 30533 Tel. 864-3229. 22 acres on their own peninsula and right on a river, ie TOTALLY PRIVATE, private road, etc. Picnic tables/swimming/rafting $5.00 for one/$10.00 for two. ALL WOMEN and mostly gay. No drugs, please, and its not a heavy drinking scene either.

title: YWCA
description: Across the street from campus of Mahoa University. Small library and referrals. Their publication: THAT'S ALL SHEWROTE.

title: Keeping In Touch
description: KNDI Radio,1 270. Call-in number: 946-2845. 9am-1Oam on Thursdays.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Mailing address: PO Box 4611; 96813. Meets at 2500 Pali Highway Tel. 945-3973 (Church office). Sunday services, 7.30pm. Part1c1pat1on: 30% gay women.

title: Lavender Wahini's Club
description: a social group for gay and bi-sexual women. Two meetings a month. Dances (100 women attend). Hikes, boat-trips, parties, picnics - it's all very well attended. Collectively run.

title: Cocktail Center
description: Tel. 946 9722. Pool table, dancing, juke box. A real old timer and probably your best bet In Honolulu. Near Ala Moana shopping center. Clientele: 'genuine, helpful women', 95% gay women. Open 2pm-2am daily.

title: Hula's Bar & Lei Stand
description: Tel. 923-0669. There's a nabyan tree outside and a disco inside. Highly recommended especially after 11pm - located across from the Kuhio Theater. Comment from a traveling GAIA contributor: 'An excellent places for women, especially on weekends, also excellent Is the 5-6pm Happy HounFood nightly.' Clientele: straight and gay. OK for gay women tourists. Open 2pm-2am.

title: The Wave
description: Tel. 941-0421. Disco scene can be rough and mixed straight. Also, the After Hours disco Is gay (2am-5am) New York decor but not snobbish nor restrictive about dress code or clientele. You'll meet the real backbone of OAHU's gays here. Same owners as HULA'S BAR AND LEI STAND. $2.00 or $3.00 cover charge.

title: The Godmother
description: 96815 (corner BeachWalk and Kalakaua-difficult to find but well worth it) Tel. 922-6960. Italian restaurant and lounge. Intimate patio dining in the heart of Waikiki. 'In the dark in the back'. Owned by two women. The food is excellent and the atmosphere cosy and friendly. Clientele: 60% gay men, 40% gay women. Be sure and say H1 to Terry and Josephine from GAIA.

title: Hamburger Mary's
description: Tel. 426-2233. Good food and friendly atmosphere. 'Offers a full menu of gigantic portions of health salads, home-made soups and hearty sandwiches. Also, 'the gay guys and lesbians all gather at the Pat10Bar (outdoors) between 4pm-6pm for cocktails and 'evening planning'. Not to be missed. Plus DIRTY MARY'S back bar open 3pm-3am, dance floor, DJ's Happy Hour Special Front bar, open from 10am, clientele, 25% gay women.

title: Both Sides Now
description: Weekly and bi-weekly parties, boat trips, support groups, referrals. Their newsletter, which gives full details Is available in HAMBURGER MARY'S. Very large lesbian partIcIpatIon.

title: Hamburger Mary's
description: (corner Prison & Front), La Haina Tel. 667-6989 The only gay bar and restaurant on this island. No dancing. Open till 2am.

title: Alex's Hole In The Wall
description: La Haina Tel. 661-3199. All gay waiters/gay owned and excellent Italian food.

title: The Warehouse
description: SW; 52404 Tel. 365-9044. Disco-open 4pm-2am. 'Hard to find- ring up for directions'.

title: Women's Work
description: 52801 Tel. 326-4518. Women's books/art/music. BULLETIN BOARD for local events. Open 10am-5:30pm Mon-Sat.

title: University of Iowa Women's Resource & Action Center
description: 52240 Tel. 353-6265. Hope of the lesbian Alliance- their publication is BETTER HOMES AND DYKES- newsletter. They have a full range of social activities and facilities including sports teams, also cultural and political activities...concerts, workshops and much much more. NOW Support group for new gay women. The Center is open from 9am to 5pm every weekend and Tuesday and Thursday evenings during the academic year.

title: Women's Coffeehouse
description: You enter through the plain door on the first floor. The Women's Coffeehouse is one large room with different facilities for all kinds of entertainment and gathering. After having been closed, the Women's Coffeehouse is open again. On Thursdays from 7:30am to 9:00am breakfast is served and on Monday nights from 6:00pm to 7:30pm there are soup suppers (the best deal in town). 'The Coffeehouse events check the Coffeehouse and WRAC calanders for dates and times.

title: Plains Woman Bookstore
description: 52240 Tel. 338-9642. Women's books and music, T shirts, posters, buttons, jewelry, used books, stationary, journals, periodicals, works of art and crafts by local women, leather goods and bumper stickers. Referral service/bulletin board/gallery space. They love having visitors and you should contact them for correct local information when you are in Iowa City. they sail GAIA'S GUIDE. Open noon-5/6pm.

title: Stop Light Lounge
description: (rear) Tel. 342 9558. The original gay bar in Boise. Clientele. mostly gay women.

title: Switchboard
description: Tel. 348 8040 (hours 7pm-midnight).Counseling and social information. Serving central Illinois

title: The Bar
description: Tel.3564696. 'A really good bet' and disco and entertainment Daily: 5pm-1am. Three open floors, game room on second floor. An exciting place, especially on holidays. Highly recommended.

title: Kitty's Korner
description: West Tel.558-5552. The Grandmother of the lesbian bars in Chicago. Clientele: tends to be monied, 30+ and friendly. The juke box features swing time and Kate Smith singing 'God Bless America' Open Tues-Fri 7pm-2am. Sat-Sun 4pm-2am. Located in North West Chicago.

title: The Pour House
description: Tel. 891 9476. Clientele: all gay and 50%women. Open 9pm-4am. Dance bar.

title: Shraders
description: 90% gay women. Drag shows Friday and Saturday night

title: Faces
description: Tel. 271 7410. 200 seat show bar.Huge disco on another level. Highly recommended.

title: Gay-Lesbian Arts Alliance
description: Mailing address PO Box 14757 Chicago Ill. 60614. Office address: 1922 north Dayton Chicago Ill. 60614. Tel. 327-7388. Service organization dedicated to the encouragement of gay artists of all types. Not-for-profit Organization the Alliance provides resources and skills which too seldom allow gay creators the attention talents deserve. Auctions, exhibitions, sales, festivals. LAMBDA RESOURCE CENTER FOR THE BLIND: PO Box 1319; 60690 Tel. 929-4357 or 274-0511.

title: Gay Chicago
description: 60610 Tel. 751-0130. Weekly guide published every Thursday. Distributed free in restaurants, bars, etc. or 8 months $24.00 or $44.00 per year. Directory/entertainment and organizations. Their bar guide actually indicated which bars are women-frequented. There is also a street map to gay Chicago and a bar guide.

title: Lesbian Community Center
description: Tel. 549-4370. Mon-Fri: 7-10pm.Sat: 2-Spm. Volleyball team, coming out group, black lesbians. lesbians over 35, lesbian students and health-care workers, and dances. On sale - publications. record albums, T shirts, menstrual sponges, mugs, candles, Metis Press books and stationery, buttons and other items. Drop-in center.

title: Gay Life
description: from Your Style Publishers, Inc: 5023 N Clark 60640 (Suite 400) Tel. 728-0633. Big gay newspaper includes a directory/bar guide which actually indicates women's bars, men's bars and which bars are frequented by both. Also has an up-dated guide to special interest groups, religious groups, social groups, handicapped groups and social events. Classified ads, too. Extremely political. Mid-Western bi-weekly. Covers Wisconsin, Illinois, Michigan and Indiana. Features some excellent stuff by top-notch women writers. Six months $25.00.

title: Midwest Women's Center
description: (room623) 60604. Tel. 922-8530. A not-for-profit educational foundation created to respond to the concerns of midwest area women.

title: Rogers Park Gay Community Center
description: 60660 Tel. 561-0277. Very active all-gay center with women's events and special happening

title: National Coalition of Black Gays Inc/Chicago Chapter
description: 60626 c/o Chris Cothran Tel. 764-2024. Many women participants.

title: Black Lesbians Rap Group
description: meets at RUMOURS/Art studio 60 E 13th St. This large group emphasis diversity of background. Sometimes meets at MOUNTAINS MOVING COFFEEHOUSE.

title: Swan Club
description: Now the women's bar in Chicago. A very diverse all women crowd. The SWAN CLUB has a very nice decor unlike the usual mirrors and strobe. Owners Dolly and Anne are often there during the week and always at weekends. Dance floor and seperate area for pool. Going strong since it first opened. 'Very, very highly recommended.

title: The Smart Bar
description: Tel. 549-0203. This one sounds like a welcome new addition to the Chicago bar scene. Features new wave and disco dancing. Hi-camp movies. Refreshments on Wednesdays. Gay owned by a real nice guy. Open 9pm-2am Thursdays thru Saturday. Clientele: mostly gay women most of the time. Very highly recommended. Be sure to say 'Hi' from GAIA.

title: Augi & CK's
description: (New Town) Tel. 975-0449. Open 7pm-4am. Sat: till 5am. Closed Mondays. Big dance floor, weekend DJ. Very popular, but also 'the crowd in this place can be quite rough!' 'Three pieces of picture ID required for women of colour who are not personally known to the management.' Pool table, pacman, live entertainment. No food. Friday and Saturday night $2.00 cover charge.

title: Lady Bug
description: (New Town) Tel. 281 3336. Mon-Fri 6pm-4am, Sat 3pm-5am, Sun 3pm-4am. Clientele: more business and professional women. Atmosphere: more conducive to conversation than most other bars. Dancing. No food.

title: Gallagher's
description: Tel. 891-9076. Dance bar. Disco. It's really nice, caters mainly for gays. However a few straight couples do attend. Very relaxed atmosphere. Two women bartenders and recommended.

title: Closet
description: Tel. 477-8533. This place is at its best either during cocktail hour or after hours. It's very small with a small dance floor. The Juke Box is good, the staff is friendly. Cl1entele: gay women and men.

title: Jimmy's Hideaway
description: (was D'ROSE'S HIDEAWAY) 905 W Belmont Ave Tel. 549-8756. Lounge bar. No dancing. Clientele: all gay and 50% women. Hours: Monday to Friday 1 1am-2am. Saturday 9am-3am. Sunday 12 noon-2am.

title: Norma's
description: Tel. 871-4880. Formerly HAPPY MEDIUM then AUGIE'S. Open 7 days: 7pm-2am, Sat to 3am. 'A friendly quiet place, a good place to go if you just want a quiet drink. Cl1entele: often more gay men than women.

title: Annex 2
description: Tel. 644-5268. Disco and sit-down type lounge bar. Quiet atmosphere. The Sunday Tea Dance attracts many women, also Sunday buffet. Open 4pm-4am 7 days a week.

title: Factory
description: (North West) Tel. 549-4166. Lounge in the front, disco room in the rear/plus separate dining room Hours 8pm-4am during the week. 8pm-5am on Saturday. Clientele: 70% gay men, 30% gay women. Recommended.

title: The Lite Factory
description: (New Town) Tel. 281-9661. Drag shows and disco. Open 4pm-4am.

title: La Cage Chicago
description: Tel 944-3293. Drag shows, dancing. Two shows every day but Wednesday, 10.30 pm and 12.30am. Thursday $5.00 entrance/open bar. Wednesday no cover charge. Restaurant dance bar. Cl1entele: 60% gay men, 40% gay women. Recommended.

title: Baton Show Lounge
description: (Near North Side) Tel. 644-5269. Open 8pm-4am. Closed Mon and Tues. Wednesday thru Sunday 8.00pm excellent drag shows. Women welcome.

title: His'N'Hers
description: (New Town) Tel. 935-1210. Live entertainment and good food. Open 12 noon-2am 7 days a week. Cover charge Friday and Saturday nights $3.00. Clientele gay women and men.

title: Mountain Moving Coffeehouse
description: (in the church basement) non-alcoholic wimmen only space. Woman talent featured. Open Sat 7.30pm-1 lpm. Suggested donation: $3.50.

title: Somewhere
description: Tel. 472-8708. An Alternative gathering place. Coffeehouse/Entertainment/RAP Groups/Table Games/Refreshments/Special Events/ Friday nights only from 8:00pm-11:00pm.

title: The Courtyard Inn
description: 60610 Tel. 664-7378. Warm, cozy atmosphere .. featuring BBQ baby back ribs and a full range of prime steaks, fish, chicken and sandwiches. Reasonable prices and all major credit cards are accepted. Open for lunch, dinner and Sunday brunch.

title: The Other Brother
description: Tel. 935-7793. Clientele: Gay women and men.

title: My Brother's Place
description: Tel. 321-0776. Clientele: gay men and women.

title: The Brewery
description: Tel. 929-9773. 'Excellent food in a great environment - close to the bars. Very highly recommended.

title: Random House
description: Tel. 871-2600. Open 24 hours. After hours meeting place. Homemade soups and breakfast things like pecan waffles and Hawaiian pancakes.

title: Riversedge
description: Tel. 467-1772. Gay owned. Across from Merchandise Mart.

title: Bake Shop Cafe
description: 60625 (at Lincoln Square) Tel. 334-1347. Fresh and natural light meals and desserts. Open Mon-Fri. 11am-7pm. Sat 11am-5pm.

title: Women & Children First
description: (just off Halsted) Tel. 871-7417. Tues-Sat 1lam-7pm. Sun: Noon-6pm. Books, women's records, music, posters, buttons, jewelry, T-shirts, MAIL ORDER and large stock of children's books. Meeting space/bulletin board/ coffee and tea. Tuesday night programs. Recordings, discussion groups, workshops. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Jane Addams Bookstore
description: 60605 (2nd floor 1nFine Arts Building) Tel. 663-1885. Women's titles, lesbian titles, rare women's books, free search service for out-of-print books, posters, women's records plus non-sexist children's books and GAIA'S GUIDE. Open Mon-Sat 10am-5pm but Thurs until 6pm. Sun 12 noon-5pm. Also coffee shop serving coffee/herb tea/cider/wholewheat pastries/yogurt served at the store Readings and events. Beautiful new space overlooking Grant Park.

title: New World Resource Center
description: Tel. 348-3370. Alternative bookstore with a wide selection of left-wing and anti-imperialist literature and women's books and records, posters, buttons, bulletin board/coffee and tea/special happenings. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE. Open Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday 2pm-8pm.

title: Bobs
description: In New Town: 2810 North Clark; 60657 Tel. 883-1123. Hours: Sam-12 midnight 7 days a week. Extremely well stocked general new stand with a huge selection of gay titles. lesbian titles. women's titles. Magazines too. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE

title: Fox Valley Gay Women's Association
description: 60120. Tel 931 1110 (Monday-Thursday 7pm-10pm). Lesbians in Elgin meet and enjoy each other's company.

title: Kinheart Inc
description: at North Shore Women's Center 2214 Ridge Ave 6020 Tel. 491 1103. Office hours: Tues-Fri 1-5pm. Ask for Mary Jo or Phyllis. Fri night 8-11pm is drop in night for lesbians. Thurs night is drop in night for all women. Program on homosexuality and homophobia. Consultations educational exams special evenings for lesbians only. Counseling support groups.OpenedOctober1982

title: Platypus Bookstore
description: (corner of Dempster and Chicago) Tel. 866 8040. Alternative bookstore selling women's music and lots of feminist and lesbian literature. Open 10.30am-6pm They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Volume III Bookstore
description: 60201 Altemative bookstore-well stocked with gay/lesbian and feminist titles.

title: Quench Room
description: Tel. 6769536. Under new management Very pleasant atmosphere, remodeled and now very clean. Open 3pm-1am 7 days a week, Clientele: all gay and at least 50% women. Weekends especially good, Recommended.

title: Freddy's Bistro
description: Tel. 6729430. Relaxed community bar, pool table, dance room, food service. Women's pool tournaments. Light shows to synchronize Juke box. Hot dogs served. Recommended.

title: Mr C's
description: 60104 Tel. 962 2380. Huge dance floor and U shaped bar. Clientele: 50% gay women. Open 4pm to 2am and Thurs, opens noon.

title: Jr's Country Disco
description: Tel. 78 9411. Pool table. DJ dance floor/lounge area.

title: Augie's
description: 61201 Tel. 788-7389. Pool table/juke box. Clientele: 50% gay and OK for gay women. Open 5pm-3am.

title: Smokey's Den
description: Tel. 522 0301. Dance bar/opens 12 noon 1am, 6 days a week. Thurs, opens at 6pm. Clientele: gay women and men. Woman owned.

title: Horizon Bookstore
description: 61801 Tel. 328 2988. General bookstore Gay/lesbian and feminist titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: The Swinging Door
description: Tel.7.Ladiesnight isFriday. The rest of the time it's 50-50 and all gay. Occasional drag shows and special happenings.

title: Bullwinkle's
description: Tel. 334-3232. Disco and restaurant on 2 floors but it's likely that the entertainment bar(upstairs) will attract mostly straights. The rest of the complex is all gay, and mostly women. Open 5pm-3am six days a week. Closed on Sundays.

title: Depot Lounge
description: Tel. 933 9496. Two bars. Disco and lounge. Disco weekends only. Clientele: all gay and 30% gay women. Recommended.

title: Labyris
description: 46202 Tel. 635-3638. Lesbian owned and operated super bar. Dancing, vegetarian food, games, community benefits. They now publish their own events calendar to publicise their own happenings which include open mike nights, pool tournaments, concerts, 'working women's lunches'. All sorts of community benefits. Snacks are served and they are open: Monday-Friday 10.3Qam-2.30pm and 4pm-3am. Saturdays: 7pm-3am and Sundays closed. LABYRISis just about as highly recommended as a women's bar can get.

title: Womanspace + Dreams & Swords
description: write PO Box 16305: 46216 Location: 3711 North Sherman Drive. Tel 926-6110 (Womanspace). 546-2623 (Dreams & Swords/Feminist Bookstore)

title: PSIS
description: (Comer South Anthony and Simon) Tel. 424-9912. Open 4:00pm-3:00am weekends and Tuesday thru' Thursday open till 2:00 am.

title: Won-Ten
description: Tel. 635-0961. Bar and restaurant, live bands. Disco and shows. Snacks and games. 'Slightly older crowd', A very, very highly recommended fun bar. Clientele: 95% gay women. Hours: 10am-3am Monday thru Saturday.

title: Gay & Lesbian Organization (GLO)
description: 46863. Tel. Helpline 744-0484. They hold Lesbian Dances at the YWCA. Their publication: TROIS. The GLO has a Lesbian Rap Group, an outreach drop-in center Sun-Thurs 2pm-1am. Fri-Sat 2pm-3am. Also the Jewish Group (Light From The Valley) meets through GLO

title: Rainbows of Life
description: 46802 Tel. 422-7913. Books, records, tapes: feminist, metaphysical, holistic, gay and lesbian owned. Psychic fairs, bulletin board. EXTREMELY community minded, women-run bookstore. A first stop when new in Fort Wayne and be sure to say 'hi' from GAIA. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE. Hours: Mon-Fri; 10am-7:30pm. Sat 10am-5pm, Sun: 12 noon-5pm.

title: The Chase
description: tel. 637-8797. Disco plus three floors of super-bars. Open 8pm-12:30am. Pizzas and sandwiches are served. Clientele: 70% gay men, 30% gay women.

title: Talbott Street
description: 46202. Tel. 925-2411. Candlelight cabaret and disco. Drag shows on Monday and Thursday nights. Live acts once a month. TALBOTT STREET opens at 8pm and there is a $1.00 cover during the week. $2.00 cover at weekends/drink specials. Clientele: 75% gay women/25% gay men and very highly recommended.

title: Mark III
description: Tel. 282-8273. Dance bar. Sandwiches are served. Clientele specials and cocktail hour. Clientele: 30% gay women, some gay men and some others. Opens 9am-3am Monday to Saturday. Sunday 12:30 noon-12 midnight.

title: The Ruins
description: Tel. 262-9401. Excellent food and good music. Open 5pm-3am. Recommended. Drag show 3 nights a week, also dancing. Never a cover charge. 'We welcome gay women.'

title: Varsity (CIEL'S)
description: 46202. Tel. 635-9998. Dinner specials and cocktail hour. Clientele: 30% gay women, some gay men and some others. Opens 9am-3am Monday to Saturday. Sunday 12:30 noon-12 midnight.

title: Seahorse II Cabaret
description: Tel. 237-9139. A gay bar for men and women. Occasional shows.

title: Carriage House
description: Tel. 282-7411. Open 7 days a week from 4pm-1am. Sunday closes at 12:30am. NOTE:THIS BAR IS NOT OPENLY GAY.

title: Seahorse II
description: Tel. 237-9139. Reopened after fire. 95% gay. Sometimes more gay women, sometimes less. Disco and shows.

title: Rosalea's house
description: 67058. 'Rosales is an artist and a feminist - a one-woman army in Harper. ' the house is a wonderful experience and every room is unique. Open May 31st thru Labor Day. No phone. 'The oasis of the Bible Belt... since 1968.' Reservations are a MUST.

title: The Women's Coalition
description: University of Kansas Tel. 854 4934. Switchboard and other services and facilities too numerous to mention. very highly recommended as being nice people. Go visit them when you-re in Lawrence.

title: Pete's Pub
description: Tel. 722 9667. Clientele: 98% women and one of the few open on Sundays.

title: Gay Information
description: Tel. 235-0235. An extremely informative taped message gives you the current details regarding the bar scene, MCC/counseling service/AA/other groups and current activities.

title: LAMBDA Club
description: Tel. 296 9089. Private club. open 7 days a week until 3:00am. Disco pin ball. A gay owned. gay operated community minded bar. highly recommended.

title: Spinsters Books
description: Tel. 843 9574. Lesbian and feminist titles. your first stop in Lawrence. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Jerry's Place
description: Tel. 358-3524. Dancing. Food served. No cover charge. Atmosphere homely, nice and quiet. Clientele: almost all gay women. Open 12 noon-2:30am and recommended very, very highly. Be sure to say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Meets at Unitarian Church 4th and York Tel. 366-4052. Sunday meetings: new outreach to lesbian community.

title: The Lavender Letter
description: 420207 Tel. 969-1908. Free in bars, etc. or $5.00 pa, 12 issues.

title: The Bungalow
description: (near Main) Lexington, Kentucky; 40507. Tel. 255-7477. Open 11am-1am. Recommended. Feminist clientele. Everyone welcome. Lunch: Tues-Fri 11:30am-2:00pm. Dinner: Tues-Thurs 6:30-9:30pm. Fri-Sat 6:30-10:00pm. Brunch: Sat. 10:00am-2:00pm. Small but comfortable cozy atmosphere and decor. Recommended.

title: Kentucky Collection of Lesbian Herstory (KCLH)
description: Write PO Box 1701; 40201 Tel. 634-1869. Lesbian/Separatist starting point in Louisville. Contact them for information regarding the women's bar: FOURTH STREET PUB ($report back with full details, please).

title: Equality Products
description: 40205. Badges, bumper stickers, T-shirts, stationary, jewelry, etc.

title: The New Downtowners/Ladies Choice
description: Tel. 583-1166. LADIES CHOICE is the basement in the NEW DOWNTOWNER. Dance floor, pool table, pin ball. It's open every day of the week from 9pm-4am. Drag shows upstairs. Recommended.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Po Box 8223, 40208 Tel. 583-4052. They meet at the First Unitarian Church comer 7th and York. Worship services every Sunday at 7pm. The Reverends are both lesbians.

title: Silly Sally's
description: 71360 Tel. 448-9164. A very, very highly recommended disco and show bar. Women's entertainment, rights/pool and other games. Open Mon-Sat: 2pm-2am. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: Impact
description: 70152 Tel. (504) 948-9244. Excellent coverage of events and happiness in Louisiana. includes directory of all groups, centers, contacts, resources, etc.

title: Snootee Fox Lounge
description: Tel. 746-9664. very friendly, very nice women's bar. Dancing and games. 'We have a women's band entertaining every other Sat night.' Open 8pm-2am. A private club but you can get in with a copy of GAIA"S GUIDE and valid ID. Just say that 'GAIA' sent you.

title: The Dock
description: Tel. 346-0938. Most complete disco light show anywhere. Pool tables, pin ball and entertainment. Private club, open Mon-Sat; 5pm-2am. Cover charges on certain nights. Plan to arrive before 10pm Recommended.

title: George's Place
description: Tel. 387-8537. 'Had a face lift-Nov 1980'. Happy hour: Mon-Sat 3:30pm-6:30pm; open 3pm till 2:30am Mon-Sat. Patio, game room, island type bar. Quite ok for gay women.

title: The Cock and Bull
description: Tel. 387-9549. bar/restaurant with a separate women's room which has juke box and pool tables- 'Western Recipes'. Open daily: 4pm-2am and 5pm-midnight on Sundays. Recommended.

title: Care and Counseling Center
description: Tel. 947-4297. Counseling/group therapy/gay parents meetings/socials for couples/speakers bureau/hospital and jail visits/friendship rituals. 'A mini social services agency operated by GAYS FOR GAYS'.

title: Grace Fellowship in Christ Jesus
description: Mailing address PO Box 30183; 70190 Office/personage: Tel. 944-9836. They meet at the St Louis Community Center. A non-denominational Christian family meeting Sundays.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of New Orleans
description: Meets at First Unitarian Church, 1800 Jefferson Avenue, Tel. 899-1468. Sunday services/Weds evening dinner meetings.

title: LAMBDA CHAI
description: 70116 or call 524-6932 (Shalom). New Orleans only Gay-Jewish congregation. Religious services every Friday, 8pm.

title: Pino's
description: Tel. 944-WHAT. Dance floor/pool tables/afternoon socials 5-7. Open 5pm till... weekdays and 2pm till... weekends. Very new and already getting many, many, letters of excellent recommendation.

title: Bourbon Pub, Inc & Parade Disco
description: 70116 Tel. 523-9720. Top Twenty in sounds, light show, hand painted walls and furniture. PARADE DISCO is mixed gay and women very, very, welcome. Pool table, pin ball, private club. PARADE DISCO is open 9pm-late. BOURBON PUB open 24 hours but it's 95% men Open 7days a week.

title: Soiled Dove Saloon Bar
description: Tel. 525-1459. Women's Western Bar. Sunday evening it's Kim Williams and her Lesbian Country/Western Band. Opens every day of the year at 2pm until closing.

title: Diane's
description: 70116 Tel. 523-9527 or 833-9213. Dancing floor, pool tables, and other games. Every Saturday night-oldies but goldies. 'A gay unity bar' -women entertainers, community benefits, snacks served, Open Mon-Thurs 4pm till... Fri, Sat, and Sun 12 noon till... 'The same friendly and warm atmosphere will continue at DIANE'S.' Very highly recommended.

title: The Clinic
description: Tel. 522-1585. A nice, friendly bar-open 24 hours a day 7 days a week (but don't walk around alone in the neighborhood). However, 'This is a nighbohood bar with pool table, pac man, sometimes 100% gay women'.

title: Mississippi River Bottom
description: Tel. 566-0665. 'Some women do frequent' . Open 10am till close.

title: Charlene's
description: Tel. 945-9328. Dance bar and show bar featuring the very best in women entertainers, community benefits, pool table. A private club, but a copy of GAIA"S GUIDE plus valid ID will get you in. Open Tues-Thurs, 4pm till... Fri-Sun 2pm till... juke box, video games and very, very friendly women. Say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Lucille's and Friend
description: Tel. 524-8840. Open 24 hours a day 7 days a week. Pool table, pinball, video games. Gay women are always welcome here.

title: Flamingo's
description: Tel. 523-6141. Gay run by very, very nice people. Clientele: gay women and men and a few others. Very highly recommended. Be sure and say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Enraged Chicken
description: (off 100 Block of Magazine) Tel. 524-8636. Open for lunch and dinner. Closed Sundays. Enormous menus. Clientele: gay women and gay men (about equal). Reservations required.

title: Bob's
description: Tel. 945-1703. Clientele: gay women and men (about equal) and recommended.

title: Lafitte
description: 70016 (near Philips) Tel. 581-2678. Writes a woman contributor; 'I highly recommend this place; although predominantly gay male, women are made very, very welcome. The rooms are furnished in antiques and mine had a gas-burning coal fireplace. 'Conveniently located in the French Quarter. Rates: $53.00-$77.00 a day single including continental breakfast.

title: Faubourg Marigny Bookstore
description: 70116 (Comer of Chartre and Frenchmen St) Tel. 943-9875. Gay Bookstore with women's titles, posters, records, buttons. MAIL ORDER SERVICE. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and are open 11am-6pm seven days a week. 'An emporium for ideas'.

title: The Country Club
description: Tel. 945-9395. It really is a country club; swimming pool, bar and game room. TV and reading room. It's located in an old creole cottage and the membership is private. Cocktail bar and rooms available for private parties. Very, very highly recommended. Open 7 days per week: 10am-10pm.

title: Bourgoyne
description: 70116 Tel. 524-3621 or 525-3983. 'In the heart of the attractions of New Orleans' "French Quarter". 'Gay clientele and very reasonable rates. Highly recommended. Extremely hospitable, supportive people. Say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Shreveport/Bossier City: write Shreveport Human Rights PO Box 4231, Shreveport; 71104 tel. 221-8172. A Christian church with a special outreach to lesbians and gay men.

title: My Way
description: (was the OTHER SIDE): 1605 Marshall Tel. 221-9543. Clientele: gay and straight. Drag shows Thursday nights.

title: Bobbies Korner
description: Woman owned and very comfortable. Highly recommended.

title: Everywoman's Center
description: 01002 Tel. 545-0883 (taped message). They publish a newsletter and magazine: CHOMO-URI.

title: The Women's List
description: 02116. The what and where of women's action groups in the greater Boston area. $3.95 plus 60c postage.

title: Young Gay and Proud
description: Room 309 02111 Tel. 542-5679. 'Every teenager's guide to Gayness' from Alyson Publications. $3.50 post paid.

title: Focus (From the D O B)
description: (Cambridge) 02138 Tel. 661-3633/259 0063. A journal for gay women. Published by the DAUGHTERS OF BILITIS (D O B/Boston Chapter). Fiction, poetry, and reviews plus D O B calendar of events. $.75 per copy. $8.00 per year. Overseas: $9.00.

title: Lesbian and Gay Hotline
description: 02106 Tel. 426-9371. 'Serving the entire North Eastern States Region and able to provide national gay community information.'

title: Daughters of BILITIS (D O B)
description: 02138 (Cambridge) Tel. 661-3633. 'We hold weekly discussion meetings open to all women and centering around living the lesbian experience' Their publication: FOCUS.

title: Equal Times
description: 02116. 1 year for $8.00. Boston's newspaper for working women.

title: Gay Community News (GCN)
description: Subscription 167 Tremont St (5th floor); 02111. Weekly, non-sexist gay newspaper. Excellent resource material. $6.00 for a 12 week subscription.

title: Fenway Community Health Center
description: Tel. 267-7573. Lesbian medical providers. By appointment Mon-Fri. Days and Monday evening.

title: Musically Speaking
description: WMBR 88 1FM 1-4pm. Women's programming-music, ideas, and announcements. Call Melanie at 494-8810 with events and comments.

title: Commonground
description: WMBR Radio Cambridge 88.1 FM. Friday evenings Tel. 253-4000. 2 Ames St Cambridge 02142. Founded by a woman, this is radio for lesbians and gay men.

title: Boston's Other Voice.
description: WROR 98 5FM 10:30pm. Weekly discussions of problems facing the lesbian/gay community. News, views, calendar, music.

title: Gay Way Radio
description: WBUR (90.0 FM). Tel 353-2790. Every Tuesday at 8:30 pm.

title: Janus Counseling for Lesbians
description: (Janus House) Cambridge Tel. 661-2537. Individual, group, and couple therapy for lesbian women. Serving the community since 1974.

title: Behavior Associates of Boston
description: 02116. Tel. 262-9116. Serving the community. Weight control/Anxiety reduction/Depression/Assertiveness training/gay and lesbian couples counseling/Social skills training/Phobias/Hypnosis. 'Call for a consultation with one of our licensed psychologists, social workers or career counselors.'

title: Expressions
description: Tel. 666-5697. Therapy for women/individuals, couples, groups/lesbian relationship issues/sexuality/incest/abuse/removing barriers to intimacy. Sliding scale.

title: Women's Health Spa
description: Tel. 423-7730. Featuring a racquetball court, universal gym, jacuzzi and sauna.

title: NOW/Boston Chapter:
description: 02139 Tel. i661-6015. NOW NEWS is published monthly at our office. Deadline for advertising: 1st of the month. Subscription: $3.00 for non-members.

title: Gay Professional Women's Association
description: Boston U Station 02215. A large organization of lesbians in the professions. They meet regularly (meetings half lecture/presentation, half social) and have brenches on Worchester and Lexington.

title: Exodus Center
description: 02116. Tel. 266-0612. Day-long workshops, weekend retreats, primarily organized by gay religious groups.

title: Isaiah's Lounge
description: 01605 Tel. 798 8950/791 71 95. A disco bar. Good place to talk and meet old and new friends. Monthly entertainment. open every day from 4pm-2am except Sun, 4pm-1am. Games and snack and quite ok for gay men. Recommended.

title: The Gay Dating Show
description: Marblehead 01945. A new concept for the gay community- a new way for gay women (and men) to meet each other. You just call in and describe yourself and the type of person you would like to meet. If a listener thinks you sound appealing, they call in and you're away. Other types of advertising too.

title: Glad Day Bookstore
description: Tel. 452 0144. One of the most well-stocked gay bookstores in the world. Lesbian and feminist titles and periodicals. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: The Marquee
description: (Central Square) Cambridge 02138 Tel. 492 9545. Disco, pool tables, pinball. A marvellous place for gay women, epsecially those who like to view the vamps on the wall (Mae West, Marilyn Monroe etc.) Great for dancing, open 7days a weel. They Sponsor local athletes and sports teams in the Cambridge Women's League. Very highly recommended. Open 7 days a week. Weds 2 for 1.

title: Pipeline
description: Kenmore Square 9 Lansdowne St. Recommended disco. Games room.

title: Somewhere
description: Tel. 423-7730. Seven days a week, a place for all women. Open noon-2am. Sundays: brunch 1-4pm. Live entertainment and tea dances 5-7pm. large TV screen, hot dog, dance till the morning hours. Lots of rave recommendations always come in for this one.

title: Together
description: (next to Colonial Theater) Tel. 426 0086. Highly recommended supper bar.

title: Paradise
