description: Tel. 864-4130. A nice place with a quiet atmosphere- but mostly gay men.

title: Common Stock
description: Tel. 247-8249. 'A restaurant for gay women, men and their friends.' Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late nights, fabulous weekend brunches. Many, many letters recommend this as an excellent and low-priced, high quality women's restaurant.

title: The Ideal
description: (Copley Square) Tel. 247-8249. 'A restaurant for gay women, men and their friends.' Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late nights, fabulous weekend brunches. Many, many letters recommend this as an excellent and low-priced, high quality women's restaurant.

title: Modern Times
description: Tel. 354-8371. Dinners, desserts expresso, films and live music. plus, women's film nights, women's music nights.

title: Oasis
description: (chapel entrance) tel. 536-7050. Coffeehouse with music, run by MAXINE FELDMAN. Weds-Sun 7:30pm.

title: Words Worth
description: 02138 Tel. 547-5201. Alternative bookstore with gay titles, women's titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Avenue Victor Hugo Bookshop
description: Tel. 266-7746. Women's poetry and poetry readings by women. Coffeehouse type poetry reading nights.

title: Grolier Book Shop
description: 02133 Tel 547 4648. General bookstore- gay/lesbian/women's title. 'POETRY only with a very solid collection of gay authors; we carry gay literacy periodicals, some of the poets reading are gay poets, but our emphasis is poetry. Mail and special orders invited.

title: Glad Day Bookstore
description: temporary location at CARRIER PIGEON 74 Kneeland St tel. 542-5679. Trying and reopen as soon as possible after being burnt out by fire on July 7 1982.

title: Women's Emporium
description: Tel. 661 2059. Crafts, funky furniture and clothes. Tues-Sat 11am-6pm.

title: Cauldron Experimental Theater
description: 02118. Tel. 542 8575. 'We are a Lesbian Community Theater featuring long run theater productions, poetry, visual art, film, dance rituals political forums and more. We have a big empty loft space in Bsoton's South End founded in January 1981... lesbian theater is a viable artform.'

title: The New England Women's Gym
description: Studio 107 46 Waltham St 02118 Tel. 451 3514. Lesbian run/owned gym. A supportive environment, designed for women interested in WEIGHT TRAINING, BODY BUILDING and POWER LIFTING. All women are welcome (beginners to professionals).

title: Green River Cafe
description: Tel. 773-9077. Gay coffeehouse. Women's entertainment. Community benefits, special women's nights. 'We are a consciousness-raising restaurant- a collective trying yo bring creative new ideas to the general public... new ownership, new philosophy'. Very highly recommended.

title: The Bookswap
description: Tel. 774-3989. Used books/feminist titles and Olivia Records.

title: World Eye Bookshop
description: 01301 Tel. 772-0844. General bookstore with women's titles, gay titles, lesbian titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Lesbian Support Group
description: 02601. Tel. 771-6739. At MERCY OTIS WOMEN'S CENTER. Additional address: 298 Main Street.

title: Blue Anchor
description: get address and phone number and report back!

title: Fran's Place
description: Tel. 595 8961. Dance floor with disco lights. Pool table, video games, 8/9 booths, juke box, DJ booth. Quite a large bar seating 200 people.

title: The Iron Horse Coffeehouse
description: Tel. 584 0610 (recording) 584 3177. Live music 7 nights a week- the best in women's entertainment. Monthly events schedule. Coffee Happy hour: 8am- 10am. Serves 3 meals a day. Brunch served Sat and Sun until 2:30pm.

title: The Polish Club
description: ask a WOMONFYRE BOOKS. 'Lesbians get together for socializing at the POLISH CLUB.'

title: Womonfyre Books
description: 01060 Tel 586-6445. Women's books, records, posters, T-shirts, jewelry, magazines, buttons. Ticket outlet for wimmin's concerts, bumper stickers, cards and GAIA'S GUIDE. Open 10am-6pm Tues/Weds/Thurs & Fri 12 noon-5pm Saturady. 'We love visitors.' MAIL ORDER SERVICE/information Notebook/'Meet the Author'.

title: Beyond Words
description: Tel. 586 6304. 'We carry books that celebrate the feminist spirit.' Including GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Broadside Bookshop
description: Tel. 586 4235. Feminist and gay titles. Hours: Mon thru Sat 9:30-5:30pm. Thursday evening 7-9pm on the spring, summer and fall.

title: The Sleepy Pilgrim Motel
description: Tel. 746-1962. 'A motel for all people'- air conditioning, color tv, walk to the beach or relax in the tree-shaded grounds.' Pets welcome. Recommended.

title: Pennacook Guest House
description: 02557 Tel. 693 1231. Near beach and shopping area. Gay male owned, receptive and friendly to gay women. 'We welcome you.'

title: Everywoman's Center
description: Box 949 for mail; location 14 Center St 02657. Supposed to be open from 4-6pm. Check it out and report back.

title: Cafe Edwige
description: Breakfast, lunch, dinner, full bar. 'Excellent food and very pleasant atmosphere.'

title: Vorelli's
description: Mail PO Box 901; 02657. No phone. Very popular restaurant with show bar/lounge area. They feature women entertainers as well as men. The atmosphere is always extremely pleasant and the central location is excellent. Clientele: gay women and men and a few others. Summer season only. Very highly recommended.

title: Pied Piper
description: Mail to PO Box 680; 02657. Location: 193 commercial Street 02657 (Alley) Tel. 487-1527. Top disco, top entertainment, excellent restaurant, game room, piano bar, pinball and pool tables. Exciting atmosphere overlooking the water and all of Provincetown-decks for summer sunning and swimming. Open 10am-1am. THE place for women in Provincetown. By far one of the most highly recommended women's bars in the world. Exceptionally friendly.

title: The Cellar/at the CROWN AND ANCHOR
description: Tel. 487-1430. An all women's bar and a quiet respite from the disco scene. 'A place for women and their friends to meet.' Entertainment weekends (seasonal).

title: The Town House
description: Tel. 487 0292. Super bar complex. 50% straight, 50% gay.

title: Womencrafts
description: Mail Po Box 190; 02657. Location: 373 Commercial Street Tel. 487-9854. Feminist books, records, gifts, handcrafts, jewelry and many other items especially for lesbians- including records, gifts, handcrafts, jewelry and many other items especially for lesbians-including GAIA'S GUIDE. They have a bulletin board for accommodation, events, etc. Open during the summer only. Say hi from GAIA.

title: The Gull Walk-Inn
description: Mail to PO Box 456; 02657. Location: 300A Commercial St Tel. 487-9027. AN ALL WOMEN'S GUEST HOUSE (for 6 years!) Reasonable rates. Central location, large front yard and porch, TV/social lounge. Three steps off Commercial St, right near the bus depot, Boston ferry and the beach. OPEN ALL YEAR ROUND. Highly recommended.

title: Sea Fox (was Back Stage)
description: PO Box 193 186 Commercial St 02657 Tel. 487 3536. Mellow and comfortable. Show tunes and tapes of older music (40s to 60s). Omelettes plus fairly extensive breakfast and lunch menu. Gay owned. Gets the late night crowd. Open: 7am-2:30pm and 11pm-3am. Very highly recommended.

title: Lobster Pot
description: One block from the wharf and seems like the same menu as the old CLAMBAKE. It is fabulous! Clientele:mixed. Bar staff: gay and lesbian.

title: Angel's Landing
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1420. Studies and apartments on the waterfront in the heart of Provincetown. Private beach, sundecks and a gorgeous view of the bay. Woman owned and operated. Gay women are more than welcome here. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: Pilgrim House Hotel
description: 02657 Tel. 487-0319. A hotel for gay women and men- 50 rooms. Also disco and lounge with top name live entertainment. Dinners served. Piano bar and open mike nights. Very highly recommended.

title: The Gabriel Apartments
description: 02657 Tel. 487-3232. Furnished apartments and rooms for women only. Hot tub/sun deck/meeting/gathering space. Free coffee in central location. Free brochure upon request. 'Courtyard bar-B-ques/women's art gallery'. Women own and operate this resort guest house.

title: Renaissance Apartments
description: 02657. Tel. 487-3083 (May-Oct) and (Chicago) (312) 752-1166 Oct-May. Situated in Provincetown's historic West End. These are fully and newly decorated apartments across the street from the beach. Free parking and pets welcome. Owned by two friendly young guys who've been together for over 20 years. Welcome gay women. Theirs is a small operation. 'Many women recommend RENAISSANCE.'

title: Watership Inn
description: 02657 Tel. 487-0094. 'Serving gay women and gay men.' The location is good and central, the rooms are unique and comfortable. Private baths, contintetal breakfasts. The atmosphere is friendly and homey. Bar mixes are also available and WATERSHIP INN is very, very highly recommended.

title: The Captain and His Ship
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1850. An old Victorian house which has been restored and kept very nicely. Reasonable rates, living room with color TV, open all year round. Walking distance to shops, bars and beach. Rooms with water view. Very highly recommended by traveling gat women.

title: Richmond Inn
description: Tel. 487-9193. 20 feet from Commercial Street and 3 blocks from PIED PIPER. It's a nice place to stay, gay owned and about $30.00 a night for a double.

title: Boatslip Hotel
description: Tel. 487 1669. Bar and swimming pool plus disco. Gay Clientele and very, very highly recommended. 6 apartments/40 rooms. Restaurant. Motel.

title: Twelve Center
description: Tel. 487-0381. An elegant 1872 house. Rates $28 double. Efficiency cottage $40 per night, $250 per week. Complimentary coffee. 'Wonderful guest house-great hosts, Roger and Jon, made us feel welcome. Very good prices and clean lovely rooms. They give comp tickets to some of the bars too.'

title: Haven House
description: Tel. 487 3031. Swimming pool. Open year round.

title: Sandpiper Beach House
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1928. Nice rooms, friendly, helpful, happy people.' Located on beach and next door to the BOATSLIP MOTOR INN (same ownership). SANDPIPER guests have the use of BOATSLIP, swimming pool deck, lounge, chairs. Free parking. Three short blocks away from PIED PIPER and other women's bars. Very very highly recommended.

title: Crown and Anchor Motor Inn
description: PO Box 111, 247 Commercial St 02657 Tel. 487 1430. Thirty hotel rooms, swimming pool (summer only), five bars, a restaurant, disco, entertainment center and a shopping arcade. Clientele: mostly gay men in summer season. Women are always most welcome, but 'post-season it was mixed straight and mostly gay men.'

title: Christopher Inn Guest House
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1920. Pool deck. Continental breakfast. Set ups. Open all year round. Center of town. Brochure and rates available on request.

title: Normandy house
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1197. 'Reasonably priced guest rooms, cottages and apartments.'

title: Carl's Guest House
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1650. 'Clean, comfortable, inexpensive. Convenient to all, friendly.' April through November.

title: Peasant Stock
description: Tel. 354 9528. International dishes from around the world. Beers and wines. Open for lunch, dinner, and Sunday brunch.

title: Women's Center
description: (above Laundromat) Tel. 628-6311 (Tuesday 7-9pm office hours). Women's coffeehouse every Mon eve at 7:30-10:30pm.

title: Di Rocco's Cabaret
description: (Rte 3A). Tel. 649-9186. Large disco- pulsating dance floor, pooltables, pinball, Live entertainment on Sunday evenings. Monthly buffet parties. Open Weds-Sun 8pm-1am. Fri Sat 8pm-2am. About 20% gay women. Recommended.

title: 59 Taylor
description: Tel. 736-5811. Disco and 'Duryee Room' -cocktail lounge. Open 7 days a week. 11am-2am. Disco from 9pm.

title: Wimmin's Music On WMHC
description: 91.5 FM Tel. 538-2044. Saturdays from 12 noon to 2pm. Cell in when they're on the air. 'Where wimmin are the sound of the world'.

title: Isaiah's Lounge
description: 01605 Tel. 798 8950/791 7195. A disco bar. Good place to talk and meet old and new friends. Monthly entertainment. Open: Sat- Sun from 4pm. Mon-Fri from 2pm. Closes 1 am Sun. The rest of the week it's 2am. Games and snacks and quite OK for gay men. Recommended.

title: The Uncommon Reader
description: Tel 791 5127. Open Monday to Saturday 10am-6pm. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: The Mailbox
description: 01068 Tel. 752-8993. There's a wide dance floor and the disco music is excellent. The DJ sits above in a room with glass window. Fantastic lights. Piano bar: gay singers- jazz and blues. Clientele: all gay. Closing time 2am.

title: The Gay Paper
description: 21203-0074. Gay newspaper, non-sexist, non porn. bar guide for women and men. One year's subscription donation of $15.00 or more. Includes current, correct information about local organizations including religious ones, political ones, black groups, alcoholics anonymous, teachers groups, handicapped groups, reading discussion groups, NOW and theater and made groups.

title: Open House
description: In Bowie, Columbia, Largo and New Carrolton there are regular 'open house' See BLADE OF DC for current details.

title: Gay Community Center

'Heavily into role playing' and' lots of hassle from straight guys and NOBODY SAYS A DAMN THING TO THEM',and the walls are decorated with oil paintings of menstruating women.. open 7.30pm-2am. (Oh yes, arcade games/good music/nice dance floor).

description: 21202. Tel. 837 3363. General bookstore-gay and feminist titles.

description: Rte 40 up towards South Mountain Tel 790 2760. A good place to party on a Saturday night cos thats when the women show up!

title: Webwork
description: 04619. A correspondence contact club for Maine, new England and the Maritimes- to help lesbians and bi-sexual women to find each other now easily. Write for full details.

description: 04530 Tel. 442-7447. They no longer have specific sections for women's titles because they're crowded but do carry quite a few anyway. Hours Mon-Sat 9:30-6pm.

description: c/o MLF PO Box 125 04915. 'A club for women identified women-created with the intention of getting social, cultural and educational events happening in Maine for women. 'Write for MLF for complete directions. (It's located in Downtown Belfast on Main St). Newsletter- Schedule of Happenings.

title: Maine Lesbian Feminists
description: 04915. Three divisions: North/Coast/South/Extremely active political and support group.

title: The Club
description: 03907 Tel. 646 9282. Featuring: happy hour and tee and dance, daily from 4 to 7. Only a one-minute stroll from town, with plenty of free parking. Southern Maine's newest and friendliest dance bar. Light Meals. Reasonable prices.

title: Dignity/Maine
description: 04240 Tel. 345 3195. For gay/lesbians/Catholics and their friends.

title: Valerie's
description: Tel. 646 2476. Full dinner menu and cozy piano bar.

title: The Inn At Two Village Square
description: 03907. Location 2 Main Street Tel. 646 5779. Perched on a hill overlooking the center of Ognuquit, the INN AT TWO VILLAGE SQUARE commands a sweeping view of the ocean. large, sunny common rooms, enclosed dining porch and a sundeck. Uniquely decorated guestrooms and continental breakfast. Gay owned and operated, they are a 'very welcome place for traveling women to stay'. Write for brochure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Capt Perkins Guest House
description: 'Full service bar and restaurant, good ample parking. Large comfortable rooms with antiques. Special off-season packages available.'

title: Yellow Monkey Guest House
description: Tel. 646 9056. Efficiencies, decks, ocean views available. Open thru Oct. 12. Run by Victor and Peter.

title: Seafair
description: Tel. 646-2181. Your hosts: David and Rod. Traditional accommodation and efficiencies. Complimentary continental breakfast.

title: Clipper Ship Guest House
description: (Rte 1) 03907 Tel. 646 9735. Located in two separate buildings, there are rooms, some with private baths and three apartments with kitchens. Everyone is welcome. Clientele: gay women, gay men and some straight people. 'We cater more for young people (mentally if not chronologically) an we have three miles of beautiful beach, discos, a playhouse, and lots of fun. 'Very, very highly recommended. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: The Collective
description: c/o Elve, 372 Preble St Sth Portland 04106. Portland Women's Community Newsletter published every month on various topics such as motherhood etc and every other month publishes a calender of events happening in the women's community, spirituals, dances etc.

title: New Leaf Books
description: Tel. 236-2030. Specializes in books by and about women. Publications from small presses etc. Non-sexist children's literature, women's music, and books that are simply fun. Hours 10:30am-5:30pm Monday thru Saturday.

title: Gay People's Alliance
description: 04103 tel. 780 4085. Your best contact if new to the scene in Maine.

title: Wilde Stein Club, Senior Skull Room
description: 04470 Tel. 581 1288. A non-profit group supporting the local gay community as well as the student community.

title: Sea Gnomes Home
description: 04681 Tel. 367 5076. A rooming house for womyn by the sea. Just rooms; no meals, projects, entertainment. It's a funky, partially restored victorian house offering semi-private rooms with double beds. two room suites are also available. The Rose Room, a parlour which looks out on the harbor and island is shared by all the guests. Peaceful and relaxing, SEA GNOMES HOME is very highly recommended by many GAIA readers. Say that GAIA sent you. Closed by the end of September.

title: Gay Switchboard
description: Tel. 577 3450. Mon-Thurs. 6pm-10pm and 6pm-11pm Fridays and Saturdays, 'volunteers needed'.

description: Tel. 892 6522. Extremely pleasant interior lots of plants and graphics. Small comfortable and highly recommended. Sunday brunch noon-3pm.

Clientele: ALL GAY- women and men mixing very well together. College crowd. your night is Wednesday and now highly recommended.'

Social activities. Serving lesbians and working closely with bi-sexuals and straight women. 'All are welcome by appointment or by drop-in.'

title: Gigi's
description: Tel. 584 6525. 3 blocks east of Southfield and there is a disco. Upper deck for men, lower deck for women. Upper deck open from 2pm-2am. Bar for women opens at 8pm on Monday, Friday and Saturday. Friday night is the 'Gay Go-Go Gi~s

Get there early or you will have to stand in line.

Ski-ing etc. It's highly recommended although it's now mostly gay men- 'Gay women are always welcome and well treated here.'

title: Trends
description:
Tel. 461-0076. Dance bar with games. Clientele is
mostly gay men but quite OK for women too. Private club. Women to admit non-members
with valid ID and copy of GAIA'S GUIDE. Recommended. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: The Open Closet
description:
Tel. 537-6697. Disco and lounge bar. DJ Thurs/Fri/Sat/
Sun. Clientele: 75% gay men, 25% gay women at least. Happy hour: 5pm-8pm. Thurs: Happy
Hour all night. Other drink specials too. Opening hours: 2.30pm-1.00am. Fri, Sat open till 4am.
Recommended.

title: Ginzzy's
description: Tel. 226 9801. Dance floor/OJ/live music on weekends. Clientele: mostly gay women but a few gay men.

title: Air Wave TV Records
description: Tel. 221-0875. Large collection of women's music.

title: Lambda
description:
Tel. 244-9413 or 245-9413. 'The proprietors are super-nice
and will tell you what's happening locally if you call them. It's a really good place for local
women and there's no animosity between the women and the few men who also frequent.
Although) It's a small place it's most definitely all gay (no straights allowed!) and the shows
that they offer once in a while are both entertaining and in good taste. Dancing also.

title: Exedra
description:
Tel. 621-8414. Disco/bar open after 2.30am on weekends
although no liquor served after that time. A really nice all-gay bar, becoming more and more
popular with women. The dance floor is great and they have excellent parties. Thurs, Fri, Sat,
disco and live music. Clientele: 50% gay women/50% gay men. Tuesdays mostly women.
Cocktail hour, 4pm-8pm. Open till 2.30am. Highly recommended

title: Summitt Station
description:
No Phone Listing. Exclusively a women's bar. Pool table, dancing, DJ, live entertainment occasionally.Opens
noon at 2pm to 2.30am. Happy hour: 2pm-7pm. Highly recommended.

title: Trends
description:
Tel. 461-0076. Dance bar with games. Clientele is mostly gay men but quite OK for women too. Private club. Women to admit non-members
with valid ID and copy of GAIA'S GUIDE. Recommended. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: New World
description: Tel. 861-1101. Natural food restaurant. Open Mon-Fri, 11.30am-8.30pm. Sat 11 am-6pm, Sun 11 am-5pm.

title: Fan the Flames
description:
Tel. 291-7756. Well stocked feminist bookstore. T-shirts.
buttons, pins, cards. Open 1 1 am-7pm during week, 12 noon-6pm weekends. They moved
into this bigger better space in March 1983. Be sure and say hi from GAIA. They sell GAIA'S
GUIDE..

title: Satans Inc
description:
Tel. 773-9317. Dance bar/pool table/other games. Drag shows and other live entertainment. A private club but you can get in with a copy
of GAIA'S GUIDE and valid ID. Avery highly recommended place. Note: this bar is very difficult to find, you can't see it from the Street. It has an almost unmarked rear entrance, but it is well
worth the search.

title: Fantasy Bookstore
description:
Tel. 248-9204. Open 11am-12 midnight; Sundays
and holidays 12 noon-12 midnight.

title: Tiger Lily Press
description: Tel. 241-4859. Collectively run women's printing press.

title: David's
description:
Tel. 283-9274. Disco/show-bar. Happy hour specials. 'The
friendly bar of the 80s'. Open Tues/Weds/Thur/Sun 7pm-2.30am. Fri 11.30am-2.30am and
Sat 7pm-2.30am. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Caesar's
description:
Tel. 241-5140. More gay during the week, the weekend shows,
which are excellent, attract straight crowds too. Disco dance bar and show bar. The shows are
Fri, Sat, and Sun at 9pm, 11pm and 1am. Recommended. $2.00covercharge.

title: Club ISIS
description: Tel. 589 5866. Highly recommended women-only bar. Membership. Open Mon-Fri, 5pm-2.30am, Sat-Sun 7pm-2.30am.

title: The Crazy Ladies Bookstore
description:
Tel. 541-4198. Open
Tue/Wed/Fri/Sat noon-6pm, Thurs, noon-8pm. The Crazy Ladies Bookstore keeps a large
stock of women's books, posters, cards, records, T-shirts and gilt items by local craftswomen. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE. Non-sexist kids books, etc. CRAZY LADIES is just a
great place to go to find friendly talkative helpful women. A stop there is recommended before a stop anywhere else in Cincinnati for the traveling lesbian since CRAZY LADIES
always know what's going on all over Cincinnati I say that GAIA sent you.

title: Scenic Bar
description:
Tel. 248-9717. New dance floor, juke box, pool tables. Clientele
varies. sometimes as much as 75% gay women, but sometimes less. Hours 1 pm-2.30am,
seven days a week. Recommended.

title: Coventry Books Inc
description:
Tel. 932-8111.
General bookstore with women's records/music, posters, buttons, used books, T-shirts.
Feminist small press titles. MAIL ORDER SERVICE. Referral service, meeting space, bulletin
board. We sell GAIA'S GUIDE and other lesbian and feminist periodicals'. lesbian owned.

title: Epic Book Shop
description:
Tel. 767-7997. New and used women's section. The
only source of feminist books in this area. Open 1 Oam-6pm Mon-Sat, 12 noon-6pm Sun.

title: Adam's Rib
description:
Tel. 281-9691. Sundays free brunch 4 till 8pm and
cocktail prices all night Sundays. Wednesdays live entertainment in the lounge (lounge opens
at 8.30pm). Very, very highly recommended. Open Weds-Sun 8.30pm-2.30am.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description:
Tel. 836-3930
(Answering Service). Services Sundays at 330 Morewood Road. Counseling, rap groups, social activities, gay weddings, etc.

title: Christ the King Metropolitan Community Church
description:
Tel. 521-8352. They now have their own church
building and newsletter, DIFFERENT DRUMMER. The pastor is a lesbian and the
congregation is 60% lesbian. Social as well as religious and counselling activities. Be sure and
say hi from GAIA.

title: Zippers
description:
Tel. 749-9797 (taped message). Strictly private membership
club.

title: The Club
description:
Tel. 838-9283. Juke box and disco/dance bar.
Pool table/pin ball/private patio. Male and female impersonation shows plus open mike
nights. Open Tues-Thurs 7pm-2am; Fri/Sat 7pm-3am. Closed Sun and Mon. A private club
but you can get in with valid ID plus a copy of GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: DJ's Club
description:
Tel. 942-9658. Dancing/pool tables/other games.
Sunday is brunch and games day. DJs is owned and operated by gay women. They-want a
clean club- no drugs of any kind allowed.' The age group catered for is 21-55 and it's a private
club but you can get in with a copy of GAIA'S GUIDE and valid ID. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and
are closed Mondays and Tuesdays. Open Weds/Sat 6pm-2am. Open Sundays: 3pmmidnight.
Very, very highly recommended. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: King Arthur's
description:
Tel. 528 9671. Women's bar, restaurant too. Opens 12
noon.

title: Zoo Zoo's
description:
Tel. 344-4764. New location bigger and brighter now and still
the same great food. Natural foods restaurant. Thursday night is women's night. Open daily
Bam-1 0pm. Closed Tuesday. Wheelchair accessible. Table service.

title: Northwest Fountain
description:
Tel. 248-1990. Non-sexist
gay monthly newspaper. Includes lots of women's resources and bar-map guide to places in
Portland and Seattle. $10.00 per year (make checks payable to TAURUS PUBLICATIONS).

title: Mother Kali's Books
description:
Tel. 343 4864. A dyke hangout which sells GAIA'S
GUIDE. Has a list of places where traveling women can stay. Library and bulletin board.

title: Gayline
description:
Tel. 241-2251 24 hour recorded information on events and meetings in the gay
community.

title: Womansource
description:
No Phone Listing. Lesbian/feminist housing network for southern
Oregon. Contact them when new to the area and say hi from GAIA

title: Club 927
description:
Tel. 231-1606. Operated by gay woman. Game room, pool
tables. Basically disco music. DJ at weekends. Flo\\ restaurant. Live entertainment, video
games. Holds 150-175 people. Open 7 days a week 2pm-2,30am and till 4am Friday and Saturday (open for breakfast). Highly recommended.

title: Wilde Oscar
description:
Tel. 223-8620. An extremely unique bar and
restaurant with an outdoor patio and open-air theater - woman's groups, very special
happenings like weekend cabarets and art shows. Community minded and 'vary hospitable'.
A highly recommended old-timer open 11 am-1 am daily.

title: Home-Friend Truckshop
description:
Tel. 344-9988. Collectively run.
Burgers, chicken and vegetables. Open Bam-9pm. Closed Mondays. Extremely reasonable
prices. Bulletin board. Recommended.

title: Dahl & Penne's
description:
Tel. 228-7469. Basically a man's bar. Pool tabla,
dancing, show bar restaurant. Beer garden. During the week it's about 5% gay
women and weekends about 20% gay women. It's open from 7am-2.30am 7 days a weak.
The shows which are Friday and Saturday at 9pm and 11 .30pm are free.

title: Cook's Reception
description:
No Phone Listing. Not exclusively gay, but fun for all - and not uptight
about it

title: Darcelle XV Tavern
description:
Tel. 222-5338. Female impersonation shows.
Monday is burlesque night $5.00 cover. 'Incredibly delightful show bar but so popular that it's
not all gay now. Lots of people go but still recommended.'

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description:
Tel. 485-3665. Serving the Willamette Valley Area. The Gay and Lesbian community counseling services
have emerged through this MCC effort.

title: Jacqueline's See Vue Motel
description: Tel. 547-3227. On the beach. Private quiet rooms overlooking a remote stretch overlooking the beach.

title: A Woman's Place Bookstore
description:
Tel. 236-3609. Books plus
periodicals, buttons, posters, records, community referral canter with a bulletin board and free
lending library. They publish an excellent newspaper which costs $0.25 and they sell GAIA'S
GUIDE. A good place to start out when you first hit Portland.

title: Riviera Room
description:
Tel. 344-4022/0434. Disco and snacks and the
restaurant SEYMOUR'S. Lounge happy hours and pinball, pool. Open 11am-2.30am. 75% gay
women

title: Goldstein & Drescher/Attorneys at Law
description:
Tel. 484-4435.
Serving the women's, alternative and political communities of Eugene.

title: Chuckles
description:
Tel. 223-2372. Juke box. Food is served. Pool
table. Clientele: all gay and 40% women. Open 7 days a week and recommended.

title: JOQ's Tavern
description:
Tel. 287-4210.
Neighborhood bar for gay men and women, inter racial. Video games, pool table, no dancing.
A real friendly place and recommended.

title: Fogelman's
description: No Phone Listing. After hours: for gay people only!

title: Hamburger Mary's
description: Tel. 223-0900 (Second location) 1441 NE Broadway Tel. 287-7715. Open 11am-12 midnight 7 days a weak. Bulletin board.

title: Wilde Oscar
description:
Tel. 223-8620. An unique bar and restaurant with an outdoor patio and open-air theater - women's groups, very special
happenings like weekend cabarets and art shows. Community minded and 'very hospitable'.
A highly recommended old-timer open 11 am-1 am daily.

title: Jonah's Galley & Pub
description:
Tel. 245-2188. Casual,
intimate, and relaxing. Steak and seafood. Brunch and dinner. Lunch 11-4.30 Dinner 4.30-11.
Sunday Champagne Brunch - recommended.

title: Goldenwimin
Hot Potata Cafe
description:
Tel. 223-7573. Gay run,
the food is _good and the waiters are very helpful, they even found us a place to stay.' Open
11am-10pm.

title: Women In Transition
description:
No Phone Listing. Southern Oregon State College; 97520. Information services and
newsletter.

title: The Iron Gate
description:
No Phone Listing. (Underneath a bar called Perry's downtown near the bus
station). Saturdays lots and lots of women. Thursday night is a good night tool Disco with a
good large dance floor. 2 pinball machines ad lots of video games. $1.50 cover charge on
Saturday and Friday nights but you get a coupon for a free well drink. Highly recommended
It's new, clean and nice. They serve beer, wine and cocktails.

title: The Experience Restuarant
description:
Tel. 563-4555. A unique, highly
recommended women-owned restaurant. Reservations only.

title: I Walama
description:
Tel. 342-6545. Does routine gynecological work and
invites women to take part in examinations. Referrals for gay women and other minorities.v

title: C C Slaughters
description:
Tel. 248-9135. Country and Western Bar and Restaurant. Pinball. Open 11am-2.30am daily. Clientale mostly gay and about 15%
gaywomen.

title: Mother Kali's Books
description:
Tel. 343-4864. Feminist and lesbian titles, they sell
GAIA'S GUIDE and is the focal point lesbian and feminist activities/happenings in
Eugene.

title: Old Wives' Tales
description:
Tat.
238-0470. Saturday and Sunday Brunch/Salad Bar. Fine desserts and expresso/beer and
wine. Children's playroom/Meeting and Banquet room. Featuring works of women musicians'.
artists and writers. Browsing library. Open every day; Mon-Thurs 11.30am-10pm, Friday
11.30am-11 pm. Sat 9am-11 pm, Sun. 9am-10pm. Be sure to say hi to Holly Hart from GAIA

title: Old Wives' Tales
description:
Tel. 238-0470. Saturday and Sunday Brunch/Salad Bar. Fina desserts and expresso/beer and
wine. Children's playroom/Meeting and Banquet room. Featuring works of women musicians,
artists and writers. Browsing library. Open every day; Mon-Thurs 1 l.30am-10pm, Fri
11.30am-11 pm. Sat 9am-11 pm, Sun. 9am-10pm. Be sure to say hi to Holly Hart from GAIA.

title: Older Women's Network (OWN)
description:
No Phone Listing. A support system in
the process of establishing a rural living community.

title: The Other Side of Midnight
description:
Tat. 233-0755. Three
pool tablas, and 3 pin-ball machines, wide screen TV. Featuring: hot and cold sandwiches,
cracker and cheese board, and home-made soups. Summer beer gardenI.t 's owneda nd
operated by women for woman. Hara are the directions: located under the eastbound
off-ramp of the Hawthome Bridge. Park your car beneath the bridge. Open: 6pm-1am Sunday
through Thursday and till 2.30am Fri & Sat. Vary highly recommended.

title: Star Flower
description:
Tel. 686-2151. Wholesale natural foods. Worker
owned and controlled. Feminist collective. Bulletin board.

title: Looking Glass Books
description:
Tel. 227-4760. Gay, lesbian and feminist titles.
Bulletin board. Children's section. Open Monday, Friday and Saturday 1 Oam-6.30pm. Tuesday
to Thursday 1 Oam-5.30pm. Closed on Sunday.

title: Women's Press
description:
Tel. 5B4-9329. Oregon's feminist newspaper and one
of my own favorites. News/announcements/classifieds. Only $5.00 per year. Bi-monthly.

title: Cassady's
description: Tel. 484-9983. Now it's a beer and wine bar especially for women on Friday and Saturday nights. The rest of the time the ratio is 10 men to 1 woman. Hours: 4pm-2.30am Monday to Thursday. 1 pm-2.30am Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

title: Keep Listening
description:
Tel. 239-6896. Ski
trips, biology and bicycling, rafting, backpacking and photography, outdoor leadership classes.
NO DOGS ARE ALLOWED ON KEEP LISTENING TRIPS.

title: Thyme
description: No Phone Listing. Oregon Women's Land.

title: Capitol Forum News
description:
Tel. 585-9295/232-0669. About to change title. Will have new
mailing address too.

title: Cabbage Lane
description: No Phone Listing. Women are welcome to build their own structures or just to drop by. Cabbage Lane has 60 acres.

title: Fly Away Home
description:
No Phone Listing. We are creating theater here in
these woods, and inventing ritual here in this silence. You are invited to join us for workshops
designed to share the fun, depth and power that we are discovering'.

title: Womensource
description:
No Phone Listing. 'We bring lesbian/feminist musicians and artists to
town. Hold annual fall and winter gatherings, maintain library and mailing list. Contact group
for lesbians in southern Oregon. There's more happening here than you think' Say hi from
GAIA.

title: Boxcar Flats
description:
Tel. 241-1368. Small cafe, seats 60. Woman owned. Serves
hamburgers and other sandwiches. Open 5.30pm-2am. Extremely reasonable prices and
recommended.

title: Portland Town Council
description:
Tel. 227-2765. The emphasis is on the political: gay civil rights/military and veterans rights
included. Their publication is OREGON GAY RIGHTS REPORT. Membership Is $20.00 per
year or just $5.00 for the publication. The Lesbian Forum, sub-group, meets the third Monday
of each month for dinner and discussion programs. Also lesbian workshops.

title: Portland Feminist Women's Health Center
description:
Tel. 777-7044. Lesbian self-help group. Alternative fertilization program forthcoming. They
work in coalition with other lesbian groups and are open from 9am-5pm Monday through
Saturday.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of Portland
description:
Tel. 281-8868. The Christian Church with an outreach to the gay community. Social activities
as well as religious, counselling, referrals and job bank. Their publication is THE CHALICE and
they sell GA\A'S GUIDE

title: Metropolis
description:
Tel.. 223-3438. An excellent place for lesbian mothers to
come with their children.

title: Cassady's Tavern
description:
Tel. 581-2326. Owned by the same two men who
own CASSADY'S in Eugene. 'A great gay crowd - about 50-50 and all gay. The men seem to
occupy one side of the bar and the women the other- each have pool tables. The dance floor
is busy and they are expanding.'

title: Oregon Lesbian Political Caucus
description:
No Phone Listing. All women's
caucuses in Oregon can be contacted here. Both Statewide Caucus and Lesbian Caucus have wonderful retreats for workshops. They also have entertainment and exciting guests. The Workshops are to improve all political skills. Usually, they are held on women-owned land in
the mountains of Oregon. Also lesbian attorney referrals.

title: Gensis Juice Bar
description:
No Phone Listing. Juice Bar. Open Tues-Sat: Bam-6pm & Sundays:
11am-5pm. Closed Mondays.

title: Orpheus Club
description:
Tel. 921 8338. Opens 12 midnight 5/6pm. Fri and
Sat wild disco. Reportedly an after hours club and it's BYOB.

title: Sneakers
description: Tel. 922 9306. Women's bar, disco. Very highly recommended.

title: Natural Foods Eatery
description: Tel. KL-6-1360 Vegetarian cuisine. Eat in and take out.

title: 1 Metropolitan Community Church
description:
Tel. 546 5730. They hold their Sunday services at 6pm at the FIRST UNITARIAN
CHURCH, 2125 Chestnut St. Ring for other events, too.

title: DCA
description: Tel. 735 5772. After hours. Downstairs is open to women.

title: Gay News
description:
Tel. 625 8501. Statewide
gay newspaper - somewhat more for men than women in content, but its approach is
totally non-sexist. List of women's resources/bar guide and high standard book reviews.
$18.00. 26 issues $36.00.

title: Tel-A-Woman
description:
Tel. 103 8599. Monthly: free 'Information about
women's concems. We also publish a women's guide to Philadelphia and its vicinity. Taped
message for current local events.'

title: Shadows
description:
No Phone Listing. Downtown bar.
Quiet. Video Games. 70% gay men, 30% gay women.

title: The Eromin Center
description:
Tel. 732 3212 for information or appointment. Provides professional
counselling for individuals, couples, families and groups serving lesbians, gay men, bisexuals,
transsexuals and transvestites and local black gays chapter. Fees determined on a sliding
scale.

title: Rittenhouse Medical Associates
description:
Tel. 567 2031. 'Genera lmedicine
for the gay community.'

title: Shawn's
description:
Tel. 566 9194. A real old timer, but caution: this
bar Is located in the worst part of Pittsburgh.

title: The Inner Circle
description:
Tel. 3911593.
Very small but good food and a small bar. Clientele all gay women and men. Across the street
from BUYERS' MART. Highly recommended. Pittsburgh's No 1 gay restaurant.

title: The New Prelude
description:
Tel. 862 5171. 'Bar and disco that's still jumping.
Clientele: gay women and men. Atmosphere: lots of fun. $4.00 cover charge now but that
does get you two drinks.' Closed Sundays.

title: The Gold Standard
description: Tel. 729 6707. Seating for dinner: Tues-Sat 6-1Opm, Sunday 5-9pm. Please call ahead for menu and reservations.

title: Pegasus
description: No Phone Listing. Cocktail hour 4pm-8pm. Disco 9pm-2am. Mon-Sat 4pm-2am. Closed Sundays. Cover charge. Drag shows.

title: The Blue Bugle
description:
Tel. 4219370 Two bars/tables/juke box and dance floor.
Saturday nights you'll meet the women from Pacono mountains and Jersey who frequent thisbar on weekends. Recommended.

title: Stonewall
description:
Tel. 432 0706. 'Has two bars and a really great dance floor plus fantastic music. It's mostly gay men but on weekends there are a lot of gay
women.

title: Gay Switchboard
description: Tel. 234 0328 Volunteer staff badly needed infrequent service as a result of under staffing.

title: Wooden Shoe Books & Records
description:
Tel. 569 2477. An excellent
alternative bookstore featuring lots of women's titles, gay and lesbian titles. They sell records,
buttons, posters and magazines and have an annual lecture and film series. Theys ell GAIA'S
GUIDE.

title: Psychological Alternatives
description:
Tel. 5461767. Hours by appointment.
Mon-Fri 8am-8pm. Sat9am to 5pm. Hours by appointment. Moderate fees. Professional
mental health service for sexual minorities.

title: Woody's
description:
Tel. 5459188. Serving lunch Monday through Saturday 11am
to 3pm. Appetizers, salads,o omelets, strudel, chili, hot and cold sandwiches.Also take out
and local delivery

title: D-Gem
description:
Tel. 255 9488. Disco bar 'very good' and lots of letters of
recommendation. Closed Mondays. Another report: spacious and charming - but difficult to
find: the entrance is kept dark and the front doors are locked. It might look closed even when
it's open. Enter rear. Your best bet in Harrisburg.

title: Gay Switchboard
description: Tel. 546 7100. Hours: Mon-Fri 6-11 pm plus Sat-Sun.

title: Venture Inn
description:
Tel. 545 8731. Bar, restaurant. Mostly men. Particularly
friendly for women.

title: RP Club
description:
Tel. 545 9181. Private Club, disco. 'A fabulous women's
bar, the music is great for dancing and it's open till 3am.' Gay women and men. Hours: Wed,
Fri, Sat & Sun 9pm till ? Very highly recommended.

title: Land of Pizza
description:
Tel. 735 6650. The food is good and so is the
atmosphere. Very friendly to gay women and helpful with advice about local women's bars

title: Lenape Kennels
description:
Tel. 566 2035. German short haired
pointers/shetland sheep dogs. Complete boarding service/all-breed grooming/puppies and
stud service.

title: Atland's Ranch
description: Tel. 225 4479. 10 miles west of town off Rte 30. Bar, disco Sunday night: gay disco 6pm-2am.

title: P C Club
description:
Tel. 9359341/384 6091 (call for schedule and information).
Private women's club. Wed 9pm-3am, Fri-Sat 1 Opm-3am. Sun 1 pm-7pm. OJ dancing. Women
only Sat. Men welcome other nights. Sun $1 cover includes buffets

title: Paradise Cove
description:
Tel. 2952070.
Dance bar serving food, also game room and overnight accommodation in the Hotel. Fri and
Sat nights it's all gay. Occasional Sunday parties with free buffet. Special women's nights.
Highly recommended.

title: SMC Club
description:
Tel. 928 0670 (located at
Camac-Center City Area). 'A really nice, complete women's bar with game room, disco and
lounge.' Closed Mondays and Tuesdays. Opens the rest of the week at 11 pm. Includes
men-only LOFT. If you're from outside the State, just show license, entrance $3.00 plus $5.00
cover.

title: Philadelphia Lesbian and Gay Task Force
description:
Tel. 386
1610/387 4626. We are a Civil rights organization and publish a quarterly bulletin.'

title: Giovanni's Room
description: Tel. 923 2960A gay bookstore with a huge variety of feminist and lesbian titles.

title: Mamzelles
description:
Tel. 924 9524. Private women's bar. Open Wed-Sat: 9pm till ? Sunday 6pm till ? Sunday buffet. New disco just opened. Very highly
recommended

title: The Railroad House
description:
Tel. 4264141. 'The restaurant is exquisite with fireplaces and the food is superb. The bar is large - a lot of atmosphere. Clientele:
professional-type women.' Closed Mondays and Tuesdays and very highly recommended.

title: Dignity/Philadelphia Inc
description:
Tel. 546 2093. Gay and concernedRoman Catholics. Mass is celebrated every Sunday night at 7pm at 2212 Spruce St. Also
social, counseling and referrals. Monthly newsletter.

title: MSA Club
description:
Tel. 352 9762. Private club/disco. Very much the same
clientele as C R CLUB.

title: Amazon Country
description: Tel. 387 5401. Lesbian feminist radio show. Sun 1-2pm, 88.9FM.

title: Beth Ahavah
description:
Tel. 922 3872. Mail address: PO Box 756619101. Women's
night: First Friday of the month.

title: Oakland Women's Center
description:
Tel. 624 5956. political and
social activities plus counseling and referrals

title: The Baron
description:
Tel. 862 9431.
Viscount Lounge overlooking the Garden, intimate living room atmosphere. The Fireside
Room is run by two friendly women who make you feel at home beside a cheerful fire or at the
Piano Bar. Open 1 pm till 2am.

title: Travelers
description: Tel. 361 9620. Clientele gay women and men, took over from the old TILDEN.

title: Karla's
description:
Tel. 862 2612. Breakfast lunch/dinner. Cocktails. Daily
9.30am. Tea Dance Tuesdays 4pm. Late Nite Breakfast Fri/Sat 1-4am. 'After the bars close,
many people go there for breakfast.' Your host: Rolf 'Yetta'.

title: Mountain Meadow
description: No Phone Listing.  Sleep away program for young women located on one entire side of a mountain. The average cost per young participant is $250.00 per two week session.

title: Safari Lounge
description: Tel. 837 9948. Dance bar. Clientele: 30% gay women.

title: Brigantine Womonstore
description:
No Phone Listing. 'I stock turtlenecks, drawstring
pants, (for ritual, play, work), blue chambray shirts, the Jogbra, Womonsound tapes, classical music by women on records, signmaker cards, women-authored books, herbels for healing cooking, in soap and in toothpaste, the amazon tarot, dream pillows, canvas carryalls and more. My catalog is amazing. Send two stamps.

title: Rainbow Mountain Resort
description:
Tel. 223 8484. A great gay
resort. 50% gay women, 50% gay men.

title: La Pierre
description:
Tel. 943 9134. Good sized bar, a dance floor, a room in the back, and a pool table. $1.50 C0\18rc charge. Everyone is carded at the door. Phone GAYLINE8 63 0588
7.00-9.00 for complete directions. Hotel accommodation, too.

title: The Great Skate
description:
No Phone Listing. The Tuesday Night Club
every Tuesday evening from:, 9.30pm till 1 am plus the Sunday Night Club every Sunday
evening from 8pm till midnight. Memberships required.

title: 14 Karat
description: No Phone Listing. Bar: mixed clientele.

title: Cafe Lafitte
description:
Tel. 985 1181. Cafe Lafitte Special. Sunday brunch from
1-5pm.

title: Lizzy Borden's
description:
Tel. 833 4360. Dance bar, 2 bars, occasional shows
clientele all gay, women and men. There is a cover charge and it's highly recommended.

title: Woman's World
description:
Tel. 4245367. Cross-country skiing.All women. For
info send self-addressed, stamped envelope.

title: Strawberry Inn
description:
Tel. 234 4228. Sunday night is best. Downtown
type bar/ type people.

title: A Nameless Women's Bar
description:
No Phone Listing. Via Cairnito (San Juan to Caguas Road). Sony about this.
Apparently, it does exist at this address, but I just can't get any more information - reports,
please!

title: La Vista
description:
Tel. 722 2514. Roof top garden bar with dance floor,
pool table, snacks. Clientele: straight cruise ship members, but lots of lesbians at the pool
table.

title: La Condesa Inn
description:
Tel. 727 3698. A gay owned and operated
guest house with pool/patio/restaurant/all the comforts. Continental breakfast. The location
is very charming - in one of the less built up areas. Clientele,  mostly gay men and few
straights but the gay and lesbian travel agents are sending lesbians there so it should look up
soon. Highly recommended.

title: Lutece-On-The-Beach
description:
Tel. 725 0893/724 9800.
Truly charming gay guest house directly on the most beautiful beach in San Juan. Outdoor
patio bar/restaurant. Breakfast/lunch/dinner. All rooms with private baths, air-oonditioning or
tropical ceiling fans. Free continental breakfast. Their newest addition to this _very highly
recommended place is a terrific swimming pool and sunning terrace. Be sure and say hi from
GAIA.

title: Stars Disco
description:
Tel. 724 0034. Outside, on the
roof, is a quiet bar.

title: Barefoot
description:
No Phone Listing. Small and friendly, there's a patio on the beach and live
music on weekends. Highly recommended.

title: Bocaccio's
description:
No Phone Listing. Near the comer of FD Roosevelt and Fernandez Juncos. Near the
University.

title: Small World
description:
Tel. 724 9491. Open 1 10am-2am, in tourist section of Old San Juan. Days are very mixed with many
cruise ship passengers and crew. Nights mostly gay - more men, but some women who
certainly are welcome.

title: El Prado
description:
Tel. 724 2542. An elegant, old spanish guest house in the
heart of the oondado. An immaculate and quiet environment, a 5 minute walk to the beach,
restaurants and bars. All with private bedrooms and air conditioning. New swimming pool, sun
terrace.

title: Arcos Blancos
description:
Tel. 723 6343/9825. 103 ft from renowned Caribbean Beach. Oasis Bar serves superb Caribbean cocktails. Swimming pool. Clientele:
gay women and men. Very highly recommended. Garden Restaurant. More lesbians than last
year frequenting bar. Say that GAJA sent you.

title: Camelot
description: No Phone Listing. A very friendly place with dramatic decor tapestries etc. Dancing.

title: La Boheme
description:
Tel. 621 8681. Piano lounge. No food is served.
Clientele mostly gay men and a few gay women. Open noon-lam. Fri and Sat noon-2am.

title: Raffles
description:
Tel. 847 9663. A very pleasant and friendly place. Nice decor -
mirrored walls in dancing area. OJ. Clientele: gay women and men. Winter: open 7am-1am
during the week and 7am-2am during the weekends. Summer: 4pm-2am nightly.

title: Old Cabana
description:
Tel. 331 8355. Pool table. Small dance floor (DJ). Open
7pm-1am. Clientele basically gay women.

title: Dorrwar Bookstore
description:
Tel. 521 3230. Gay and Feminist titles/
posters/records/jewelry/T shirts/buttons/used books/priodicals/postcards/greetings cards.
Children's section, Spanish language books. Bulletin board and free films on women's and gay
issues. Newsletter/book reviews and local events calendars. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and are
open Mon-Sat 1 Oam-6pm and open to 8.30pm on Thurs nights.

title: Women's Growth Center
description:
Tel. 728 6023 (call for appointment).
This s a lesbian owned business offering a variety of social services and support groups
utilising a feminist approach.

title: The Gallery
description:
Tel. 274 3895. Disco pub (DJ). Women's T dance
Sunday afternoons.

title: Metropolitan Communitiy Church
description:
Tel. 272
9247. Worship space: 134 Mathewson St. The Christian church with an outreach to gay
people.

title: The Inn at Castle Hill
description:
Tel. 849 3800. 10 rooms, 1 suite, restaurant open
April thru November. Lounge open all year round. $40.00-$75.00 in winter, $65.00-$120.00 in
summer.

title: 28 Prospect Hill
description:
Tel. 847 9698. DJ on weekends.
Neighborhood gay bar atmosphere. 25% gay women.

title: Dobees
description:
Tel. 7284170. Relaxed atmosphere. Games,
pool table, sandwiches. Gay clientele, 50% women. Located hall an hour from Providence.

Tel. 863 2189 daily(varying
hours) Mailing address: Box 1B29 Brown University; 02912. Political and social activities,

title: The Loft
description:
Tel. 231 1180. Dance bar, DJ. Cover charge some nights. Swimming
pool. Open 6pm-1 am 7 days a week. Clientele: mostly gay men and a small percentage of gay

title: King Street Garden and Gun Club
description:
Tel. 577 0800. Wildest club.
Dynamite on Saturday night. Between 1000-2000 people come here.' Clientele: black, white,
straight, gay.

title: Streetcar
description: Tel. 722 2181. Better for women in the afternoons. Closed Sun.

title: Les Jardins
description:
Tel. 723 9362. Private club. Disco. Non-members
must call in advance to be admitted. Clientele includes about 30% gay women. Opens
1 Oam-2am Tuesday thru Sunday

title: Our Place
description: Tel. 7996252. 'Cruisy down town beer bar-open till late.'

title: Stone Castle
description:
Tel. 235 9949. This bar has a large disco dance
floor, main bar and tables and chairs next to the fireplace and TV lounge, pool tables and video
games. Very cosy private club. Out of towners must show out of state ID. Food is served.
Open Bpm-2am 7 days a week.

title: Rhapsody
description:
Tel. 332 9348. Under new management and
now, 50% gay women. Community-minded bar. Open Bpm-1a m/Fri-Sat 7pm-2am.

title: Sioux Empire Gay and Lesbian Coalition
description:
No Phone Listing. Their publication: TOGETHER. $15.00 annual membership dues include subscription,
or $4.50 pay for TOGETHER, only.
notes:
PO Box 220 Sioux Falls South Dakota
57101.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of Sioux Empire
description: Tel. 335 8396/5978. Religious services on Sundays at 1 p.m. at 1901-1903 W 25th St. Side entrance on south.

title: Psyche Out
description:
Tel. 523 1940. Disco/show bar/patio. Open 8pm-3am Closed
Monday-Thursdla

title: East Tennessee Alliance of Lesbian Activists
description:
Tel. 992 8423. Umbrella organisation for women's discussion groups, other activities
both political and social and TENNESSEE LESBIAN ARCHIVES.

title: Eleanor House
description: No Phone Listing. A guest house for lesbians and gays.

title: Gay Switchboard
description: Tel. 726 4299 726  Gay but: busy, busy, busy).7 pm-1am nightly.

title: P W Bumps
description:
Tel. 7269953. Pizzas, shuffleboard,d raft beer, pinball.( Is it true
that PW stands for Pussy Whip?)

title: The Parlor
description:
Tel. 292 9177. 'Pool table, electronic
games, a juke box and small dance floor. The women are friendly. It's the best lesbian haunt in

title: George's
description:
Tel. 5261038.Disco/show bar/boutique/gameroom/restaurant/
patio bar. The only gay liquor bar in Memphis. It's on 3 levels and open 8pm-3am. Clientele:
50% gay men, 50% gay women. Recommended

title: Alan Gold's
description:
Tel. 756 6868.' Very attractive decor, good disco music.
Dress is casual and the clientele is more gay men than women and a few straight couples.'
Recommended. Hours: Weds-Sat 8pm-3am and Sundays 5pm-3am. More recent comment:
'Also serves food on the second floor. Good mixture of gay men and women and it's one of the
nicest bars I've been to anywhere.'

title: Warehouse
description:
Tel. 385 9689. Popular disco with special women's
nights. Sunday shows and buffet. No cover charge during the week, but $2.00 Fri/$3.00 Sat &
Sun. Highly recommend!ld.

title: J Wags
description:
Tel. 725 4670. BAR/Restaurant after hours. Most gay people go
thereafter the other bars close.

title: P&H Poor and Hungry
description: Tel. 274 5522. Short orders/light lunches, etc. Opens 1 am. Closed Sundays

title: The Cabaret
description: Tel. '820 7082. Dance bar/game room/ shows and recommended.'

title: Gayline
description: Tel. 748 6790 7.30pm-12am 7 days. Serves Dallas and Fort Worth.

title: Maggie's Disco
description: Tel. 372 5081. Show bar and disco with community benefit nights and games

title: Hilltop Inn
description:
Tel. 762 9671. Small dance floor, two pool tables. Pub type

title: Gay Community Services
description:
Tel. 477 6699 (Switchboard operates Tues-Fri 7pm-10pm. Otherwise taped message).
Very helpful people offering a full range of activities and services - their publication: GAY
AUSTIN.

title: Gay Resource Services
description:
Tel. 7493 489.  All people
who are sympathetic to the gay rights cause are invited to attend and contribute to our meetings

title: The Twins
description:
Tel. 520 0244. Disco. Good dancing,
intimate atmosphere, special nights. Open 8pm-2am, Fri-Sat til 4am. Closed Mon & Tues,

Tel. 341 4302. 'We have disco with computerized light show and

title: Metropolitan Community Church

Tel. 443 3332. The Christian Church with an
outreach to the gay community. Social as well as religious activities plus counselling and

title: Kon Tiki Club
description:
Tel. 763 9031. Disco, DJ bar, plus pool tables, video games.

title: Take Five II
description:
Tel. 372 9240. Two pool tables. Wednesday night is the
'Women's pool tournament. Gay women, gay men 50-50. Recommended.

title: Dignity
description:
Tel. 779 0293. Gay Catholics and their friends participating in

title: Steak N Eggs
description:
Tel. 528 8135. Open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Cheap
food. Gay owned and operated. Recommended.

description:
Tel. 529 7014. A very well established gay
bookstore. Texas gay archives. Records/buttons/posters/magazines/T shirts. Bulletin board,

title: Roberts La Fitte
description:
Tel. 765 6896 Open 10am-2am Mon-Sat, Noon-2am
Sundays. Shows every Sunday at 8.30pm.

title: Tequila Sunrise
description:
Tel. 927 9861. Open 7 nights a week, 4pm-2am.
DJ/disco Sat after hours. Pool tables. Mixed ages. Neighborhood bar but weekends high

title: Connections
description: Tel. 474 1660 or 472 0018. Gay newspaper $9.00 per year

title: Mary II
description:
Tel. 763 9435 relaxed bar, right on the beach. Winter, local gay people,

Tel. 665 9756. Mellow bar, community-minded, predominantly lesbian, never a cover charge. Happy hour 4.00-7.00pm, free live

title: Houston Guest House
description:
Tel. 520 9767. A small, all gay hotel in a fine
old mansion. It's near the women's bars, has a swimming pool. Where the world meets
Houston'. Very, very highly recommended. Be sure to say hi from GAIA to your host, Rick.
Rooms with baths $40, rooms with shared baths $30. Reservations advised. (May change
hands, may change completely).

title: Women's Info Referral
description: Tel. 792 4664 or 528 2121. Resources for lesbians,i includingbar info. Operates 9am-9pm Mon-Sat.

title: Womanspace
description:
Tel. 472 3053. Social and political activities, counselings
and referrals service, including bar info, plus lesbian mothers group.

title: Walnut Street Pub
description:
Tel. 677 2522. Multi level dance floor and class
enclosed balcony bar. Giant TV and fireside lounge. Shows and women's nights. Highly

title: This Week in Texas (TWT)
description:
Tel. 522 1760. Statewide entertainment guide, including a Woman's Place plus Texas
bar guide, sometimes Louisiana information. $55 per year, $35 per half year. Back issues $2
each. First class postage. Weekly

title: Puss and Boots
description:
Tel. 972 9730. Community minded,
woman-owned, women-only bar. Women's entertainment nights and highly recommended.

title: Waking Owl Book Co
description: Tel. 582 7323. Good selection of gay literature etc. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: The Sun
description:
Tel. 532 9052. Disco bar and restaurant, and show bars.
Open 12 noon-1.00am in the winter and until 2am in the summer. We usually have 400 or

This is a private club. Full Bar. Annual dues are currently $20.00. Be sure and say hi from
GAIA.

title: Cosmic Aeroplane Books
description:
Tel. 533 9409. Gay, lesbian and
feminist titles.

title: The Front Page
description:
No Phone Listing. For current, correct details about religious and social
groups throughout Virginia.

title: The Park
description:
Tel. 342 0946.
Dancing/pool tables and other games. Community benefit nights, special women's nights.
It's a private club but you can get in with a copy of GAIA'S GUIDE plus valid ID. Closed on
certain nights, so ring up first !answering machine with current times, etc). They sell GAIA'S
GUIDE.

title: Shirley's
description:
Tel. 625 8828. Small, intimate beer and wine bar. Sometimes a full liquor license-also a restaurant, is open 24 hours. On weekends, it's women singers and DJ/disco.
'Not just a lady's place - a women's space.' A very, very highly recommended community
minded bar. 'Great breakfasts - full menu.'

title: Charlottesville Lesbian/Feminists Organization
description:
No Phone Listing. Sponsors social events such as dances, picnics, and volleyball games. Encourages local
political participation and sponsors the annual weekend lesbian conference. Very friendly and
helpful women

title: Cary Towne Inn
description:
Tel. 355 9963. Women's bar. DJ's 7 nights a week.
Drag show, Sunday nights. Restaurant during day. Bar after Bpm. Hard liquor.

title: Roanoke Valley Trouble Center Inc
description:
Tel. 563 0311.
Switchboard, counseling and referrals. A social service center for gay women/men and
others. Includes Trust House, which is an overnight place.

title: The Cue
description:
Tel. 625 1130. Bar/restaurant show bar. Sunday buffet and
weekly drag shows. Beer, wine, and mixed drinks. Plush atmosphere, a great disco. Highly
recommended. Clientele: 50% gay women.

title: The Late Show
description:
Tel. 625 8797 or 625 8965. An after hours
club with private membership. At least 50% gay women.

title: The King Frederik Hotel on the Beach
description:
Direct dial (809) 772 1205. Small hotel with 22 units and 2 beach front homes. Maximum
privacy, personalized service, friendly atmosphere. Outdoor balconies. The hotel is surrounded
by tropical foliage and immaculate grounds. The patio, bar, and fresh water pool are steps
away from emerald blue Caribbean. KING FREDERIK is our home and we.take the utmost
pride and pleasure in operating a 1st class resort hotel. Prices from $32-54. No children
allowed. Clientele: gay women, gay men and a few others.

title: Book Stacks Inc
description:
Tel. 862 8513. Alternative book store with gay/
lesbian and women's titles. MAIL ORDERS SERVICE. Gallery space, bulletin board, reading
tables. Coffee/tea are served. 'We sell GAIA'S GUIDE'.

title: Andrews Inn
description:
Tel. 463 3966. Hotel/resort, bar, disco, shops, coffee
shop, gourmet dining room. Conference facilities. Clientele: gay women and men. Friday
night in the downstairs lounge is women only. However, the comment has also been made
'the people are very nice but the ambience is that of a male pick-up place-very stark- not at
all homey

title: Gay Student Union
description:
Tel. 656 4173. Gay
Hotline Monday-Friday7-9pm. Dances, meetings, other activities etc.

title: Inwood Manor
description:
Tel. 633 4047. Head for the hills! Relax and enjoy the splendor of the

title: The Open Closet
description: No Phone Listing. from Southern Vermont Lesbians/Gay Men's Coalition

description:

description:

Women's Center

Tel. 325-2643.
'We offer legal, emotional and financial support to lesbian mothers undergoing custody

title: Ruth Roten

description:
Tel. 946 4357. A gay support for women and men.

GRAPEVINE the feminist support and social group for lesbians and their publication is

The Lost'N'Found

Camping is on the rugged side, so bring your own supplies. There is a shelter and water. Some goats. Hilly and wooded area. Some women stay for whole summer in tents and work.

notes: Unsure what to put at star type as there are two different choices for bar
